Hedge can help them offset inventory loss when commodity price fall./r/n 在商品价格下跌时，海琴能够帮助他们抵补存货价跌的损失。/r/n Some stores inventory their stock once a month./r/n 有些商店每月盘货一次。－/r/n
This is the inverse of his earlier proposition./r/n 这和他早些时候提的建议截然相反./r/n
The chairs were inverted on the table./r/n 椅子被倒置过来放在了桌子上。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．不可征服的，难以制服的
RECORD.lx: We have an invincible army./r/n 我们有一支不可战胜的军队。/r/n Our manager has an invincible will./r/n 我们的经理有着坚强的意志。/r/n
She showed me her gratitude by inviting me to dinner./r/n 她邀请我吃饭以表示她的感激。/r/n You are just inviting trouble if you do that./r/n 你那么做就是在自找麻烦。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．祈求，恳求，（法律的）实施生效．
RECORD.lx: They invoked help in the desperate situation./r/n 他们在走投无路的情况下恳求援助。/r/n The government has invoked the official secret act in having the book banned./r/n 政府援引国家机密保密法以禁该书。/r/n
A signed invoice presumes receipt of the shipment./r/n 经过签字的发票表示货物已经收到。/r/n The invoice was for 35 cif./r/n 发票为到岸价35英镑./r/n
The reporter is curious to know whether the official is involved in the case./r/n 这个记者很想知道那位官员是否涉及此案。/r/n She was quite positive about the amount of money involved./r/n 她对所涉及的钱数十分肯定./r/n
A tincture of iodine may be used medically./r/n 碘酒可以作为医药使用。/r/n The doctor painted iodine on the cut./r/n 医生在伤口上涂点碘酒。/r/n
Could you teach me how to adjust the iris of the camera?/r/n 你能教我怎么调照相机的光圈吗？/r/n Shaped like a sword, as the leaf of an iris./r/n 剑形的，如鸢尾属植物的叶子/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．反话，出人意料的事情或情况
RECORD.lx: That's really lovely, that is!' he said with heavy irony./r/n ｀那真是可爱极了, 真的!＇他故意说反话./r/n Do I detect a tinge of irony?/r/n 我觉得这话有点儿像反话吧?/r/n
Madness, an ironic fate for such a clear thinker./r/n 发疯，对这样一个思维清晰的人莫过于一种带有嘲弄意味的命运/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．无法抗拒的，无法抵抗的
RECORD.lx: His arguments were irresistible./r/n 他的论据是无法反驳的。/r/n It is so hot, our desire to swim in the pool is irresistible./r/n 天这么热，我们不禁要下去游泳。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．不能改变的，无法取消的
RECORD.lx: I am sorry to say the only term of payment we can accept is100% irrevocable documentary letter of credit./r/n 抱歉地说，我们能接受的付款条件只有100％不可撤销跟单信用证。/r/n The decision has been made and is irrevocable./r/n 木已成舟已作出决定，无法反悔/r/n
They are irrigating with water./r/n 他们正用水灌溉土地。/r/n We have irrigated the desert area to make it fertile./r/n 我们已经灌溉了荒芜地区使它肥沃。/r/n
His letter irritated me a little./r/n 他的信使我有点恼怒。/r/n Wool irritates my skin./r/n 毛织物会使我的皮肤过敏。/r/n
For the details of their itinerary, I am all to seek./r/n 关于他们的具体旅程，我毫无所知。/r/n This itinerary leaves us plenty of leeway./r/n 这个旅行计划给我们留有很多自由活动的余地./r/n
It's a collection of Chinese jade./r/n 这是收藏的一批中国玉器。/r/n This jade dragon is a genuine antique./r/n 这件玉龙是真正的古玩。/r/n
A jagged wound or cut./r/n 锯齿状的伤口或裂口/r/n
He is a school janitor./r/n 他是学校的门卫。/r/n The janitor is very conscientious./r/n 那个管理员很认真。/r/n

The special terminology understood among the members of a profession, discipline, or class but obscure to the general population; jargon./r/n 术语，行话在一个职业、学科或阶层的成员间能被理解的特殊术语，但对一般大众来说却晦涩难懂；专门术语/r/n The jargon of a particular group; cant./r/n 黑话，行话某一特殊团体的行话；黑话/r/n
He jeered at a defeated opponent./r/n 他嘲弄被击败的对手./r/n They jeered at the speaker./r/n 他们讥笑发言的人。/r/n

The security of the whole operation has been jeopardized by one careless person./r/n 整个作业的安全让一个粗心大意的人给破坏了./r/n If you are rude to the boss, it may jeopardize your chance of success./r/n 如果你对老板没有礼貌，那也许会危及你事业的成功。/r/n
The knife was stuck but she pulled it out with a jerk./r/n 那把刀子被卡住了，她猛地一拔，把它拔了出来。/r/n The bus jerked to a stop./r/n 公共汽车猛然刹车停住了。/r/n

The first-stage vehicle is used to launch the rocket and is then jettisoned in the upper atmosphere./r/n 第一级运载火箭是用来发射火箭的, 进入高层大气後即抛掉./r/n A ship jettisoning wastes; a pilot jettisoning aircraft fuel./r/n 一艘正在丢弃废物的船；一个正在抛弃飞机燃料的飞行员/r/n
The wagon jogged along on the rough road./r/n 马车沿着崎岖不平的道路颠簸前行。/r/n You jogged my elbow and spoiled what I was drawing./r/n 你撞到了我的手肘，弄坏了我正在画的图画。/r/n
It's time we jolly them up./r/n 是给他们鼓劲的时候了。/r/n They jollied the little girl into going with them./r/n 他们哄得那女孩跟他们一起去。/r/n
It's time we jolly them up./r/n 是给他们鼓劲的时候了。/r/n They jollied the little girl into going with them./r/n 他们哄得那女孩跟他们一起去。/r/n

The workers decided to take judicial proceedings against the company./r/n 工人们决定对公司正式提起诉讼。/r/n A court judgment, especially a judicial decision of the punishment to be inflicted on one adjudged guilty./r/n 判决法庭的判决，尤其指对已判决有罪的人加以处罚的法院的刑罚决定/r/n
Details of the accident were all jumbled up in his mind./r/n 该事故的详情在他头脑中已混在一起。/r/n There is a jumble of books and papers on the table./r/n 桌子上凌乱地堆着一堆书和报纸。/r/n
He wrote down to the juvenile readers./r/n 他为青少年读者写浅显的作品。/r/n Now she returned to the subject of juvenile delinquency in that country./r/n 现在她又回过来讲那个国家少年犯罪的问题。/r/n
The kangaroo is a native of Australia./r/n 袋鼠是产於澳洲的动物。/r/n An exceptionally swift kangaroo./r/n 行动极其敏捷的袋鼠/r/n
I think there is a kernel of truth in these otherwise frivolous comments./r/n 我认为在这些本来是无关紧要的评论中含有一定的真实性。/r/n The edible kernel of a nut./r/n 核仁坚果的可食的仁/r/n
Her eyes kindled with excitement./r/n 她的眼睛里闪耀出激动的神色。/r/n The moon kindled the countryside./r/n 月光照耀着郊外。/r/n

Soon Mr.Ho will install an iron gate across the side entrance to his10-by-4-foot stall, and then he says he will be able to sleep again. But just as he is saying this, a motorist opens a car door and bangs it against the back of the kiosk and the proprietor nearly jumps out of his skin./r/n 不久何先生就会在他的十尺长四尺宽的木屋的侧门前面装一个铁门。他说那样他就可以高枕无忧了。话犹未了，一个驾车人打开车门时，猛然撞到报亭后墙，吓得报亭主人几乎魂不附体。/r/n
She knelt down to pray./r/n 她跪下祈祷。/r/n Something, such as a stool, cushion, or board, on which to kneel./r/n 跪垫下跪时垫在膝下的东西，如跪凳、跪垫或跪板/r/n
She often knits while watching TV./r/n 她常常一边看电视一边织毛衣。/r/n I gave her a knitted shawl as a Christmas gift./r/n 我送给她一条编织的披肩作圣诞礼物。/r/n
One that raps or strikes, especially a door knocker./r/n 敲击者敲击或打击的人，尤指敲门者/r/n At the rat-a-tat of the knocker her heart fly into her mouth./r/n 听到敲击者咚咚声她的心都悬起来了。/r/n
Knowledgeable about or constituting all or many subjects; comprehensively broad./r/n 博学多才的关于或组成所有或许多学科知识的；包罗万象的广阔/r/n I do not respect him because he is knowledgeable./r/n 我并非因为他有学问而尊敬他。/r/n
He has a laborious style of writing./r/n 他的文笔不流畅。/r/n Laborious study or meditation./r/n 刻苦的学习勤奋的学习或思考/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．困难地做，太冗长地解释
RECORD.lx: You needn't labour a point that is perfectly plain./r/n 这点很明显，你用不着讲个没完。/r/n It takes a lot of labour to build a railway./r/n 修筑一条铁路要花费许多劳动力。/r/n
She wears a dress with delicate lace./r/n 她穿了一件带有精致花边的裙子。/r/n I always have troubles lacing these football boots./r/n 我给足球鞋穿鞋带时总是遇到麻烦。/r/n

A person of slavish or unquestioning obedience; a lackey./r/n 象奴隶般的人一个象奴隶一般顺从或无条件服从的人；卑躬屈膝者/r/n An accomplice or a lackey who aids in the commission of base or disreputable acts./r/n 同谋，同伙共犯或帮凶，其帮助实施无耻或下流的行为/r/n

Swedish director whose critically acclaimed films, such as The Silence(1963) and Fanny and Alexander(1983), are characterized by slow pace, laconic dialogue, and heavy use of symbolism to explore the psychological states of the characters./r/n 伯格曼，英马尔生于1918瑞典导演，其受到评论界赞扬的电影，如沉默（1963年）和芬尼和亚历山大（1983年），其特点是慢节奏、对话简洁和大量运用象征手法以揭示人物的心理状态/r/n
The kidnappers' lair was an old farm in the hills./r/n 绑架者的藏身处是一座山上的旧农场。/r/n
The new proposals affect both clergy and laity./r/n 新的建议与神职人员和俗人都有关系。/r/n
He deeply lamented the death of his wife./r/n 他对妻子的去世深感悲痛。/r/n Short pleasure, long lament./r/n 【谚】痛快一时，痛苦一世。/r/n
His death is a lamentable loss of our work./r/n 他的死对我们的工作来说是令人悲痛的损失。/r/n The decision they made is a lamentable lack of foresight./r/n 他们做的决定实在缺乏远见。/r/n
His cartoons mercilessly lampooned the leading politicians of the day./r/n 他的讽刺漫画无情地挖苦了当今的政界要人./r/n
The horseman aimed his lance at his quarry./r/n 骑手把长矛对准了他的猎物。/r/n Marvelous, Lance from usa have clock10 second to set a new100-meter world record./r/n 好极了，美国的兰斯用10秒的成绩刷新了100米世界纪录。/r/n
He speaks with a languid drawl./r/n 他慢吞吞拉着长调说话。/r/n I was angry with his languid movements./r/n 我被他那懒洋洋的动作激怒了。/r/n

After a lapse of several years he came back to see us./r/n 数年不见之后，他又回来看我们了。/r/n I started to eat the peas with my hands, but I don't think anyone noticed my little lapse./r/n 我开始用手吃豌豆，但我想没有人注意到我的小错误。/r/n
He only said it for a lark./r/n 他只是说着玩而已。/r/n She rose with the lark./r/n 她一大早就起床了。/r/n

A long, slender, flexible rod having a tuft or sponge at the end, used to remove foreign bodies from or apply medication to the larynx or esophagus./r/n 除鲠器，食管探子纤细而可弯曲的长圆棒，其一端有一小片海绵或毛撮，用来去除喉部或食管的外来异物或给喉部或食道上药/r/n
He lashed at his rival for dishonesty./r/n 他严厉斥责对手的欺诈行为。/r/n The cat lashed her tail./r/n 这只猫急速摇动着尾巴。/r/n
He was infected with a latent infection./r/n 他被感染了一种潜伏性的传染病。/r/n The manager did not find her latent abilities./r/n 经理没有发现她潜在的才能。/r/n
That lathe is used for shaping pieces of wood./r/n 那个车床是用来加工木材的。/r/n Do you know how to work a lathe?/r/n 你会开车床吗?/r/n
The new law allows firms a lot less latitude than before in fixing the price of their goods./r/n 新法律在允许各商行给产品定价的自由上比以前少得多了。/r/n The latitude of the island is 30 degrees north./r/n 这个岛的纬度是北纬三十度。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．（做篱笆或爬藤架等的）格子架
RECORD.lx: The space around the altar of a church for the clergy and sometimes the choir, often enclosed by a lattice or railing./r/n 教堂高坛教堂内圣坛周围供牧师有时也供唱师班用的通常围以格子或栅栏的高坛，/r/n A crystal defect caused by the absence of an atom, an ion, or a molecule in a crystal lattice./r/n 晶格空位在晶格里由于缺少一个原子、一个离子或一个分子造成晶格空位/r/n
All other laurels wither before hers./r/n 所有荣誉和她获得的相比都黯然失色。/r/n Our team won the regional laurels./r/n 我们的球队赢得了地区冠军。/r/n

It might be better for his reputation if he stopped writing and rested on his laurels./r/n 也许停止写作，安于现状会对他的声誉更好一点。/r/n New developments are forcing long-established firms to look to their laurels./r/n 新的发展使一些老牌企业也得小心行事才能保持声誉。/r/n
I've seen the stream of lava from a volcano./r/n 我见过火山喷发出的熔岩流。/r/n The volcano spewed molten lava./r/n 火山喷出了熔岩./r/n
She will never lave home; she is too tied to her mother's apron strings./r/n 她永远也离不开家；她太依赖她的母亲了。/r/n I lave done my duty./r/n 我已尽了我的责任。/r/n

The seeds of this plant, widely used as a mild bulk laxative and sometimes added to foods as a dietary source of soluble fiber./r/n 亚麻籽车前的籽这种植物的种子，作为温和的散装缓泻剂而被广泛使用，有时加在食物中作为可溶纤维的饮食上的来源/r/n An agent for purging the bowels, especially a laxative./r/n 泻药通肠的动力物质，尤指泻药/r/n
Layman is not a clergyman or a priest./r/n 普通信徒有别于教士和牧师。/r/n This book is written for professionals and laymen alike./r/n 这本书既可供专业人员阅读，又可供外行人看。/r/n

The act or process of leaching./r/n 过滤滤去的行为或过程/r/n The treatment of metal or the separation of metal from ores and ore concentrates by liquid processes, such as leaching, extraction, and precipitation./r/n 水冶金术通过液体过程，象过滤，提炼，沉淀等方法处理金属，从矿石中或矿石浓缩物中分离出金属/r/n
I pick up a leaflet about the care of teeth./r/n 我拿起一张宣传保护牙齿的传单。/r/n They distributed leaflets to customers./r/n 他们给客户散发传单。/r/n
The washer for preventing leakage is broken./r/n 那个防漏的垫圈坏了。/r/n
The trees leant in the wind./r/n 树在风中倾斜。/r/n The little girl only eats lean pork./r/n 这个小女孩只吃瘦肉。/r/n
We've taken a lease on an office building./r/n 我们已租了一幢办公楼。/r/n We will lease you the house for one year./r/n 我们将把这房子租给你一年。/r/n
These are the cultural legacies of the Renaissance./r/n 这些是文艺复兴时期的文化遗产。/r/n His weak chest was a legacy of a childhood illness./r/n 他那瘦弱的胸脯是儿时患病的后遗症。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．地图里的说明文字或图
RECORD.lx: The musician made the legend into a beautiful ballad./r/n 这位音乐家把传说编成了一首美丽的民谣。/r/n He is a legend in his lifetime for his scientific discoveries./r/n 他的科学发现使他一生成为传奇人物。/r/n
The inscription was still legible./r/n 铭文仍清晰可辨./r/n The sign was no longer legible because much of the lettering had worn away./r/n 这块招牌已看不清楚，因为大部分字已磨掉了。/r/n

The filmstar has a legion of admires./r/n 那个影星有一大群崇拜者。/r/n I know you want adventure and, be that as it may, the Foreign Legion is not as glamorous as it appears in the films./r/n 我知道你喜欢冒险，不过得想一想，“外国军团”并不像电影中出现的那样具有魅力。/r/n
It's impossible to legislate for every contingency./r/n 为每一偶发事件都立法是不可能的./r/n It is the jobof Parliament to legislate./r/n 立法是议会的工作./r/n
Do you know what is the legislature in China?/r/n 你知道中国的立法机关是哪个吗？/r/n The legislature has enacted a new liquor law, and he that runs may read./r/n 立法机关颁布了一项新的酒业法，措辞通俗易懂。/r/n
I'm not sure that his business is strictly legitimate./r/n 我说不好他的生意是否全部合法。/r/n The quality or fact of being legitimate./r/n 合法（性）成为合法的特征或事实/r/n
The problem was solved only after several lengthy discussions./r/n 那个问题几经长时间的讨论才得以解决./r/n Being or taking a roundabout, lengthy course./r/n 曲折的，迂回的处于或采用迂回的、冗长的途径/r/n
Lenient parents; lenient rules./r/n 仁慈的父母；宽松的规章制度/r/n In your case, we are prepared to be lenient./r/n 根据你的情况，我们拟予从宽处理/r/n
There were many people with leprosy around the age of thirty./r/n 在三十年代有很多麻疯病人。/r/n Leprosy is a kind of disease affecting the skin and nerves./r/n 麻疯病是一种影响皮肤和神经的疾病。/r/n

Loss of the ability to read, usually caused by brain lesions./r/n 读字不能，失读症通常由脑损伤引起的对阅读能力的丧失/r/n Characterized by the presence of small skin lesions that have the size and appearance of millet seeds./r/n 粟粒状的，粟粒性的以皮肤上出现粟粒大小和外形的小泡为特征的/r/n
The lessor can evict the lessee for failure to pay rent./r/n 出租人可驱逐不付租金的承租人。/r/n
Pot-holes can be lethal for the unwary cyclist./r/n 路上的坑坑洼洼骑车的人一不小心就有致命危险./r/n In situation like this, she wish she have a gun or some lethal weapon./r/n 在这种情况下，她真希望自己有一把枪或什么致命武器。/r/n

The same lethargy, I am afraid, characterizes the use of all our faculties and senses./r/n 恐怕，同倦的懒散也成为利用我们所有的本能和感觉的特点。/r/n He was jolted out of his lethargy and into action when he realized he had only a short time to finish the article./r/n 他意识到须在很短时间就得把文章写完, 立即动手写起来./r/n
The nation levied all able-bodied man for the war./r/n 国家征召所有壮丁参战。/r/n The government levies a fine against the factories for polluting the air with smoke./r/n 政府向以烟尘污染空气的工厂征收罚金。/r/n
A lexicon, vocabulary, or dictionary./r/n 字典辞典、词汇或字典/r/n The lexicon of surrealist art./r/n 超现实主义艺术的词汇/r/n
The judge exempted them from all liability in these matters./r/n 法官免除了他们在这些事上的所有责任和义务。/r/n Taking extra vitamins may reduce your liability to colds./r/n 多吃一些维生素会减少你得感冒的可能性。/r/n
He was not liable for his son's debts./r/n 他对自己儿子的债务没有责任偿还。/r/n We are liable to make mistakes./r/n 我们都易犯错误。/r/n
When does your driving licence expire?/r/n 你的驾驶执照何时到期?/r/n He is at last the proud possessor of a driving licence./r/n 他终于获得了驾驶执照，这使他颇为得意。/r/n
The workers saw off a limb from the tree./r/n 工人从树上锯下了一根大树枝。/r/n The section of the leg or hind limb between the knee and foot; shank./r/n 小腿，胫位于膝盖和脚之间的腿部或后肢的部位；胫/r/n
The commander ordered the troops to limber up and move out./r/n 指挥官下令把炮装上牵引车开出去。/r/n Having the ability to move with ease; limber./r/n 敏捷的能活动自如的；灵活的/r/n
Management kept her promotion in limbo for months./r/n 有好几个月领导将她的升迁之事放置一边/r/n I'm in limbo, waiting to know if I've got the job or not./r/n 我心神不定，等着知道是否已得到了那份工作。/r/n
A limousine carried us to the museum./r/n 一辆小型巴士载我们到博物馆。/r/n The hotel has a fleet of limousine to take guest to the airport./r/n 这家饭店拥有一个运送客人去机场的豪华车队。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．跛行 adj．无力的，松软的
RECORD.lx: He walks with a limp./r/n 他走路一瘸一拐。/r/n The injury left him with a permanent limp./r/n 他受伤後就一直瘸了./r/n
He bathed in many a limpid stream./r/n 他在许多清澈的溪流中沐浴。/r/n The stream is very limpid./r/n 溪流十分清澈。/r/n

A linear measure equal to5.50 yards or16.5 feet(5.03 meters); a rod./r/n 杆一种长度量单位，等于5。50码或16。5英尺（5。03米）；一杆/r/n The number of units of useful information contained within a linear dimension, usually expressed in units per inch./r/n 在一单位长度内包含的有用信息单位数。通常用每英寸多少单位表示。/r/n
The beautiful melody is lingering in my mind./r/n 美妙的音乐在我心中回荡。/r/n He lingered outside the school after everybody else had gone home./r/n 别人回家后，他仍在学校外面徘徊。/r/n
The beautiful melody is lingering in my mind./r/n 美妙的音乐在我心中回荡。/r/n He's no better, but he's lingering on by sheer will power./r/n 他毫无起色，但他全凭着意志力而继续活着。/r/n
Literary studies have been cross-fertilized by new ideas in linguistics./r/n 文学研究从语言学方面的新见解中受益良多./r/n He is engaged in studies in linguistics./r/n 他从事于语言学的研究。/r/n
Linoleum is made of canvas coated with linseed./r/n 油毡是由涂有亚麻油的帆布做成的。/r/n
Marilyn wanted to be loved, not lionized./r/n 玛里琳要的是爱而不是崇拜。/r/n
Hitler tried to liquidate the Jews in Germany./r/n 希特勒试图全部消灭德国的犹太人。/r/n
The firm went into voluntary liquidation./r/n 那家商号自动停业清算债务./r/n He lost all he possessed when his company was put into liquidation./r/n 当公司被清算结业时他失去了拥有的一切。/r/n
He appears to have drunk a lot of liquor./r/n 他似乎喝得醉醺醺的。/r/n The liquor is 80% proof./r/n 这种酒为标准度数的80%./r/n
He wrote down his name on the list./r/n 他将他的名字写在清单上。/r/n She complained about the omission of her name from the list./r/n 她抱怨名单上遗漏了她的名字。/r/n
A literal translation is not always the closest to the original meaning./r/n 逐字翻译不一定最接近原义。/r/n Don't be so literal-minded you know what I meant!/r/n 别那麽死心眼嘛－－你知道我是什麽意思。/r/n
Our cat has a litter of four kittens./r/n 我们家的猫一窝养了4只小猫。/r/n He was fined for littering on the sidewalks./r/n 他因在人行横道上乱扔杂物而被罚款。/r/n
He told a very lively story about his life in Africa./r/n 他非常生动地讲述了他在非洲的生活。/r/n She had a lively sense of humor./r/n 她幽默感很强。/r/n
Don't loaf away your time./r/n 别浪费你的时间。/r/n We loafed for hours in the park./r/n 我们在公园里闲逛了几个小时。/r/n
The anti-nuclear lobby is becoming stronger./r/n 向议员游说的反核群众声势渐强。/r/n I waited for her in the lobby of theatre yesterday./r/n 昨天我在戏院的大厅等她。/r/n
Lobsters turn scarlet when they are boiled./r/n 龙虾在被煮熟的时候会变红。/r/n Lobster has eight legs and two long claws./r/n 龙虾有八条腿两条爪子。/r/n
The director is looking for a suitable locale for his new film./r/n 导演在为新片物色合适的拍摄场地。/r/n
The steam locomotives were superseded by diesel units./r/n 蒸汽机车已被柴油内燃机车所取代。/r/n He is a locomotive engineer./r/n 他是一名火车司机。/r/n

A plane curve formed by the locus of points equidistant from a fixed line and a fixed point not on the line./r/n 抛物线到一固定直线和不在直线上某一固定点等距的点的轨迹所形成的平面曲线/r/n The taxpayer do not have locus stand in this court./r/n 该纳税人没有在法庭上的陈述权。/r/n
The locust swarm has destroyed all the crops and vegetables./r/n 蝗虫群毁坏了所有的庄稼和蔬菜。/r/n A locust is a kind of destructive insect./r/n 蝗虫是一种害虫。/r/n
He put the keys in the porter's lodge./r/n 他把钥匙放在了传达室。/r/n The bullet became lodged in her spine./r/n 那颗子弹嵌在她的脊椎骨里。/r/n
He has lofty ideals about life./r/n 他对人生抱有崇高的理想。/r/n She hate his lofty manner./r/n 她恨他那傲慢的举止。/r/n
Do you know how to log in to the system?/r/n 你知道怎么登录进入这个系统吗？/r/n The captain described the accident in the ship's log./r/n 船长在航海日志中描述了这次事故。/r/n
Next time don't loll out your tongue out./r/n 下次可别伸出舌头来嘲笑人了。/r/n Price cut inevitable as new crop available soon loll off until notice./r/n 新的谷物即将上市，价格降低在所难免，请稳住另候通知。/r/n
His longevity vexed his heirs./r/n 他的长寿令他的继承人们不快/r/n Proper rest and enough sleep contribute to longevity./r/n 适当的休息和足够的睡眠有益于长寿。/r/n

The town is at longitude 24 degrees east./r/n 这个镇位于东经二十四度。/r/n Nothing make the earth seem so spacious as to have friend at a distance; they make latitude and longitude./r/n 没有一件事情比得上有朋在远方更使这地球显得如此广大的了；他们构成纬度，也构成经度。/r/n
The convention looms as political battle./r/n 这场大会将是一场政治角斗。/r/n The mountainous island loomed on the horizon./r/n 那座巨大的岛屿隐隐约约浮现在地平线上。/r/n
Her wavy hair fell in loose wisps and loops upon her shoulders./r/n 她那一头波浪般的长发一簇簇一圈圈地散垂在肩上。/r/n The news of their marriage knocked me for a loop./r/n 他们结婚的消息使我大吃一惊。/r/n
She had the prize-winning lottery ticket./r/n 她抽到了得奖的彩票./r/n He scooped 1000 in the lottery./r/n 他在抽彩中捷足先登赢得1000英镑./r/n
Don't lounge around all day: do something!/r/n 别整天闲逛，做点事情吧！/r/n She is waiting for me in the departure lounge./r/n 她在候机室等我。/r/n

A lucrative income; a lucrative marketing strategy./r/n 一笔利润收入；一套赢利的市场策略/r/n I've been offered a lucrative contract in the States: it's only for six months but I might as well make hay while the sun shines./r/n 美国向我提供了一项有利的契约，时间仅6个月，但我也会抓住时机勿失良机的。/r/n
Gave only lukewarm support to the incumbent candidate./r/n 给在位的候选人不冷不热的支持/r/n Indifferent or lukewarm especially in matters of religion./r/n 淡漠的漠不关心或不热情的，尤指对宗教事务/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．蹒跚而行，笨拙地走n．杂物，累赘
RECORD.lx: The old car lumbered up the hill./r/n 那辆旧车摇摇晃晃地开上了小山。/r/n He has a lumber-mill./r/n 他有一个锯木厂。/r/n
There are many luminous road signs along the roads./r/n 沿着路有许多夜光路标。/r/n Giving off light; luminous./r/n 发光的散发光的；明亮的/r/n
The oatmeal lumps if you don't stir it well./r/n 如果你不好好搅拌，麦片粥会结块。/r/n The boys agreed to lump the expenses of their camping holiday./r/n 孩子们同意把露营费合在一起而不分彼此。/r/n
It's sheer lunacy driving in this weather./r/n 天气这麽坏还开车, 简直是疯了./r/n
The lunatic fringe are ignored by most members of the party./r/n 绝大部分党员对极端分子不予理睬。/r/n You're driving on the wrong side of the road, you lunatic!/r/n 你现在是逆行开车，你这个蠢材！/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．突然向前或旁边倒v．蹒跚而行
RECORD.lx: The bandit catch Bill, and Tom leave him in the lurch./r/n 歹徒抓住了比尔，而汤姆却把他弃之不顾。/r/n The enemy of human happiness is always lying at lurch./r/n 人类幸福的大敌总是伺机进行破坏的。/r/n
He left home because of the lures of the life in the city./r/n 由于受到城市生活的诱或，他离开了家。/r/n The enticement of the big city lure her away from her home./r/n 大城市的种种诱惑吸引了她离家出走。/r/n
The thief lurked in the shadows./r/n 小偷在阴暗处躲着。/r/n Danger lurked in the atmosphere./r/n 氛围中隐藏着危险。/r/n
She is a luscious blonde./r/n 她是个迷人的金发女郎。/r/n I like the luscious taste of ripe peaches./r/n 我喜欢熟桃的香甜味。/r/n
She is like a child lusting for toys./r/n 她像一个渴望玩具的小孩。/r/n His lust for power will never be satisfied./r/n 他的权力欲永不能得到满足。/r/n
He has a strong and lusty son./r/n 他有一个体格健壮精力充沛的儿子。/r/n A lusty cry./r/n 强有力的吼叫/r/n
His deeds add much lustre to his reputation./r/n 他的行为使他声誉大增。/r/n

The soft, thick, lustrous fur of this animal./r/n 貂皮这种动物的柔软、浓密且有光泽的毛皮/r/n A smooth, lustrous, variously colored deposit, chiefly calcium carbonate, formed around a grain of sand or other foreign matter in the shells of certain mollusks and valued as a gem./r/n 珍珠在几种软体动物的贝壳中，围绕着一粒沙子或其他外来物质形成的一种光滑、有色泽、具有不同颜色且主要是碳酸钙的沉积物，被珍视为宝石/r/n
There is luxuriant tropical vegetation in our country./r/n 我们国家有很多繁茂的热带植物。/r/n Luxuriant forests covered the hills./r/n 山上长满茂密的树林。/r/n
Your mackintosh looks better belted./r/n 你的雨衣系上带子更好看./r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．使人恼火的，令人气恼的
RECORD.lx: Her oscillations in mood are maddening./r/n 她喜怒无常能把人气疯。/r/n The box has spat forth maddening nine- second sound bite./r/n 电视机已经整整吐放了九秒钟令人疯狂的插播。/r/n
He worked as a magistrate after graduation./r/n 他毕业后任地方行政长官。/r/n The magistrate refused his bail./r/n 地方法官不准他保释。/r/n
He is a magnanimous person./r/n 他是个宽宏大量的人。/r/n He is a leader who is magnanimous in victory./r/n 他是个在胜利时宽宏大度的领袖。/r/n

A multimillionaire media magnate has shocked his employees with his candor by telling them all that he's putting his business affairs on hold to enter an alcoholism-counseling program./r/n 一位身份数百万的媒体大亨，坦诚地告诉他全体员工他将暂时搁置他的事业以便参加戒酒班，令员工大为惊愕。/r/n The list so settled it now a slate, unless some discontented magnate objects and threatens to withdraw. To do so is called"breaking the slate"./r/n 除非某个心怀不满的大亨加以反对并威胁要退出，这样决定下来的名单就成了人名单。如果出现反对或退出的行为，那就称为“撕毁候选人名单”。/r/n
He persuaded them to join him by the sheer magnetism of his personality./r/n 他完全是靠个人的魅力，说服他们和他在一起干。/r/n Magnetism produced by electric charge in motion./r/n 电磁性由运动电荷引起的磁性/r/n
The microscope magnified the object 100 times./r/n 这台显微镜将物体放大了100倍。/r/n This lens can magnify 20 diameter./r/n 这个透镜能放大20倍。/r/n
A photograph requiring magnification for viewing./r/n 微型照片放大后才看得清楚的照片/r/n An image that is too small to be read without magnification./r/n 一种需要经过放大才可阅读的微小图象。/r/n
The magnitude of the epidemic was frightening./r/n 这种流行病传播范围之广令人惶惶不安。/r/n You haven't realized the magnitude of her achievement./r/n 你没有认识到她这一成就的重大意义。/r/n
She survived the accident but she was maimed for life and will never walk again./r/n 她在意外事故中大难不死，但却终身残废，再也不能行走了。/r/n He was maimed in a First World War battle./r/n 他在第一次世界大战的一埸战斗中受伤致残./r/n
A crude or makeshift dwelling or shelter; a shack./r/n 简陋小屋，茅屋粗糙的临时住房或隐蔽处；棚屋/r/n A crude or makeshift bed./r/n 简易床简陋的或权作使用的床/r/n
His handling of the negotiations was maladroit./r/n 他的谈判技巧十分拙劣./r/n
All the trouble is being caused by a handful of malcontents./r/n 这些是非都是由一小撮不满分子搬弄的./r/n
All the trouble is being caused by a handful of malcontents./r/n 这些是非都是由一小撮不满分子搬弄的./r/n
Having or showing malice or ill will; malevolent./r/n 恶意的具有或表现出恶意或不良愿望的；含有恶意的/r/n The quality or state of being malevolent./r/n 恶毒处于邪恶的状态或具有恶毒的特征/r/n

Pertaining to the detection and isolation of a malfunction or mistake./r/n 用于修饰或说明与故障或错误的检测和隔离有关的特性。/r/n A procedure to terminate execution of a program when an unrecoverable error or malfunction occurs./r/n 异常结束当一种无法补救的错误或故障发生时中止计算机程序的运行/r/n
She certainly bears you no malice./r/n 她对你的确并无恶意。/r/n It seems so absurd to bear malice after all that./r/n 经过这一切之后还抱有怨恨情绪是很荒谬的。/r/n
He cares nothing about the malicious attack on his reputation./r/n 他对别人对他名声的恶毒攻击置之不理。/r/n To do her justice, she was never malicious./r/n 说句公道话, 她从来没有恶意。/r/n
A malign tumour was found in his stomach./r/n 在他的胃部发现了一个恶性肿瘤。 /r/n She likes to malign innocent persons./r/n 她爱诋毁那些清白的人。/r/n
The tumour is not malignant./r/n 这个瘤不是恶性的。/r/n It's a malignant slander to me./r/n 这对我是恶意的诽谤。/r/n
The young are more malleable than the old./r/n 年轻人比老年人容易受影响./r/n The malleable mind of the pragmatist./r/n 实用主义者那适应性很强的思想/r/n
A small mallet used by auctioneers./r/n 拍卖锤拍卖者所用的小锤/r/n The drummer was worried because his mallet was missing one minute before the concert./r/n 鼓手很著急，因为他的小音槌在音乐会开始前一分钟不见了。/r/n
Monkeys and dogs are mammals./r/n 猴子和狗都是哺乳动物。/r/n A whale is no less a mammal than a horse is./r/n 鲸鱼和马一样都是哺乳动物。/r/n
Our election victory has given us a mandate to reform the economy./r/n 我们在选举获胜, 这就使我们有权进行经济改革./r/n Britain was mandated to govern the former colony of German East Africa./r/n 英国受权代管德国在东非的前殖民地./r/n

It's mandatory to pay taxes./r/n 缴税是义务性的。/r/n The predetermined mandatory order, organization or position of symbols in a computer instruction, data or word, data transmission message, etc. The order is mandatory so that the computer can understand and interpret the information./r/n 对计算机的指令、数据或字以及数据传输所预先确定的且必须遵循的各种符号的次序、结构或位置。次序必须遵循，否则计算机不能理解和解释信息。/r/n
A maneuver, stratagem, or ploy, especially one used at an initial stage./r/n 策略尤指人在开始阶段所采用的计谋、策略、手法/r/n A maneuver causing someone to stumble or fall./r/n 绊使某人绊倒或跌倒的动作/r/n
The symphony was dreadfully mangled./r/n 那首交响乐曲给糟蹋得不成样子。/r/n There are many badly mangled bodies of those killed by the explosion./r/n 那有许多在爆炸中被炸得残缺不全的尸体。/r/n
He's maniacal about sex./r/n 他性欲旺盛./r/n
This riot is only one manifestation of people's discontent./r/n 这骚乱仅仅是人们不满的一种表露而已。/r/n His generosity manifests itself in times of need./r/n 他的慷慨在困境中表现了出来。/r/n
The uses of this machine are manifold./r/n 这台机器有多种用途。/r/n His interests are manifold./r/n 他的兴趣广泛。/r/n
He lives in Victoria Mansions./r/n 他住在维多利亚公寓。/r/n The poor girl was astonished by the sumptuous furnishings of the mansion./r/n 这个贫穷的女孩被大厦里的豪华的陈设惊呆了。/r/n
Snow mantled the hills./r/n 雪覆盖着丘陵。/r/n The mountain was covered with a mantle of snow./r/n 山上覆盖着一层雪。/r/n
I read his novel in manuscript./r/n 我看过他小说的手稿。/r/n The earliest extant manuscript of this poem has been kept in the museum./r/n 此诗现存最早的原稿收藏在这座博物馆里。/r/n
The maple leaf is the emblem of Canada./r/n 枫叶是加拿大的象征。/r/n The garden is flanked to the north with large maple trees./r/n 花园的北侧是一些高大的枫树./r/n
Age cannot mar her beauty./r/n 岁月无损于她的美貌。/r/n Such a mistake would mar your career./r/n 这种错误会有损你的事业。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．书页空白处的，不重要的
RECORD.lx: The marginal strip of beach; a marginal issue that had no bearing on the election results./r/n 边缘细长的海滩；和选举结果没有多大关系的边缘问题/r/n Barren or marginal farmland./r/n 荒芜或边远的农田/r/n
The rocks are covered by marine plants./r/n 岩石被海生植物所覆盖。/r/n The risk of breakage is covered by marine insurance, isn't it?/r/n 破碎险是包括在海洋运输货物险之内的，对吗？/r/n
There are more than 50 mariners on this ship./r/n 船上有五十多名水手。/r/n He recited the whole of The Ancient Mariner to us off the reel./r/n 他一口气把《古水手吟》从头到尾都背诵出来了。/r/n

Both partners now resent your interference; that's what you get when you fish in the troubled waters of marital strife./r/n 现在两方面都对你的干预不满，那是对你的婚姻冲突中趁火打劫的报应。/r/n Paranoia reigns supreme among the women, causing much marital conflict./r/n 偏执狂现象在妇女中很盛行，引起了许多婚姻纠纷。/r/n
It was so cold that he felt frozen to the marrow./r/n 天气太冷了，他感到寒冷刺骨。/r/n Come by the fire you must be chilled to the marrow!/r/n 到火旁边来吧－－你一定冻坏了。/r/n
It's dangerous to be alone in the marsh./r/n 一个人在沼泽地里是很危险的。/r/n Low, flat, swampy land; a bog or marsh./r/n 沼泽低平的沼泽地；泥塘或湿地/r/n
Pouches are a peculiarity of marsupials./r/n 腹袋是有袋动物的特色。/r/n
He is a martyr of his country./r/n 他为国捐躯。/r/n She died a martyr for liberty./r/n 她为自由而捐躯。/r/n
He mashed up the potatoes with a spoon./r/n 他用一把勺子把马铃薯捣成糊状。/r/n She loves sausage and mash./r/n 她喜欢香肠和土豆泥。/r/n
They did so under the mask of charity./r/n 他们是打着慈善的幌子这么做的。/r/n Her smile masked true feelings./r/n 她的微笑掩饰了她的感情。/r/n
He asked the mason to make him a tombstone./r/n 他要求这个石匠给他做一块墓碑。/r/n Miss Mason bought a beautiful car yesterday and must have spent a bomb thereby./r/n 梅森小姐昨天买了一辆非常漂亮的车，她一定花了一大笔钱。/r/n
I was hurt by a piece of falling masonry./r/n 我被掉下来的一块建筑用石块砸伤。/r/n The masonry is crumbling./r/n 石屋日渐崩溃。/r/n
We want to join in the masquerade./r/n 我们想去参加化装舞会。/r/n The robbers got into the bank by masquerading as security men./r/n 劫匪假装成保安人员进入银行。/r/n
The press has reported the massacre of thousands of people for their religious beliefs./r/n 新闻界报道了那场因宗教信仰原因而对千万人的大屠杀。/r/n The game was a complete massacre; we lost 10-0./r/n 那次比赛真是一次惨败，我们0比10输了。/r/n
The soldier suffered a massive haemorrhage and died soon after./r/n 那个战士经受了大量出血的痛苦，不久便去世了。/r/n The wedding got massive media coverage./r/n 婚礼得到大众传播媒介的广泛报道。/r/n
Flags were at half mast everywhere on the day of the president's funeral./r/n 总统葬礼那天，全国到处降半旗致哀。/r/n The tall man always wore his trousers at half mast./r/n 那高个子老是穿着一条长不及踝的裤子。/r/n

The bull forgot all about the matador and ran at the drunk who had wandered into the middle of the ring during a bullfight./r/n 公牛全然不顾斗牛士，向斗牛场中央的醉汉冲去，他是在斗牛比赛中糊里糊涂走进去的。/r/n Apparently sensitive to criticism, the bull forgot all about the matador and charged at the drunk./r/n 看来那公牛对挑衅很敏感，它完全撇开斗牛士，直奔醉汉而来。/r/n
The threatened strike never materialized./r/n 扬言要举行罢工, 却从未付诸行动./r/n Our plans did not materialize./r/n 我们的计画未能实现./r/n

A term sometimes applied to a stylus in a thermal matrix printer./r/n 有时用来指热敏点阵打印机的触针的一个术语。/r/n A matrix used in constructing a symbol or character image on a display screen./r/n 用来在显示屏幕上构造出一个符号或字符图象的一种点阵。/r/n
I'll go to buy a new mattress for my bed./r/n 我要去给我的床买个新床垫。/r/n The mattress was hard and unyielding./r/n 这床垫很硬, 没有弹性./r/n
Teenage is the period at which the body reaches maturity./r/n 青少年是身体成熟期。/r/n His experience has a slow maturity./r/n 他的经验缓慢地成熟。/r/n
He always becomes maudlin after he's had a few drinks./r/n 他喝了几杯酒后总是变得多愁善感。/r/n
Her novel has been badly mauled by the critics./r/n 她的小说横遭评论家抨击。/r/n Stop pulling my arm, you have no right to maul me about like this!/r/n 别拉我的胳膊，你没有权利这样粗暴地对待我！/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．独行者，想法与众不同的人
RECORD.lx: Politically, she's a bit of a maverick./r/n 在政治方面, 她有点自行其是./r/n
"Waste not, want not" is her favorite maxim./r/n “不浪费则不匮乏”是她特别喜爱的格言。/r/n Maxim seems to be particularly fond of her./r/n 马西姆似乎特别喜欢她。/r/n
There was absolute mayhem when the cow got into the village hall./r/n 那牛闯进村会议厅, 造成一片混乱./r/n
She was lost in the maze for several hours./r/n 她在迷宫中迷了路，浪费了好几个小时。/r/n We were quite disorientated by the maze of streets./r/n 街道曲曲弯弯的, 把我们弄得迷失了方向./r/n
There are many herds of cattle in the meadow./r/n 牧场上有许多牛群。/r/n The workers are scything in the meadow./r/n 工人们正在草地上割草。/r/n
He had to support his family with his meager income./r/n 他只能靠微薄的收入来养家。/r/n Particulars are too meager to form a decision./r/n 详情不明，难以做出裁夺。/r/n
The discussion meandered (on) for hours./r/n 讨论会漫无边际地进行了几小时./r/n
The child got measles./r/n 那个孩子得了麻疹。/r/n Measles is an infectious disease./r/n 麻疹是种传染病。/r/n
The force of the wind is measured on a standard scale of 0-12./r/n 风力是按0-12级标准等级测量的。/r/n We measured the difference(s) in temperature./r/n 我们测量了温度的变化./r/n
The soldier earned a medal for bravery./r/n 这名战士因作战勇敢而获得了勋章。/r/n The general pinned the medal on the soldier's chest./r/n 将军把奖章别在这位士兵的胸前。/r/n
Get rid of that meddlesome fool!/r/n 让那个爱管闲事的家伙走开。/r/n By this means the meddlesome woman cast in a bone between the wife and the husband./r/n 这爱管闲事的女人就用这种手段挑起他们夫妻这间的不和。/r/n
He cooled the situation down by offering to mediate between the disputing parties./r/n 他提出愿为争执的双方调停，情况因此缓和下来。/r/n Mediate a labor-management dispute./r/n 调停一劳动管理上的争端/r/n
Knighthood was an ideal in medieval Europe./r/n 在中世纪的欧洲，骑士是一种风范。/r/n Medieval painting is not his province./r/n 中世纪的绘画不属於他的研究范围./r/n
Of limited or average quality; mediocre./r/n 平凡的，普通的有限的或一般的性质的；普通的/r/n A casual or mediocre player of a sport, especially golf./r/n 漫不经心或平庸的运动员，尤指高尔夫球手/r/n
His plays are distinguished only by their stunning mediocrity./r/n 他的戏剧与众不同之处就是平凡得出奇./r/n Caricature is the tribute that mediocrity pays to genius./r/n 笨拙的模仿，是凡人对天才呈献的赞词。/r/n
You're very meditative today./r/n 你今天总在沉思。/r/n The society's evils are worth meditative./r/n 社会上的罪恶是值得思考的。/r/n
Sound travels through the medium of air./r/n 声音通过空气这一媒介传播。/r/n This cloth is of medium quality./r/n 这种布质量平平。/r/n
A usually humorous medley./r/n 幻想曲一段相当幽默的旋律/r/n
The dictator was suffering from megalomania./r/n 那独裁者患有夸大狂./r/n
When he left, she sank into melancholy./r/n 当他走后，她陷入沉思。/r/n A funeral is a melancholy occasion./r/n 葬礼是一个令人忧伤的场合。/r/n
I love Victorian melodrama(s)./r/n 我喜爱维多利亚时代的情节剧./r/n
Next the melody is taken up by flutes./r/n 这主调接着由长笛合奏。/r/n The organist played a famous melody./r/n 这位管风琴手演奏了一首著名的曲子。/r/n
She plays a melodious cello./r/n 她拉着一手悦耳的大提琴。/r/n This piece of music is melodious./r/n 这首音乐音调优美。/r/n
He picked a melon from the field./r/n 他从地里摘了一个甜瓜。/r/n If it were him, he would cut the melon with a word./r/n 换了他，一句话就可以把事情定下来。/r/n

A vibrating membrane in the ear helps to convey sounds to the brain./r/n 耳膜的振动帮助声音传送到大脑。/r/n The inward flow of a fluid through a permeable membrane toward a fluid of greater concentration./r/n 内渗透一种液体透过可渗透膜流向另一种浓度比它高的液体的内部流动/r/n

A prize or memento, such as a cup or plaque, received as a symbol of victory, especially in sports./r/n 奖品，奖杯（牌）尤指体育比赛中，作为胜利的象征而授予的奖品或纪念品，例如奖杯或奖牌/r/n Something given or kept; a memento./r/n 赠品赠给的或保存的东西；纪念品/r/n
He was often seen at funerals and memorials./r/n 人们经常在葬礼和追悼会上见到他。/r/n This memorial commemorates those who died in the war./r/n 这座纪念碑是纪念战争中牺牲者的./r/n
Your vicious dog is menacing my cat!/r/n 你那条恶狗对我家的猫太凶了！/r/n These weapons are a menace to world peace./r/n 这些武器是对世界和平的威胁。/r/n
One who performs menial tasks for another./r/n 仆人替别人做卑贱工作的人/r/n One who does menial work; a drudge./r/n 苦役干杂活的人；苦役/r/n
A priest who is one's spiritual mentor./r/n 神父作为某人精神导师的神父/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．唯利是图的 n．雇佣兵
RECORD.lx: His actions are entirely mercenary./r/n 他的行为完全是为了钱。/r/n Those mercenaries were hired to fight./r/n 那些雇佣兵被雇佣来打仗。/r/n
Their merchandise is of high quality./r/n 他们的货物质量很好。/r/n Among all the merchandise, I was interested in the cotton piece in particular./r/n 在所有商品中, 我对棉布特别感兴趣。/r/n
She has a mercurial turn of conversation./r/n 她谈话善转话锋./r/n A mercurial nature./r/n 反复无常的性格/r/n
The merest little thing makes him nervous./r/n 最微不足道的小事也会使他紧张。/r/n Don't scold him; he is a mere child./r/n 别责备他，他只不过是个孩子。/r/n
The bank merged with its major rival./r/n 该银行与其主要对手合并了。/r/n Where does this stream merge into the Rhine?/r/n 这条小河在什么地方与莱茵河合流？/r/n
Have you read the story of mermaids?/r/n 你看过关于美人鱼的故事吗？/r/n

The dosage was geared down to a level which would work on the infected cells but not upset their normal metabolism./r/n 药量已被减低到某一水平，既足以对付受感染的细胞，又不会干扰正常的新陈代谢。/r/n The complex of physical and chemical processes occurring within a living cell or organism that are necessary for the maintenance of life. In metabolism some substances are broken down to yield energy for vital processes while other substances, necessary for life, are synthesized./r/n 新陈代谢维持生命所必需的，发生于存活细胞中或生物体中的物理和化学过程的总和。在此过程中，一些物质被分解从而为生命过程提供能量，而另一些维持生命所必需的物质则被合成/r/n
She has a striking originality in her use of metaphor./r/n 她在运用隐喻方面有独创性。/r/n In poetry the rose is often a metaphor for love./r/n 玫瑰在诗中通常作为爱的象征。/r/n

The apparent celestial origin of a meteoric shower./r/n 流星群的辐射点明显的流星雨太空光源/r/n A tiny particle of meteoric dust, especially one of many that fall to the surface of the earth or moon./r/n 微陨星微小的陨星颗粒，特指大量坠向地球或月球表面的微陨星/r/n

Meticulous Japanese planners have tried to control everything from the weather to left-wing radicals to make sure the last rites for the87-year-old monarch come off without a hitch./r/n 无微不至负责筹划的日本人，已经试图掌握所有情况——从天气以至左翼极端分子——以确保87岁的天皇最后几个典礼圆满度过。/r/n
We can't see microscopic creature with naked eyes./r/n 我们不能用肉眼看到微生物。/r/n The doctor had a microscopic examination of traces of blood./r/n 医生用显微镜作了血迹检查。/r/n
Migrant workers move from city to city in search of work./r/n 流动工人为了寻找工作从一个城市移居到另一个城市。/r/n
Those roses have been ruined by mildew./r/n 那些玫瑰已经霉烂。/r/n Cog liable to mildew damage effect ins acidly./r/n 货物可能会发霉，请予以投保。/r/n

A belligerent person or a militant partisan./r/n 交战的人或好战的游击队队员/r/n One that believes in or follows the ideas of Marx and Engels, especially a militant Communist./r/n 马克思主义者马克思和恩格斯主义信仰者或追随者，尤指富于战斗精神的共产党员/r/n
The town miller was famous for his excellent flour./r/n 镇上的面粉场主以优质面粉著称。/r/n He used a miller to mill the grain into flour./r/n 他用碾磨机把谷物磨成面粉。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．模仿，戏弄，n．模仿他人言行的人
RECORD.lx: This parrot is an amazing mimic./r/n 这只鹦鹉很会学舌。/r/n He mimicked his uncle's voice and gestures perfectly./r/n 他把叔叔的声音和姿态模仿得惟妙惟肖。/r/n
I minced the lean meat finely before making dumplings./r/n 包饺子前，我把瘦肉细细剁碎。/r/n I won't mince words (with you): I think your plan is stupid./r/n 我不（跟你）兜圈子, 我认为你的计画是胡闹./r/n
He showed me the miniature of the mansion./r/n 他给我显示了大厦的模型。/r/n She is just like her mother in miniature./r/n 她简直是她母亲的缩影。/r/n
They are the dictator and his minions./r/n 他们就是那个独裁者和他的奴仆。/r/n Can you send one of your minions to collect this file?/r/n 你能不能派个助手来取这份档案？/r/n
These criminals arrested by the police are only minnows, their leader has escaped./r/n 这些被警察抓住的犯罪分子只是些小鱼，他们的头子却跑掉了。/r/n
A French peasant dance resembling the minuet./r/n 加伏特舞一种法国农民的舞蹈，类似于小步舞/r/n The music for or in the rhythm of the minuet./r/n 米奴哀舞曲为米奴哀舞而写的舞曲或米奴哀舞节奏的舞蹈/r/n
A mirage is an optical illusion./r/n 海市蜃楼是一种视错觉./r/n The heat reflected from the white sand formed a mirage./r/n 热气经白色的沙面反射形成了蜃景./r/n
The most brilliant person may be mired in detail and confusion./r/n 即使是最聪明的人也会陷入琐事与混乱之中。/r/n My car was mired./r/n 我的车上溅满污泥。/r/n
Christmas is a time of mirth, especially for children./r/n 圣诞节是个快乐的日子，尤其是对孩子们。/r/n When I told them what had happened to me, they all chortled with mirth./r/n 我把我的事告诉他们以後, 他们咯咯地笑起来了./r/n
The show was a miscellany of song and dance./r/n 那场演出是又有歌曲又有舞蹈的混合表演./r/n
He likes to have miscellaneous collection./r/n 他喜欢多种多样的收集。/r/n The miscellaneous expenses of import are so much!/r/n 进口货物的杂费太多了！/r/n
One expects active children to be mischievous at times./r/n 活泼的孩子有时是会淘气的。/r/n Mischievous, teasing, or annoying./r/n 有害的、调皮的或打搅/r/n
You have completely misconstrued me/my words/what I said./r/n 你完全误解了我[我的话/我的意思]了./r/n

Tell your mother you have arrived here without mishap./r/n 告诉你母亲你已经平平安安到达这里。/r/n He hurt his knee during the football match, but this mishap didn't stop him from playing./r/n 足球比赛时他伤了膝盖，可他并没有因此中途退出。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．投射出的物体或武器，导弹
RECORD.lx: The huge ship was sunk by a homing missile./r/n 这只巨大的军舰被一枚自动寻的导弹击中。/r/n Demonstrators attacked the police, using sticks and assorted missiles./r/n 示威者用棍棒和各种投掷物攻击警察。/r/n
The mists was fleeing before the rising sun./r/n 太阳慢慢升起，薄雾渐渐消失。/r/n We watched the mists ascending from the valley below./r/n 我们看著薄雾从下面的山谷中升起./r/n
I offer a mite of comfort to him./r/n 我给了他一点安慰。/r/n Poor little mite!/r/n 可怜的小家伙！/r/n
The government is trying to mitigate the effects of inflation./r/n 政府正试图缓和通货膨胀的影响。/r/n Her words mitigated my suffering./r/n 她的话减轻了我的痛苦。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．（四指套在一起姆指分开的）手套
RECORD.lx: In winter she wears mittens./r/n 冬天时她戴连指手套。/r/n The part of a glove or mitten that covers the palm of the hand./r/n （手套的）掌份覆盖手掌的物体或手套的一部分/r/n
A COBOL mnemonic name associated with the console typewriter./r/n 和控制台打字机有关的一种COBOL助记忆名。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．n．（痛苦的）呻吟，（不满的）抱怨
RECORD.lx: What is he moaning about?/r/n 他在发什么牢骚？/r/n He moaned about his misfortunes to anyone who would listen./r/n 他向每一个愿意听的人抱怨他的不幸。/r/n
There is a moat round the castle./r/n 城堡外环绕着一条护城河。/r/n The medieval town was fortified with a high wall and a deep moat./r/n 这座中世纪的城市周围建有城墙和护城河。/r/n
The army training exercises ended with a mock battle./r/n 军事训练演习以一场模拟战结束。/r/n We should not mock at other people's religious beliefs./r/n 我们不应该嘲笑别人的宗教信仰。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．不过份的，有节制的 v．减轻，节制
RECORD.lx: He usually drives at a moderate speed./r/n 他通常中速驾驶。/r/n The wind was strong all day, but it moderated after sunset./r/n 风猛烈地刮了一整天后，日落后变小了。/r/n
"If he had a modicum of sense, he wouldn't do such a foolish thing."/r/n ＂要是他稍有一点理智，他决不会做出如此愚蠢的事来。＂/r/n
The union has been forced to slightly modify its position./r/n 工会被迫稍稍改变立场。/r/n The policy was agreed by the committee, but only in a modified form./r/n 那项政策经修改后才获得委员会同意。/r/n
Persistent modification of behavior resulting from an animal's experience./r/n 行为的修正由动物过去的经历导致的保持终生的行为修正/r/n Automatic modification of the index register./r/n 自动修改变址寄存器内容。/r/n

A device used to modulate an electromagnetic wave./r/n 调制器用以调制电磁波的装置/r/n Music students learn how to add other parts to add other parts to a given tune, and how to modulate to a related key./r/n 音乐学生学习给一个现有的调子配上其他音部，还要学习怎样转成和声调。/r/n
A region of western India bordering on the Arabian Sea. An independent kingdom after1401, it was annexed by the Mogul Empire in1572./r/n 古吉拉特印度西部一地区，与阿拉伯海相邻。1401年后成为一独立的王国，1572年被强行并入莫卧帝国/r/n
The elephant grinds its food with/between its powerful molars./r/n 象用其强有力的臼齿嚼碎食物./r/n
The dog that molested the sheep was killed./r/n 那只骚扰绵羊的狗被杀死了。/r/n Cares do still their thoughts molest, and still the unhappy poet's breast./r/n 烦忧仍然困扰诗人的思绪，诗人郁闷的胸膛。/r/n
He tried to find ways of mollifying her./r/n 他想方设法安慰她./r/n

An animal, such as an insect or a mollusk, that lacks a backbone or spinal column./r/n 无脊椎动物缺少脊骨或脊柱的动物，例如昆虫或软体动物/r/n The pearly internal layer of certain mollusk shells, used to make decorative objects./r/n 珠母层某些软体动物壳内似珍珠的层，用来做装饰物/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．过份爱惜，娇惯 n．娇生惯养的人
RECORD.lx: He doesn't believe that children should be mollycoddled./r/n 他认为不应溺爱儿童./r/n
She hesitated in momentary confusion./r/n 她一时思想紊乱，犹豫不定。/r/n Giving a momentary or superficial impression of brilliance./r/n 闪烁的，炫耀的给人以短暂或表面印象的光彩或才华的/r/n
History bears evidence that each momentous political change is usually followed by an economic revival./r/n 历史证明，在每次重大的政治变革之后随之而来的往往是经济上的复兴。/r/n
As the rock rolled down the mountainside, it gathered momentum./r/n 石头滚下山时，它的动量增加。/r/n The struggle for independence is gaining momentum every day./r/n 为独立而斗争的势头日益增长。/r/n
They attempted to overthrow the monarch./r/n 他们企图推翻国王。/r/n The monarch as head of state./r/n 国王作为国家元首的君主/r/n

The monks live in a large monastery./r/n 这些修道士居住在一个大修道院里。/r/n The only regular visitors to the monastery in winter are parties of skiers who go there at Christmas and Easter./r/n 冬季到修道院来的常客只是几批滑雪者，他们通常在圣旦节和复活节去那里。/r/n
A dog considered to be inferior or undesirable; a mongrel./r/n 劣等狗一种被视为低劣的或不受欢迎的狗；杂种狗/r/n
A tall, four-sided shaft of stone, usually tapered and monolithic, that rises to a point./r/n 方尖石碑升到一点的四面体高塔或碑石，常为尖顶和由整块石料的/r/n A monolithic sculpture./r/n 独块巨石雕塑/r/n
He writes dialogue by cut monologue in two./r/n 他把独白切成两截来写对白。/r/n
He seems to think he has a monopoly of brains./r/n 他似乎认为只有他才聪明。/r/n The telecommunication service is a government monopoly./r/n 电信为政府专营。/r/n
I only heard a monotonous voice of the singer./r/n 我只听到那个歌唱家单调的声音。/r/n The explorer live on a monotonous diet of bean and rice./r/n 探险者靠吃豆子和米饭这些单调的食物为生。/r/n
The ship beat back against a monsoon./r/n 船逆着季风艰难地行驶。/r/n Heavy rains occur during a summer monsoon./r/n 暴雨出现在一个夏季季风期/r/n
Dinosaurs are monsters./r/n 恐龙是种巨兽。/r/n This machine is a real monster./r/n 这台机器真是个庞然大物。/r/n

The tree planted by the magician quickly grew to a monstrous height./r/n 魔术师种下的树很快就长得极其高大。/r/n The modern city consists of monstrous edifices and of dark narrow streets full of petrol fumes, coal dust, and toxic gases./r/n 现代城市是由大得怕人的大厦和充斥着难闻的汽油味，煤灰和有毒气体和又阴暗又狭窄的街道所组成。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．旷野地，荒野 v．使（船）停泊
RECORD.lx: He used to go for long walks on the moors./r/n 他过去时常在荒野上长时间地散步。/r/n The search party spread out over the moor./r/n 搜索队在荒草地分散行动./r/n
He's been moping around (the house) all day./r/n 他整天都在（房子）周围瞎转悠./r/n Stop moping!/r/n 别那麽垂头丧气的!/r/n
They bolstered their morale by singing./r/n 他们以唱歌来鼓舞士气。/r/n They sang songs to keep their morale up./r/n 他们唱 歌以保持高昂的士气./r/n
She always has a morbid imagination./r/n 她总在做病态的想像。/r/n Don't be so morbid!/r/n 别尽往坏处想！/r/n
There are more than 5,000 adjectives in that dictionary./r/n 那本词典中有5000多个形容词。/r/n Pupils with 90% or more are awarded Grade A./r/n 满90分的学生评为甲等./r/n
Moribund customs; a moribund way of life./r/n 过时的风俗；过时的生活方式/r/n
They're a load of morons./r/n 他们是一群笨蛋./r/n He's an absolute moron!/r/n 他纯粹是个傻子!/r/n
One easy, although unkind, way of dealing with two morose teenagers is to play one off against the other./r/n 有一个简单然而有点冷酷的方法来对付这两个难处的青年——记他们互相争斗你从中得利。/r/n
He wouldn't do such silly things if he had a morsel of sense./r/n 他要是有一点常识的话，就不会干这种傻事。/r/n Between the cup and the lip a morsel may slip./r/n [谚]吃到嘴里才算是你的。/r/n
The army was fired by mortars./r/n 军队被迫击炮攻击。/r/n Put your money into bricks and mortar./r/n 用你的钱去买房子吧。/r/n
The army was fired by mortars./r/n 军队被迫击炮攻击。/r/n Put your money into bricks and mortar./r/n 用你的钱去买房子吧。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．抵押贷款，抵押证书v．抵押
RECORD.lx: He will have to mortgage his land for a loan./r/n 他不得不将土地抵押来申请贷款。/r/n Paying my mortgage was an enormous weight off my mind!/r/n 我还了抵押借款, 如释重负!/r/n
He felt mortified for his mistake./r/n 他对他的错深感羞愧./r/n The knowledge of future evils mortified the present felicities./r/n 对未来苦难的了解压抑了目前的喜悦。/r/n
It is our nation's mortification./r/n 这是我们国家的耻辱。/r/n To his mortification, he was criticized by the manager./r/n 他被经理批评，感到很难堪。/r/n
It's a rich mosaic of meadows, rivers and woods./r/n 这是一幅由草地，河流，树木组成的五光十色的镶嵌画。/r/n The sky this morning was a mosaic of blue and white./r/n 今天早上的天空是幅蓝白相间的画面。/r/n
A motif in art, literature, or music./r/n 主题艺术、文学或者音乐的主题/r/n A rectangular column with a capital and base, set into a wall as an ornamental motif./r/n 壁柱，半露柱有柱顶和底座的长方形柱子，作为装饰图案置入墙内/r/n
Attribution of human motivation, characteristics, or behavior to inanimate objects, animals, or natural phenomena./r/n 拟人论，拟人观赋予无生命的物体，动物或自然现象以人的动机，特征或行动/r/n
They are wearing a motley collection of old clothes./r/n 他们穿着各式各样的旧衣服。/r/n They were a motley crew./r/n 这帮人成份混杂。/r/n
Iron utensils with a mottled enamel resembling granite./r/n 单涂搪瓷器皿表面涂以搪瓷使外观象花岗岩的铁制品/r/n
"Think before you act" is my motto./r/n “三思而后行”是我的座右铭。/r/n I often win money at cards but never save a penny `easy come, easy go' is my motto./r/n 我玩纸牌经常赢, 可一分钱也存不住--我的俗话是｀来得容易, 去得快＇./r/n
Bread tends to mould in damp weather./r/n 气候潮湿时，面包容易长霉。/r/n The car body is moulded in the factory./r/n 汽车车身是在这家工厂里模压成型的。/r/n
The old woman still mourns for her son./r/n 这位老太太还在为儿子的死伤心。/r/n People wore crapes to mourn our leader./r/n 人们戴着黑纱哀悼我们的领导。/r/n
He looks mournful./r/n 他看上去神色悲哀。/r/n He took a mournful view on human affairs./r/n 他对人世持悲观的态度。/r/n

The Trade Union Movement works to obtain higher wages and better conditions./r/n 工会运动旨在争取更高的工资和更好的工作条件。/r/n The resistance movement started a campaign of terror against the colonial rulers./r/n 抵抗运动开展了一场反对殖民统治者的恐怖活动。/r/n
I muddled (up) the dates and arrived three days late./r/n 我把日期弄乱了, 所以迟到了三天./r/n You must be muddling me up with my twin brother./r/n 你一定是把我看成我的孪生兄弟了./r/n
We muffled the oars to stop them splashing noisily./r/n 我们裹住船浆以减小溅水声。/r/n He walked out into the snow, heavily muffled up in a thick scarf and warm overcoat./r/n 他雪天出门，裹着厚厚的围巾，穿着暖和的大衣。/r/n
The multitude may laugh at his music, but we know better./r/n 一般人也许会嘲笑他的音乐，但我们更了解它。/r/n A multitude of people gathered at the gate of the exhibition hall./r/n 大群人聚集在展览大厅的门口。/r/n
There was a low murmur of conversation in the hall./r/n 大厅里有窃窃私语声。/r/n The murmur swelled into a roar./r/n 窃窃私语的声音变大形成一片喧哗。/r/n
The young girl was lost in a muse./r/n 这女孩陷入了沉思。/r/n She lay musing for a while./r/n 她躺着沉思了一会儿。/r/n
The troops mustered on the hill./r/n 部队在小山上集合。/r/n He mustered all his courage to take part in the game./r/n 他鼓起全部的勇气参加比赛。/r/n
Our teacher has mutation of sounds suddenly./r/n 我们的老师突然语音发生了变化。/r/n The mutations in plants caused by radiation have been found in experiments./r/n 放射线引起植物变异已在实验中被证实。/r/n
He's mute on the subject of social system./r/n 他对社会制度的问题保持沉默。/r/n He's a deaf mute and cannot tell anyone secret./r/n 他是个聋哑人，不会把他们的秘密告诉任何人。/r/n
People like to have mutton in the winter./r/n 冬天人们喜欢吃羊肉。/r/n A leg of mutton, lamb, or veal for cooking./r/n 羊腿做烹调用的羊肉、小羊或小牛的一只腿/r/n
A myriad of thoughts passed through her mind./r/n 无数想法划过她的心头。/r/n The myriad fish in the ocean./r/n 海洋中数不胜数的鱼/r/n
A being in folklore or myth similar to one of these beings./r/n 巨人民间传说或神话中与以上的人种相似的人/r/n The rich uncle of whom he boasts is only a myth./r/n 他吹嘘的那个有钱的叔叔只是个乌有翁。/r/n
It is a mythology about the king./r/n 这是个关于国王的神话。/r/n The book is about the mythologies of primitive races./r/n 这本书是原始民族神话集。/r/n
Some children complain that their parents nag at them./r/n 一些孩子报怨他们父母老是数落他们。/r/n Don't nag me!/r/n 别在我面前唠叨！/r/n
Father always takes a nap in the afternoon./r/n 父亲下午总要睡个午觉。/r/n The nap is worn./r/n 细毛磨损了。/r/n
Narcotics are a major threat to health./r/n 毒品是危害健康的大敌。/r/n Stupor induced by a narcotic./r/n 麻醉性昏睡麻醉药引起的昏迷状态/r/n
He sprayed some nasal spray into the nose to make breathing easier./r/n 他往鼻子里喷了些鼻雾喷剂，让呼吸畅通些。/r/n He talked to me with a nasal voice./r/n 他带着鼻音和我说话。/r/n
The baby's nativity brought them great pleasure./r/n 孩子的诞生给他们带来了巨大的欢乐。/r/n
Experiencing nausea; nauseated./r/n 感到反胃的；恶心的/r/n A feeling of unease or mild nausea caused especially by fearful anticipation./r/n 因害怕而发抖特别是由于可怕的预感而引起的不适感觉或轻度的恶心呕吐/r/n
The idea of eating raw shellfish nauseates me./r/n 我一想到吃生贝就恶心./r/n
People gathered in the nave of the house./r/n 人们聚拢在房子的中间。/r/n If I made big money, you would nave a cut of the cake./r/n 我要是赚了大钱的话，少不了有你的一份。/r/n
You can see nebulae in the clear summer sky./r/n 在晴朗的夏夜可以看到天上的星云。/r/n
Nebulous assurances of future cooperation./r/n 对未来合作的含糊的保证/r/n
The road looks beautiful covered by golden pine needles./r/n 这条路上铺满了金黄色的松针，看上去美极了。/r/n She tried to needle me into losing my temper./r/n 她想方设法惹我发脾气。/r/n
These facts negate your theory./r/n 这些事实否定了你的理论./r/n How can you negate God?/r/n 你怎麽能否定上帝的存在?/r/n
This theory is a negation of all traditional beliefs./r/n 这理论否定了一切传统信念./r/n Shaking the head is a sign of negation./r/n 摇头表示否认./r/n
The accident was due to her negligence./r/n 这次事故是因她疏忽所致。/r/n His negligence was nothing less than criminal./r/n 他的粗心大意无异於犯罪./r/n
The risks were represented as negligible./r/n 把这麽冒险的事说得微不足道./r/n The damage to my car is negligible./r/n 我的汽车的损坏是极轻微的。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．可商量的，（支票）可兑现的
RECORD.lx: The road is only negotiable in the dry season./r/n 这条道只有在旱季才能通行。/r/n He says his claim is not negotiable./r/n 他说他的要求是不容讨价还价的。/r/n
A stone implement of the Neolithic Period./r/n 新石器新石器时代的石头器具/r/n
She caught up a popular neologism from the newspapers./r/n 她急忙采用了报刊上流行的一种新词语。/r/n I don't think these neologisms worth passing on to beginners./r/n 我认为这些新词不值得教给初学者。/r/n
A neophyte at politics./r/n 初涉政界的人/r/n
The knife fell from her nerveless fingers./r/n 刀子从她那无力的手中落下./r/n
I nestled down on the big sofa and began to read novels./r/n 我舒适地靠在大沙发上，开始看小说。/r/n The egg nestled in the long grass./r/n 蛋隐藏在高草中./r/n
The little girl is nestling closely up to her mother./r/n 小女孩紧紧地偎依在她妈妈身边。/r/n I nestled down on the big sofa and began to read novels./r/n 我舒适地靠在大沙发上，开始看小说。/r/n
Nettle is a kind of common wild plant./r/n 荨麻是一种普通的野生植物。/r/n It was clear that my remarks nettled her./r/n 显然，我的言语激怒了她。/r/n
He is a bit neurotic, but his wife is a very stable person./r/n 他有点神经质，但他的妻子是一个非常稳重的人。/r/n Neurotic about punctuality./r/n 过敏性的神经官能症的/r/n
When you start the engine, be sure the car is in neutral./r/n 你在发动引擎时，一定要让汽车处于空档。/r/n That country remained neutral in the war./r/n 那个国家在那场战争中保持中立。/r/n

I am doing an experiment of neutralizing acid./r/n 我在做一个中和酸的实验。/r/n A protein substance produced in the blood or tissues in response to a specific antigen, such as a bacterium or a toxin. Antibodies destroy or weaken bacteria and neutralize organic poisons, thus forming the basis of immunity./r/n 抗体，免疫体血液或组织针对某种抗原如细菌或毒素而产生的蛋白质物质。抗体消灭细菌或削弱其作用，中和有机毒素，因而形成免疫力/r/n
Food and rent nibbled away at the money they had saved./r/n 花在食物和房租上的钱把他们的积蓄一点一点耗掉了。/r/n The mice have nibbled a hole in the cheese./r/n 老鼠在奶酪上啃出了一个洞。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．（放艺术品等的）壁龛，合适的位置
RECORD.lx: He found the right niche for himself./r/n 他发现了一个适合他的职位。/r/n Claude was probably a humbug, whose vanity, ambition, and intelligence led him to carve out a niche as the wickedest man in the world; there is always room for a sadist at the top./r/n 克劳德或许不过是个骗子，他的虚荣、野心和才智使他在世上恶人中争得魁首之名：有残忍癖，总能爬上顶端。/r/n
Smokers who inhale are likely to become addicted to nicotine./r/n 吸烟的人容易对尼古丁上瘾./r/n
The niggard contributed little to them./r/n 这个吝啬鬼几乎就没捐钱给他们。/r/n Don't expect that niggard to invite you to dinner./r/n 别指望那个吝啬鬼会请你吃饭。/r/n
Giving or spending money grudgingly; niggardly./r/n 吝啬的给予或花钱吝啬的；小气的/r/n
Stop niggling about every penny we spend./r/n 别再为我们花的每个小钱费心思了./r/n A pointless dispute over niggling details./r/n 在琐碎小事上的一次无礼争吵/r/n
I have nightmares about falling off a cliff./r/n 我常做恶梦梦见从悬崖上摔下来。/r/n The nightmare gave her the creeps./r/n 那场恶梦使她不寒而栗。/r/n
She knitted a pair of mittens for me with her nimble fingers./r/n 她用灵巧的双手为我织了一副手套。/r/n Characterized by quickness, lightness, and ease of movement; nimble./r/n 敏捷的，灵活的具有迅速、轻巧和易动特点的；灵活的/r/n
The cold wind nipped at her face./r/n 刺骨的寒风吹在她的脸上。/r/n The dog was nipping at her ankles./r/n 那狗咬著她的脚腕子了./r/n
He can't understand a general argument, he always asks nitpicking little questions./r/n 他不能理解总的论点，总是问一些无关紧要的枝节问题。/r/n
The chairman is only the nominal ruler of the country./r/n 主席只是那个国家名义上的统治者。/r/n She charged only a nominal fee for her work./r/n 她为所做的工作只收取象征性的费用。/r/n
His nomination as chief executive was approved by the board./r/n 他被提名为行政总裁的事被董事会批准了。/r/n Who will get the nomination for president?/r/n 谁将获得总统提名？/r/n

Holding the view that the ego is the center, object, and norm of all experience./r/n 自我中心的认为自我是所有的中心、对象和经验的标准的/r/n Criminal behaviour seem to be the norm in this neighbourhood./r/n 犯罪行为似乎是这一带的正常现象。/r/n
Her work is pervaded by nostalgia for a past age./r/n 她的作品充满了怀旧之情。/r/n The sight inspired him with nostalgia./r/n 这景象激起了他的怀旧之情。/r/n
I cut a notch in a stick./r/n 我在一根棍子上刻了一个V字形。/r/n With this performance, she has notched up her third championship title./r/n 她因这一成绩而获得第三个冠军称号。/r/n
We'll notify her to draw up a contract./r/n 我们将通知她起草一份合同。/r/n She notified us of the meeting./r/n 她通知我们开会。/r/n
Hitler is a notorious killer./r/n 希特勒是一个臭名昭著的刽子手。/r/n The notorious thief will be put up for trial next week./r/n 那个臭名昭著的偷窃犯将于下周出庭受审。/r/n
The novelty of his surroundings soon wore off./r/n 他对环境的新奇感不久就淡薄了。/r/n The author seems to strain after novelty./r/n 作者似乎在力图标新立异。/r/n
She's a complete novice as a reporter./r/n 她初任记者，完全是个生手。/r/n A novice or learner, particularly in newspaper reporting./r/n 生手，新手新手或初学者，尤指报纸报导中的新手/r/n
Noxious chemical wastes./r/n 有毒化学废弃物/r/n Chemicals that produce a noxious vapor when mixed./r/n 化学物质混合后会放出有毒气体/r/n
A rich artistic performance, full of nuance./r/n 一场意味深长的艺术表演充满了微妙之处/r/n
How can we nullify the enemy's propaganda?/r/n 怎样才能抵销敌人的宣传?/r/n The state of being nullified./r/n 取消被取消的状态/r/n
The shock left me numb./r/n 我惊呆了。/r/n His leg was numbed by the intense pain./r/n 他的腿因剧痛而麻木。/r/n
The door is made of oak./r/n 这门是橡木做的。/r/n There are many acorns on the oak tree./r/n 这棵橡树上有很多橡子。/r/n
Many people tried to get their oars in./r/n 许多人都想插一手。/r/n The blade of an oar or paddle./r/n 桨面桨或橹的叶片/r/n
The caravan stopped for the night at an oasis./r/n 旅行队在沙漠中的绿洲停下来过夜。/r/n Her bedroom is an oasis of calm in the noisy house./r/n 她的卧室是这座嘈杂房屋中一个难得的安静之处。/r/n
Repeat the oath after me./r/n 请跟着我宣誓。/r/n The judge reminded the witness that she was under oath./r/n 法官提醒那个证人她已经宣过誓了。/r/n
The dog is obedient to its master's orders./r/n 这只狗听从主人的命令。/r/n My brother is an obedient boy./r/n 我弟弟是一个听话的男孩。/r/n

Obesity is a problem for many people in western countries./r/n 西方国家很多人都有过度肥胖的问题./r/n The branch of medicine that deals with the causes, prevention, and treatment of obesity./r/n 肥胖症学研究肥胖的原因、预防和治疗的医学的分支/r/n
There is no objection to your opening the window./r/n 你开窗没有什么不可以的。/r/n The chief objection to this book is its great length./r/n 这本书的主要缺点是过于冗长。/r/n
The company has to fulfill the terms of its obligation./r/n 这个公司必须履行合同条款。/r/n Damaging the goods puts you under an obligation to buy them./r/n 你损坏了这些商品，你就得都买下来。/r/n
Be not a visit to Mr. George obligatory?/r/n 是不是必须我拜访乔治先生？/r/n It is obligatory upon us to protect the world from nuclear war./r/n 保护世界免於核子战争是我们的义务。/r/n

Exhibiting a desire or willingness to please; cheerfully obliging./r/n 殷勤的表现出取悦别人意愿的；乐于顺从的/r/n You are not obliged to answer these questions, but it would make our task easier./r/n 这些问题并非非答不可, 但答问对我们大有助益./r/n
He drew an oblique line on paper./r/n 他在纸上划了一条斜线。/r/n The tendency to grow at an oblique or horizontal angle. Used of roots, stems, or branches./r/n 斜向性向倾斜或与水平成角度的方向生长的倾向。用于植物的根、茎或枝/r/n
The criminal obliterated all fingerprints./r/n 罪犯擦掉全部指印。/r/n The view was obliterated by the fog./r/n 景色被浓雾遮住了。/r/n
I was oblivious of my surroundings./r/n 我没有注意到周围的事物。/r/n The speaker ground on, oblivious of his listeners' boredom./r/n 演说者唠唠叨叨, 没注意到听众的厌烦情绪./r/n
I hate his obnoxious behavior./r/n 我恨他那讨厌的品行。/r/n He is the most obnoxious man I know./r/n 他是我认识的最可憎的人。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．难解的，不清楚的 v．隐藏，使…模糊
RECORD.lx: The path grew more obscure in the fading light./r/n 小径在渐渐消失的光线下变得更暗了。/r/n The poem is obscure to those unlearned in the classics./r/n 这首诗在不懂古典诗作的人看来是费解的。/r/n
The worker was praised for his observance of the rules./r/n 这个工人因为严格遵守规则而受到了表扬。/r/n An act of religious observance or prayer, especially when private./r/n 祈祷宗教仪式的活动或祷告的行为，尤指秘密的进行的/r/n
Her commitment to a great cause degenerated from a crusade into an obsession./r/n 她致力於一伟大事业, 但其崇高的奋斗精神已变质成为偏执的狂热./r/n Caused or conditioned by compulsion or obsession./r/n 强迫的由强迫或压制所引起或制约的/r/n
An obsolete locomotive./r/n 一个过时的火车机车/r/n The army plans to phase out the equipment as it becomes obsolete./r/n 军队计划淘汰这些设备，因为它们已经报废了。/r/n

Lack of education is an obstacle of success./r/n 缺乏教育是成功的障碍。/r/n Verification (eg Checking that weapons have been removed) could be an obstacle to an arms agreement./r/n 裁减军备协议难以达成, 症结在於如何证实（如检查武器确已销毁）./r/n
The science of childbirth; midwifery or obstetrics./r/n 产科学分娩的科学；助产学或产科学/r/n A physician who specializes in obstetrics./r/n 产科医生一个专攻产科医学的医生/r/n

This child is obstinate and rebellious./r/n 这个孩子倔强，难以管束。/r/n Only a man full of the milk of human kindness could have continued to befriend the proud and obstinate young man./r/n 只有天性善良的人才会和这个性情高傲脾气倔强的年轻人继续交往。/r/n
Tall trees obstructed his view of the road./r/n 有大树遮挡着，他看不见道路。/r/n He was charged obstructing the highway./r/n 他因阻碍公路交通而受控告。/r/n
Your car is causing an obstruction./r/n 你的汽车挡道了。/r/n He was found guilty of obstruction./r/n 他被判阻挡犯规。/r/n
The characteristic traits or customs of Occidental peoples./r/n 西洋风味西方人习惯或品质性格特征/r/n A native or inhabitant of an Occidental country; a westerner./r/n 西方人在西方国家居住的当地人或居住者/r/n

An unforeseen event that disrupts the normal course of things; an inopportune occurrence./r/n 意外扰乱事物正常进程的意外事件；不凑巧发生之事/r/n It is more a made-up story than a real occurrence./r/n 那是杜撰的故事，而不是真实发生的事情。/r/n
The best defense is offense./r/n 先下手为强/以攻为守。/r/n A pecuniary offense./r/n 需处以罚金的犯罪行为/r/n
I found him extremely offensive./r/n 我发现他非常令人讨厌。/r/n You will find it difficult to explain away your use of such offensive language./r/n 你使用这样无礼的语言是很难说得过去的./r/n
The crow is a bird of ill omen./r/n 乌鸦是不祥的预兆。/r/n It's an omen of victory./r/n 那是胜利的预兆。/r/n
Those black clouds look a bit ominous./r/n 乌云压顶，来势不妙。/r/n That evening has an ominous silence./r/n 那晚有着不祥的寂静。/r/n
She complained about the omission of her name from the list./r/n 她抱怨名单上遗漏了她的名字。/r/n The mark X denotes an omission./r/n 增补号（X）表示有脱漏./r/n
By the time the ambulance had arrived, a crowd of onlookers had gathered./r/n 救护车赶到时, 围观的人已经很多了./r/n He fell into the water, much to the entertainment of the onlookers./r/n 他跌进水中，旁观者大乐。/r/n
I felt his report was deliberately opaque./r/n 我觉得他的报告故意含糊其词。/r/n This is an opaque cup./r/n 这是一个不透明的杯子。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．（计划等）实施中的，生效的
RECORD.lx: The station will be operative again in January./r/n 该车站将於一月份恢复使用./r/n The oil rig is now fully operative./r/n 石油钻塔现全面开工./r/n
His opponent did not stand a chance./r/n 他的对手毫无取胜的机会。/r/n She is one of the strongest opponents of tax reform./r/n 她是税收改革最强烈的反对者之一。/r/n
It's an opportune rain./r/n 这是一场及时雨。/r/n He arrived at the most opportune moment./r/n 他在最适当的时候到达。/r/n
It's oppressive today./r/n 今天的天气令人难受。/r/n The heat in the tropics is oppressive./r/n 热带气候热得难受。/r/n
Pessimism, when you get used to it, is just as agreeable as optimism./r/n 悲观主义者，当你习惯它之后，就和乐观主义者一样令人惬意了。/r/n They professed optimism about the outcome./r/n 他们对结果表示乐观./r/n
Most favorable or desirable; optimum./r/n 最理想的最适宜的，最令人满意的，最优的/r/n The market offer optimum condition for sale./r/n 市场为销售提供了最佳条件。/r/n
The insurance cover is optional./r/n 保险范围可以随意选择。/r/n A4-speed automatic transmission is optional./r/n 四段自动变速器是可自由选择的。/r/n
His courage was severely tried by his ordeal./r/n 他的勇气在艰难困苦中经受了严峻的考验。/r/n She maintained her equanimity throughout her long ordeal./r/n 她在长期的苦难中心情一直都很平静./r/n
This is an area rich in ore./r/n 这里是个矿产丰富的地区。/r/n After chemical assay, we have known the composition of the ore./r/n 经过化学分析，我们知道了矿石的构成。/r/n
Germs may invade the organism./r/n 细菌会侵入有机体。/r/n The army is an extremely complex organism./r/n 军队是极其复杂的组织。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．上升的，v．确定方向，使熟悉情况
RECORD.lx: In the market, I breathed the smells of the Orient./r/n 在集市上，我闻到了东方的气息。/r/n Ian is a dab hand at the orient art./r/n 伊恩是东方艺术的行家。/r/n

The unconscious perception of movement and spatial orientation arising from stimuli within the body itself./r/n 本体感受由身体本身的内部刺激引起的对于运动和空间定向的不自觉的感受/r/n The orientation of a spacecraft relative to its direction of motion./r/n 飞行姿态宇宙飞船相对于其飞行方向所处的位置/r/n
The work lacks originality./r/n 那作品缺乏创造性。/r/n Her designs have great originality./r/n 她的设计十分新颖。/r/n

Orthodox Christian churches often have elaborate steeples./r/n 传统的基督教堂都有精致的尖塔。/r/n Roman Catholics were the next largest group with46, 000, 000 members, There were5, 600, 000 Jews and700, 000 Eastern Orthodox Christians./r/n 罗马天主教是第二个最大的团体，有四千六百万教徒。犹太教徒有五百六十万，东正教徒有七十万。/r/n
He oscillates between political extremes./r/n 他的政治观点在两个极端之间摇摆不定./r/n Manic depressives oscillate between depression and elation./r/n 躁狂抑郁症患者抑郁与躁狂交替发作./r/n
Her oscillations in mood are maddening./r/n 她喜怒无常能把人气疯。/r/n

Shrinkage or contraction of the protoplasm away from the wall of a living plant or bacterial cell, caused by loss of water through osmosis./r/n 胞质皱缩通过渗透作用由于缺水引起的活植细胞或细菌的细胞质的皱缩或收缩，并与细胞壁分离/r/n Learned French by osmosis while residing in Paris for15 years./r/n 居住在巴黎的十五年中已经潜移默化地学习了法语/r/n
Seeming or professed; ostensible./r/n 假装的表面上的或自称的；貌似真实的/r/n An ostensible or professed purpose; an excuse./r/n 借口，托词表面的目的；理由/r/n
Exhibiting no pretensions, boastfulness, or ostentation; modest./r/n 不装腔作势的不装腔作势的，不夸耀的；不铺张招摇的；谦逊/r/n
She's very outgoing./r/n 她非常爱好交际。/r/n She's outgoing and a good mixer./r/n 她是一个杰出的爱交际的人/r/n
How Harry came into the possession of this outlandish stuff makes an interesting story which he is fond of relating./r/n 哈里如何得到这种稀奇古怪的东西，是一个他津津乐道的有趣的故事。/r/n
We should never forget the outrage committed by the Japanese invaders./r/n 我们永远都不应该忘记日本侵略者犯下的暴行。/r/n The Government has been dilatory in condemning the outrage./r/n 政府迟迟才谴责是次暴行./r/n
His treatment of his wife is outrageous./r/n 他对待妻子十分蛮横。/r/n The price is outrageous./r/n 价钱高得吓人。/r/n
The start or initial stage; the outset./r/n 开始，开端开始或初始阶段/r/n The teacher laid emphasis on the precision of the translation from the outset./r/n 老师从一开始就强调翻译准确性。/r/n

Presently she recognized that she was already in the outskirts of the city./r/n 不久她看出，她已经到达这座城市的郊区。/r/n Fires swept through the outskirts, where the houses, being mostly of wood, were razed to the ground./r/n 大火席卷郊区，那里的房屋多数都是木造的，被烧成了一片废墟。/r/n
Demand is outstripping current production./r/n 现在需求逐渐超过了生产能力./r/n We soon outstripped the slower runners./r/n 我们很快就超过那些跑得慢的人./r/n

The singer got a ten-minute standing ovation./r/n 观众起立向那位歌手鼓掌达十分钟./r/n After a while Lenin came out on the stage. The ovation was unlike anything I have ever seen. Lenin let it continue for a few minutes, standing absolutely still, then with a single motion of his arms across his body stopped the uproar instantaneously and you could have heard a pin drop./r/n 不久列宁在台上出现了，那种热烈的欢呼是我从未见过的。列宁先静静地站了几分钟，让欢呼声继续着，然后用手在胸前横挥一下，喝彩声马上终止，于是连一根针落地的声音你都可以听得到。/r/n
The engine is due for an overhaul./r/n 那台发动机该大修了./r/n The fast cruiser soon overhauled the old cargo boat./r/n 快速巡逻艇迅即赶上那艘旧货船./r/n

There is no question of overlap between the two courses./r/n 这两门课程之间不存在重叠的问题。/r/n A stitch made by inserting the needle at the midpoint of a preceding stitch so that the stitches overlap by half lengths./r/n 回针缝在先前缝的一针中间加缝的一针，以便使针脚的交错重叠为原来长度的一半/r/n
The president vetoed the bill, but congress override his veto./r/n 总统否决了议案，但国会将它推翻。/r/n The appeal court override the decision of the lower court./r/n 上诉法院推翻了下级法院的裁决。/r/n
Overt hostility; overt intelligence gathering./r/n 公然的敌意；公众智慧的结晶/r/n Acts of war; overt warfare./r/n 战争行为；公开战争/r/n
The audience must be in their seats before the overture./r/n 观众必须于序曲演奏前入座。/r/n
Your kindness quite overwhelmed me./r/n 你的好意使我感激难言。/r/n The village was overwhelmed when the floods came./r/n 这个村庄在洪水泛滥时被淹没了。/r/n
Our football team has won an overwhelming victory./r/n 我们的足球队取得了压倒性的胜利。/r/n The scenic splendors of the Rocky Mountains are overwhelming./r/n 落基山脉的壮丽景色使人赞叹不已。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．紧张过度的，兴奋过度的
RECORD.lx: She didn't mean to offend you; she was overwrought./r/n 她无意得罪你, 她是情绪不好./r/n She was in a very overwrought state after the accident./r/n 事故发生後她精神十分紧张./r/n
I can hear an owl hooting./r/n 我能听到一只猫头鹰在叫。/r/n The owl swooped down on the mouse./r/n 那只猫头鹰向著老鼠猛扑下来./r/n
Iron is easily oxidized./r/n 铁很容易氧化。/r/n The carbon14 atoms oxidize to carbon dioxide which gets blown about and mixed up with lower atmosphere./r/n 碳14原子氧化生成二氧化碳，向四周散去并与低空的大气混合。/r/n
The man is as dumb as an oyster./r/n 那人极少说话。/r/n That oyster closed up its valves./r/n 那个牡蛎把壳合拢起来。/r/n

The two opposition parties made an electoral pact./r/n 这两个反对党达成了一项关于在选举中进行合作的协议。/r/n President Reagan… will insist that the pact be considered on an"all or nothing" basis./r/n 里根总统……将会坚持该条约必须在“全部接受，否则不签”的基础上予以考虑。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．壮观的游行，露天历史剧
RECORD.lx: We are all invited to take part in the pageant./r/n 我们全都被邀请参加这次盛典。/r/n A public celebration or spectacular pageant./r/n 盛典公共庆祝活动或热闹的游行/r/n
The truth is not always very palatable./r/n 事实真相并非尽如人意./r/n
Developer can install ole control onto the palette or choose from among the ole control include in delphi2.0./r/n 开发者们可以把OLE控制安装到调色板上或从包括在Delphi2。0中的OLE控制中选择。/r/n A limited palette./r/n 有限的色调/r/n
They pamper themselves after a hard day at work./r/n 他们劳累工作一日之后放纵自己。/r/n The pampered cat refused to eat food without meat./r/n 这只被娇惯的猫拒绝吃没有肉的饭。/r/n
He gave me a pamphlet for my call numbers./r/n 他给了我一个小册子记录电话号码。/r/n The pamphlet contains information of political opinion./r/n 这本小册子含有关于政治主张的资料。/r/n
I am cooking apple pies with my newly bought frying pan./r/n 我正在用我新买的煎锅做苹果馅饼。/r/n I thought it was a good idea, but I don't think it will pan out./r/n 我原以为这个想法很好，但现在我认为它行不通。/r/n

A medieval chemical philosophy having as its asserted aims the transmutation of base metals into gold, the discovery of the panacea, and the preparation of the elixir of longevity./r/n 炼金术，炼丹术中世纪的一种化学哲学。其声称的目标是将一些基本金属转变为金子，发现万灵药及制备长生不老药/r/n A remedy that cures all diseases or evils; a panacea./r/n 万灵药能治愈所有疾病或罪恶的药物；仙丹/r/n
The pancreas can produce substances which help in the digestion of food./r/n 胰脏能产生助消化的物质。/r/n
This ceiling has a carved panel./r/n 这块天花板带有刻花镶板。/r/n The panel was chosen to take part in discussion./r/n 那个专门小组被选中参加讨论。/r/n
Don't panic!/r/n 别怕!/r/n She got into a panic when she thought she'd forgotten the tickets./r/n 她想起忘记带入场券，顿时惊慌起来。/r/n

From the summit there is a superb panorama of the alps./r/n 从峰巅俯瞰，阿尔卑斯山壮丽的景色尽收眼底。/r/n The panorama of color and action which fills the world is taken for granted./r/n 充满世间的色彩和动作的景象被当成理所当然，或许，这是人性共有的特点。/r/n
He wanted to find some wine in the pantry./r/n 他想在餐具室里找到一些酒。/r/n No food is left in the pantry except some bread./r/n 食品柜里除了一些面包其它什麽也不剩。/r/n
As a writer she was on a par with the great novelists./r/n 她是与伟大小说家齐名的作家。/r/n He is the elder statesman par excellence./r/n 他是最优秀的年长的国务活动家./r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．矛盾、似矛盾而正确的说法
RECORD.lx: It is a paradox that such a rich country should have so many poor people living in it./r/n 如此富足的国家竟有如此多的穷人, 这是个矛盾的现实./r/n Paradox and irony are characteristics of her style./r/n 她善於运用似非而是的隽语和反语./r/n
The electricity failure paralyzed the water supply./r/n 停电使水供应陷于瘫痪。/r/n The accident left her paralyzed in both legs./r/n 事故后她的腰部以下瘫痪了。/r/n
A person affected with paralysis./r/n 瘫痪病者，麻痹患者患麻痹症的人/r/n The disease results in creeping paralysis./r/n 这种病可发展成脊髓痨./r/n
The reduction of unemployment should be paramount./r/n 降低失业率应是头等大事。/r/n This matter is of paramount importance./r/n 此事至关重要。/r/n

Relating to, characteristic of, or affected with paranoia./r/n 类偏执狂的，有偏执狂特征的与偏执症有关的、有其特征的或有此症状的/r/n Paranoia reigns supreme among the women, causing much marital conflict./r/n 偏执狂现象在妇女中很盛行，引起了许多婚姻纠纷。/r/n
The mistletoe plant is a parasite on trees./r/n 槲寄生是寄生在树上的植物。/r/n Don't give money to him; he is a parasite./r/n 别给他钱，他是个好吃懒做的人。/r/n
The statistics were given in parenthesis./r/n 统计数字在括号里./r/n One have to dismount from an idea and get into saddle again at every parenthesis./r/n 每当遇上一个括号，就叫人不得不从一种想法下马，然后再次骑上马鞍。/r/n
The trial was a parody of justice./r/n 这次审判是对公正的一次拙劣的模拟/r/n An exaggerated or grotesque imitation, such as a parody of a literary work./r/n 模仿一种夸张或怪诞的模仿，如对一个文学作品的滑稽模仿/r/n

A partiality or disposition in favor of something; a preference./r/n 偏爱，偏袒偏爱或喜欢事物的性情；偏爱/r/n Challenging the array is made either by reason of the partiality of the Sheriff or his under officer who arrayed the panel, or for some other cause./r/n 要求全体陪审员回避是由于行政司法长官有所偏袒，或是由于他手上部署陪审员阵容的官员有所偏袒，以及其他原因。/r/n

I don't want to go into particulars about the meeting now, I'll tell you al the details later./r/n 现在我不想详细谈（有关会议的情况），以后我会告诉你全部细节。/r/n The lawyer tried to dig up all the particulars of the case as soon as possible./r/n 那个律师试图尽快查明这一案件的全部细节。/r/n

It is the partisan who drove the enemy forces out of our country./r/n 是游击队员把敌人从我们国家赶出去的。/r/n Partisan politics is often an obstruction to good government. Office politics are often debilitating and counterproductive./r/n 党羽的政治阴谋经常是良好政府的妨碍。公务上的政治争斗经常是带削弱性质和招致反效果的/r/n

I could hear what he was saying on the phone through the partition./r/n 我能隔着墙听见他在电话里说了些什么。/r/n A grill or network of bars set in a window or door or used as a partition; a grate./r/n 格栅由杆做成的栏栅或框架，置于窗内或门上用作隔离物；格栅/r/n
The parvenu invited guests but they all hung off./r/n 这个暴发户邀请了客人，但是他们都不愿意去。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．彩色粉笔画，柔和的色彩
RECORD.lx: She works in (ie uses) pastels./r/n 她用彩色粉笔作画./r/n Pastel colours are restful to the eye./r/n 清淡柔和的颜色可以养目。/r/n
My favorite pastime is reading./r/n 我最喜爱的消遣是读书。/r/n Writing is a solitary pastime./r/n 写作是独自一人的消遣./r/n
A governing body of pastors and elders in certain Reformed churches, having jurisdiction over local churches./r/n 长老监督会一些改革派教会的由牧师和长老组成的管理机构，有对地区教会的裁决权/r/n
The picture showed a charming pastoral scene of cows drinking from a stream./r/n 这幅画表现了牛在溪边饮水的迷人的田园风光。/r/n The priest makes pastoral visits every Tuesday./r/n 牧师每星期二作履行神职的访问。/r/n
You eat too much pastry./r/n 你吃的点心太多了。/r/n She can make Danish pastry./r/n 她会做丹麦点心。/r/n
The boy's trousers need a patch on the knee./r/n 这孩子的裤子膝盖上需要打个补丁。/r/n He patched up a couple of old tires./r/n 他补了几条旧车胎。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．显而易见的 n．专利权（证书）
RECORD.lx: He got a patent for this invention./r/n 他获得了这项发明的专利权。/r/n The patent runs out in three years time./r/n 这项专利期限为3年。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．引起怜悯的，令人难过的
RECORD.lx: His tears were pathetic to witness./r/n 他的眼泪引起在场人的怜悯。/r/n We saw the pathetic sight of starving children./r/n 我们看到挨饿的儿童悲惨可怜的样子。/r/n
The play is notable for the pathos of its final scene./r/n 该剧以最后一场的哀婉动人而著称。/r/n
A veranda or roofed patio./r/n 门廊走廊或有顶棚的天井/r/n An open, often paved area adjacent to a house serving as an outdoor living space; a patio./r/n 内院，庭院紧邻房间的一块开阔、通常铺过的区域，作为室外活动场所；庭院/r/n
We are all deeply moved by his patriotism./r/n 我们都被他的爱国精神深深感动了。/r/n They criticize their opponents under the cover of patriotism./r/n 他们借口爱国来抨击反对者。/r/n
We thank you for your patronage./r/n 我们谢谢您的惠顾。/r/n The theatre is under the patronage of the Arts Council./r/n 那家剧院得到了艺术委员会的赞助。/r/n
An impoverished person; a pauper./r/n 穷人贫困的人；贫民/r/n He was degraded in their eyes; he had lost caste and station before the very paupers./r/n 他在他们的眼光里是坍台了；他在贫民前面丢了体面和地位。/r/n
The painter had to pawn his watch to pay for a meal./r/n 这位画家不得不把表当掉买顿饭吃。/r/n We are mere pawns in the struggle for power./r/n 在权力斗争中我们只是一批小卒。/r/n
Having paid off the pawnbroker, I now had my watch out of hock./r/n 偿还了当铺老板的债，我赎回了自己的手表。/r/n The shop of a pawnbroker./r/n 当铺开当铺者的店/r/n
Tourism is at its peak in August./r/n 旅游业在八月份达到高峰。/r/n The mountain peaks are covered with snow all year./r/n 山顶上终年积雪。/r/n
There are many pebbles on the riverbed./r/n 河床上有很多卵石。/r/n He dropped a pebble from the bridge and waited for the plop./r/n 他从桥上扔下一颗卵石, 然後等著听那扑通的一声./r/n
Instruction; teaching; pedagogy./r/n 指导；教学；教学法/r/n
The workers put the statue on its pedestal./r/n 工人们把雕像放到基座上。/r/n The statue reposes on a pedestal./r/n 塑像安放在台座上。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．徒步的，缺乏想像的 n．行人
RECORD.lx: The driver was slanging a pedestrian who had got in his way./r/n 那司机破口大骂挡他的路的行人./r/n Being a good pedestrian is just as important as being a good driver./r/n 做一个好的行人就像做一个好的司机一样重要。/r/n
The branch of pediatrics that deals with the diseases and care of newborn infants./r/n 新生儿学儿科学的一个分支，研究新生儿疾病和护理/r/n
Cover your eyes and don't peek./r/n 捂上眼睛，别偷看。/r/n He just had time to peek into the room before the door closed./r/n 他刚向房间里望了一眼门便关上了。/r/n
She peers through the mist, trying to find the right path./r/n 她透过雾眯着眼看，想找出正确的路。/r/n The opinions of his peers are more important to him than his parents' ideas./r/n 在他看来，他同辈人的观点比他父母的观点更为重要。/r/n
Inclined to be vexed or troubled; peevish./r/n 烦躁的易被激怒或困扰的；易怒的/r/n A peevish child is unhappy and makes others unhappy./r/n 一个脾气暴躁的孩子自己不高兴也使别人不高兴。/r/n
The children rushed pell-mell down the stairs./r/n 孩子们乱哄哄地冲下楼去./r/n The books were scattered pell-mell over the floor./r/n 书本凌乱地散置在地上./r/n
The rain was pelting down./r/n 大雨倾盆。/r/n The crowds pelted bad eggs at the speaker./r/n 群众纷纷向演讲人扔臭鸡蛋。/r/n
May I borrow your pen?/r/n 我可以借用你的钢笔吗？/r/n She fumbled about in her handbag for a pen./r/n 她在手提袋中搜寻钢笔。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．置（某人）于不利地位，处罚
RECORD.lx: The new law penalizes the poorest members of society./r/n 新法规对社会中最贫困者不 利./r/n People who drive when they are drunk should be heavily penalized./r/n 对酒醉开车者应予重罚./r/n
She has paid the penalty for her crimes with five years in prison./r/n 她因犯罪受到惩罚被判刑五年。/r/n One of the penalties of fame is that people point at you on the street./r/n 当了名人的麻烦之一是在街上被人指指点点。/r/n
He had done penance for his sins; we should forgive him./r/n 他已经为赎罪自我惩罚了，我们应该原谅他。/r/n
She has a penchant for Indian food./r/n 她爱吃印度食物./r/n
When will the pendent problem be solved?/r/n 这个悬而未决的问题什么时候能解决呢？/r/n
The lawsuit was then pending./r/n 那件讼案因而尚未解决./r/n A decision on this matter is pending./r/n 此事即将作出决定./r/n
The pendulum of the clock in my room is a bear./r/n 我房间的钟摆是小熊形状的。/r/n A pendulum oscillates./r/n 摆锤能摆动./r/n
The headlamps penetrated the fog./r/n 车的前灯的光射进雾中。/r/n Nothing we say penetrates his thick skull!/r/n 无论我们说什麽他都不懂。/r/n
The penetrating odor of garlic soon filled the entire apartment./r/n 大蒜刺鼻的气味很快就弥散了整个屋子/r/n
Resistant to penetration by water but not entirely waterproof./r/n 抗水的能抵抗水的渗透但不完全防水的/r/n He writes with penetration./r/n 他写的文章尖锐深刻。/r/n
Since he has been penitent, I don't think he will do that again./r/n 既然他已经悔罪了，我认为他不会再那样做了。/r/n
A place where persons convicted or accused of crimes are confined; a penitentiary or a jail./r/n 监狱，拘留所监禁被指控或认定有罪的人的地方；拘留所或监狱/r/n
A pennant lolling from the mast./r/n 信号旗松散地从桅杆上垂下来/r/n
He retired on a company pension./r/n 他退休时得到公司的退休金。/r/n Size of pension depends on length of service with the company./r/n 养老金的多少取决於为公司服务年限的长短./r/n
The painting can inspire a pensive mood./r/n 这幅画能引人沉思。/r/n The woman in this painting has a pensive smile./r/n 这幅画上的女人脸上露出忧郁的微笑。/r/n
November is the penultimate month of the year./r/n 十一月份是一年中倒数的第二个月。/r/n
Laid-off workers fall into penury./r/n 下岗职工陷入贫困。/r/n Peoples in Africa are living in penury./r/n 非洲的人民过着贫穷的生活。/r/n
A peppery sales clerk./r/n 一个脾气暴躁的销售员/r/n
We perceived that we were unwelcome and left./r/n 我们发觉自己不受欢迎，因此便离开了。/r/n We had already perceived how the temperature fluctuated./r/n 我们已注意到温度的波动情形./r/n
People's living standard has had a perceptible improvement./r/n 人民的生活水平明显地改善了。/r/n It's perceptible that you are a good man./r/n 可以看出，你是一个好人。/r/n

My perception was the conditions had not changed./r/n 我认为情况无变化。/r/n The branch of psychology that deals with the relationship between the nervous system, especially the brain, and cerebral or mental functions such as language, memory, and perception./r/n 神经心理学心理学的分支，研究神经系统特别是脑神经系统与诸如语言、记忆、知觉等脑功能或心理功能之间相互关系的科学/r/n
Knowledge gained by the use of this faculty; a perceptive insight./r/n 直觉知道运用这种能力而获得的知识；敏锐的洞察力/r/n Mentally responsive and perceptive; quick./r/n 思维敏捷的思维反应迅速且感觉灵敏的；快速敏捷的/r/n
From our perch up there on top of the cliff we can see the whole town./r/n 我们从悬崖顶上的高处能看到城市的全景。/r/n The small village perched on a hill./r/n 这个小村庄位于山上。/r/n
The rumour percolated through the firm./r/n 那谣言在公司里慢慢流传开来./r/n I'll percolate some coffee for you./r/n 我给你滤煮一些咖啡。/r/n

A small firework consisting of some gravel wrapped in tissue paper with a percussion cap that explodes when thrown against a hard surface./r/n 掼炮一种由草纸包住一些砾石制成的小型鞭炮，其打火帽在与坚硬表面撞击时发生爆炸/r/n Percussion instruments or their players considered as a group./r/n 把打击乐器或他们的演奏者看成一组/r/n
He made a peremptory order./r/n 他下达了一个必须服从的命令。/r/n The teacher spoke in a peremptory tone./r/n 老师以命令的口吻说话/r/n
A perennial woody plant having a main trunk and usually a distinct crown./r/n 树一种多年生木质植物，生有一个主干且常有一个很明显的树冠/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．力求完美者，吹毛求疵者
RECORD.lx: The innkeeper is a notoriously hard driving, whip-cracking perfectionist./r/n 这个酒馆的老板出名地凶狠，不准手下人犯一点错误。/r/n
The roses perfumed the air./r/n 玫瑰花的芳香四溢。/r/n Can you smell the perfume of the roses?/r/n 你能闻到玫瑰花的香味吗？/r/n

The operator answered the phone with a perfunctory greeting./r/n 接线员接通电话，象征性的打了招呼/r/n The policy of making only a perfunctory effort or symbolic gesture toward the accomplishment of a goal, such as racial integration./r/n 表面文章一种只对一个要完成的目标、如种族融合而作一些随意的努力或象征性的姿态的策略/r/n
The ship was in imminent peril of being wrecked./r/n 那条船马上就有失事的危险。/r/n You had better not invest so much money at your peril./r/n 你最好不要冒险投资这么多。/r/n

Their perilous journey across the ocean has attracted public attention./r/n 他们的越洋冒险旅行引起了公众的注意。/r/n It is true during their explorations they often faced difficulties and dangers of the most perilous nature./r/n 确实在探险中，他们经常面临着各种最有危险性的艰难和险阻。/r/n
The plane stalled, flipped over onto its back and crashed near the perimeter./r/n 飞机失速了，翻了一个跟头，坠毁在机场环形围栏附近。/r/n The barbed wire fence round the perimeter discouraged intruders./r/n 周围有铁丝网阻止了外人闯入./r/n
We have three periods of chemistry a week./r/n 我们一星期三节化学课。/r/n Which period of history are you studying?/r/n 你正在学哪一段历史？/r/n
Peripatetic music teachers visit the school regularly./r/n 兼职音乐教师定期到校授课./r/n

An interface unit or circuitry that converts data to and from the representation used by a particular peripheral device or class of peripheral devices; for example, a device that converts between bit serial and bit parallel and resolves differences in transmission speeds./r/n 一种接口部件或电路，用来把数据转换成某种特殊的外围设备上的表示或某类外围设备上的表示或把此种表示转换成数据。例如，一台在串行位和并行位之间作转换且解决传输速度差别的设备。/r/n The central processing unit of a computer exclusive of peripheral and remote devices./r/n 主机计算机除了外部和分离的装置以外的中心运作部件/r/n
