The idea is also expressed by minor poet on the periphery of the movement./r/n 该运动外围一些不大出名的诗人也表达了这些观点。/r/n Carrying inward to a central organ or section, as nerves that conduct impulses from the periphery of the body to the brain or spinal cord./r/n 传入的传入到中央器官或部分的，如从身体的神经末梢周围传导神经冲至大脑或脊柱腱的神经/r/n
Almost a hundred people perished in the hotel fire last night./r/n 近百人在昨夜旅馆的大火中丧生。/r/n The lumbermen were perished with cold./r/n 伐木工人冻僵了。/r/n
Perishable food should be stored in a refrigerator./r/n 易腐的食物应储存在冰箱里./r/n Keep perishable foods under refrigeration./r/n 把容易变质的食物冷藏起来./r/n
I can't get in I've lost the perishing key!/r/n 我进不去－－我把该死的钥匙丢了。/r/n He's too perishing mean to pay his share./r/n 他小气极了，连自己的那份钱也不付。/r/n
Several witnesses at the trial were clearly prepared to perjure themselves in order to protect the accused./r/n 在审判时几个证人显然已准备好为袒护被告而作伪证./r/n

He is accused of perjury with the intention of incriminate his employer./r/n 他被控告犯有意图加罪于其雇主的伪证罪。/r/n Four fifths of the perjury in the world is expended on tombstone, women, and competitor./r/n 世上的伪证，有五分之四花费于墓碑、女人以及竞争对手之上。/r/n
That child is a bit too perky!/r/n 那孩子有点太放肆了!/r/n He's still in hospital, but he seems quite perky./r/n 他虽然还住著院, 可是看上去倒挺精神./r/n

The property or condition of being permeable./r/n 渗透，渗透性可渗透的特质或状态/r/n The inward flow of a fluid through a permeable membrane toward a fluid of greater concentration./r/n 内渗透一种液体透过可渗透膜流向另一种浓度比它高的液体的内部流动/r/n
The smell of cooking permeates (through) the flat./r/n 整套房间都弥漫著做菜的气味./r/n Water has permeated (through) the soil./r/n 水已渗遍那片土壤./r/n
This event had a pernicious influence on society./r/n 这件事情对社会造成了有害的影响。/r/n Pollution of the water supply reached a level pernicious to the health of the population./r/n 水源污染已经达到危及居民健康的程度。/r/n
We had to listen to a peroration on the evils of drink!/r/n 我们得听一个关於酗酒害处的冗长报告!/r/n
There are many perpendicular marble columns in Greek temples./r/n 希腊庙宇有很多垂直的大理石柱。/r/n The wall is a little out of the perpendicular./r/n 那墙有点斜。/r/n
Who perpetrated that dreadful extension to the front of the building?/r/n 谁在那楼房正面加盖了那麽一截讨厌的建筑物?/r/n
They decided to perpetuate the memory of their leader by erecting a statue./r/n 他们为永远纪念那位领袖决定建一座雕像。/r/n These measures will perpetuate the hostility between the two groups./r/n 采取这些措施势必使那两集团永远对立。/r/n
The site of the memorial is granted in perpetuity to Canada./r/n 纪念馆址已选定在加拿大作为永久的纪念./r/n These lands were granted to our family in perpetuity./r/n 这些土地依法永远归我们家族所有./r/n
When new math was introduced into schools, many parents were perplexed by it./r/n 当学校开设新的数学课时，许多家长对此感到迷惑不解。/r/n The question perplexed me./r/n 那问题把我难住了./r/n
It's a problem of such perplexity that it was impossible to solve./r/n 那是个复杂得无法解决的问题。/r/n She looked at us in perplexity./r/n 她茫然地看着我们。/r/n
Politics in Britain used to be the perquisite of the property-owning classes./r/n 英国的政治以往是有产阶级的特权./r/n Perquisites include the use of the company car./r/n 福利包括可以使用公司的汽车./r/n
He persecuted me with various delicate questions./r/n 他用种种微妙的问题把我难倒了。/r/n They came to America after being persecuted for their religious beliefs./r/n 他们是在他们因宗教信仰而受到迫害之后来到美洲的。/r/n

The Jews suffered terrible persecution under Hitler's rule./r/n 犹太人在希特勒的统治下受到残酷的迫害。/r/n A psychotic disorder characterized by delusions of persecution or grandeur, often strenuously defended with apparent logic and reason./r/n 妄想狂，偏执狂一种通常用表面的逻辑和道理来设想的具烦扰或夸大妄想特征的精神错乱症/r/n
If you persevere with work, you'll succeed in the end./r/n 你如果把工作坚持下去，最终会取得成功的。/r/n When things get difficult, you just have to grit your teeth and persevere./r/n 遇到困难只需咬紧牙关坚持下去./r/n
A few persevering climbers finally reached the top./r/n 少数几个攀登者坚忍不拔，终於登上了顶峰。/r/n Refusing to give up or let go; persevering obstinately./r/n 坚持不懈的，执意的拒绝放弃或听任的；顽固坚持的/r/n
Despite persistent denials, the rumor continued to spread./r/n 尽管一再否认，谣言还是不胫而走。/r/n She eventually married the most persistent one of her admirers./r/n 她终于嫁给了最执着追求她的人。/r/n
The salesman was a very personable young man./r/n 推销员是个风度翩翩的年轻人./r/n
She is stately in personage./r/n 她仪容端庄。/r/n He played the personage of Hamlet in the play./r/n 他在这个剧中扮演哈姆雷特。/r/n
Personalities are not in good taste in general conversation./r/n 在一般的谈话中诽谤他人是不高尚的。/r/n He ghosts for a number of sports personalities who `write' newspaper columns./r/n 他给一些为报纸专栏｀写＇文章的体育界名人做捉刀人./r/n
He looked the personification of misery./r/n 他那副样子可谓是苦难的典型。/r/n Although she is poor, she is the personification of generosity./r/n 她虽然贫穷，却是慷慨大方的化身。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．（判断事物的）角度，方法，透视法
RECORD.lx: Artists didn't understand perspective in those days./r/n 在那个年代艺术家们不懂透视法。/r/n You must get the story in its right perspectives./r/n 你必须正确地了解这件事。/r/n
It is very perspicacious of you to find the cause of the trouble so quickly./r/n 你真是明察秋毫，问题的原因这麽快就找出来了。/r/n
She burst out in perspiration./r/n 她突然出了一身汗。/r/n Genius is one per cent inspiration and ninety- nine per cent perspiration./r/n 天才的百分之一是灵感，百分之九十九是血汗。/r/n
Your argument seemed not very persuasive./r/n 你的论据不太有说服力。/r/n He talked to her with persuasive manner./r/n 他以晓之以礼的态度劝说她。/r/n
This letter does not pertain to politics./r/n 这封信的内容与政治无关。/r/n It does not pertain to the young to instruct their elders./r/n 年轻人不应该对老年人发号施令。/r/n

His style of argument in meetings is not so much aggressive as pertinacious./r/n 他在会议上的辩论态度并非锋芒逼人而是坚持己见./r/n She is the most vocal and pertinacious of all the critics of the policy./r/n 在所有的政策批评家中，她是陈词最多而且最为固执的。/r/n

A document containing all the facts and points of law pertinent to a specific case, filed by an attorney before arguing the case in court./r/n 诉讼要点，案情摘要包含与案件有关的所有证据、论点的文件，由律师出庭辩论时提出/r/n The process of recording everything pertinent to a machine run, including identification of the machine run, recording the alternation switch settings, identification of input and output tapes, copy of manual key-ins, identification of all stops, and a record of the action taken on all stops./r/n 有关计算机运行的全部事项记录的过程，包括计算机运行的标识、记录转换开关的置位、输入输出带的标识、人工键入信息的拷贝、所有停止的标识以及所有为停机所采取的动作记录。/r/n
Have you perused this article?/r/n 你细读了这篇文章了吗？/r/n After breakfast he perused the newspapers./r/n 早饭后，他读了各种报纸。/r/n
Her work is pervaded by nostalgia for a past age./r/n 她的作品充满了怀旧之情。/r/n The smell of baked apple pies pervaded the house./r/n 房子里弥漫着烤苹果馅饼的香味。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．刚愎自用的，故意作对的
RECORD.lx: She gets a perverse satisfaction from making other people embarrassed./r/n 她有一种不正常的心态，以使别人难堪来取乐。/r/n We all wanted to go tomorrow, but she had to be perverse and insisted on going today./r/n 我们都想明天去，但她十分任性偏要今天去。/r/n
Do pornographic books pervert those who read them?/r/n 看色情书刊能诱人堕落吗？/r/n Scientific knowledge was perverted to help cause destruction and war./r/n 科学知识被滥用于破坏和战争。/r/n
Her account was a perversion of the truth./r/n 她所讲的歪曲了事实./r/n
A pesky mosquito./r/n 讨厌的蚊子/r/n
Stores of grain are frequently attacked by pests./r/n 储存的谷物经常受到害虫的破坏。/r/n That child is an absolute pest!/r/n 那孩子讨厌极了！/r/n

The seeds and the pesticide are both ready./r/n 种子跟农药都准备好了。/r/n A biotechnology company is developing a range of new pesticide based on naturally occur toxin./r/n 一家生物工艺开发公司正在根据自然滋生毒素的原理研制新型农药系列产品。/r/n
He pestered her with requests for help./r/n 他缠著她要她帮忙./r/n The horses in the meadow were being pestered by flies./r/n 牧场上的马不断受马蝇滋扰./r/n
She filed a petition for divorce./r/n 她提出了离婚申请。/r/n She petitioned her neighbor to turn down the radio./r/n 她请求邻居把收音机关小点声。/r/n
The petitioner ask for a variation in her maintenance order./r/n 上诉人要求对她生活费的命令的条件进行变更。/r/n
The branch of pharmacology that deals with drugs in their crude or natural state./r/n 生药学药理学的一个分支，研究处于天然或原始状态的药物/r/n

Have you heard the story of the phantom riders passing by in the night?/r/n 你听说过夜间飘过的幽灵骑士的故事吗？/r/n Something apparently seen but having no physical reality; a phantom or an apparition./r/n 幻影，幽灵明显可见但没有物质的实体；幻影或幽灵/r/n
He spent his time philandering with the girls in the village./r/n 他把时间花在和村子里的姑娘们调情上了./r/n He spent his time philander with the girls in the village./r/n 他把时间花在和村子里的姑娘们调情上了。/r/n

He is the only philanthropist I can think of who gave away his fortune with absolutely no strings binding its use./r/n 他是我仅能想想来的慈善家，把自己的钱财送人绝不附带任何条件。/r/n Scottish-born American industrialist and philanthropist who amassed a fortune in the steel industry and donated millions of dollars for the benefit of the public./r/n 卡内基，戴尔1888－1955美国教育家，因著有一本自我修养的书如何赢得朋友及影响人民（1936年）而闻名/r/n

He accused those who criticized his work of being philistines./r/n 他指责那些批评他的作品的人是对艺术一窍不通./r/n The philistine attitude of the public resulted in the work being abandoned./r/n 由於公众对艺术不感兴趣, 那个作品备受冷遇./r/n
Commuting in the rush-hour requires a phlegmatic temperament./r/n 在上下班交通高峰期间乘坐通勤车要有安之若素的心境./r/n The British character is often said to be phlegmatic./r/n 英国人的性格常说成是冷漠的./r/n
The phony glamour of night club soon become stale and boring./r/n 夜总会那种虚假的荣华不久便失去了新意而使人生厌。/r/n
He is fond of high-sounding phrases./r/n 他爱用夸大的词句。/r/n This passage is concisely phrased./r/n 这段话措辞简练。/r/n
She is learning to play the piano./r/n 她在学弹钢琴。/r/n The singer was accompanied by her sister at the piano./r/n 这位歌唱家由她妹妹担任钢琴伴奏。/r/n
A boy is flying a kite in the piazza./r/n 一个小男孩在阳台上放风筝。/r/n
The Pied piper had all the children of Hamlin on his heels./r/n 穿彩衣的吹笛人使得汉姆林镇所有的孩子都跟着他走。/r/n I am cooking apple pies with my newly bought frying pan./r/n 我正在用我新买的煎锅做苹果馅饼。/r/n
The ship lies at the pier./r/n 船在码头停着。/r/n A pier running out into the sea./r/n 突伸到海中的码头。/r/n
The regiment pierced through the enemy's lines./r/n 这个团突破了敌军防线。/r/n The needle pierced her finger./r/n 针刺进了她的手指。/r/n

The calling of a man's self to a strict account, is a medicine, sometime too piercing and corrosive./r/n 一个人的严厉自责是一种有时过于猛烈，蚀力过强的药品。/r/n All of a sudden a piercing scream broke the silence./r/n 突然，刺耳的尖叫声打破了寂静。/r/n
The old man has great piety towards God./r/n 这位老人对上帝非常虔诚。/r/n Often a convert is zealous not through piety, but because of the novelty of his experience./r/n 改变信仰者之所以常常显得热情，并非出自虔诚，而是由于他的体验新鲜之故。/r/n
They used only natural pigments to dye the wool./r/n 他们只用天然颜料染毛织品。/r/n I have mixed pigment with oil./r/n 我已经把颜料和油混合起来了。/r/n
He makes a pigsty of the kitchen whenever he does the cooking./r/n 他一做饭就把厨房弄得很脏./r/n He laid big stones at his house and began to build a pigsty./r/n 他把大石块堆在房子前开始垒猪圈。/r/n
He was caught pilfering./r/n 他行窃当场被抓住./r/n She had been pilfering from the petty cash for months./r/n 她多月来一直从零用现金中偷钱./r/n
We met many pilgrims on their way to Mecca./r/n 我们遇到许多去麦加朝圣的人。/r/n At length the pilgrim could shake the dust off his feet at Heidelberg./r/n 那个朝圣者终于可以在海德堡停下来了。/r/n
The town was pillaged by the invading army./r/n 入侵的军队将该城镇掠夺一空。/r/n Her handbag was pillaged on her way home./r/n 在回家的路上，她的手提包被抢劫了。/r/n
She was pilloried in the press for her extravagant parties./r/n 她的聚会十分铺张，新闻界对她大加嘲弄。/r/n
The new shoes pinched my toes./r/n 这双新鞋紧得夹脚趾。/r/n The door pinched my finger as it shut./r/n 门关上时夹了我的手指。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．松树v．（因疾病等）憔悴，衰退
RECORD.lx: There is a pine forest near our house./r/n 我们家附近有片松树林。/r/n They were pining for their homeland in Asia./r/n 他们思念着在亚洲的故乡。/r/n
I can see the small pinnacle from here./r/n 我能从这儿看到那个小尖塔。/r/n He has reached the pinnacle of his career./r/n 他已经登上事业的顶峰。/r/n
Bland vegetables are often served with a piquant sauce./r/n 清淡的蔬菜常以辛辣的沙司调味./r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．v（因自尊心受伤害而导致的)不悦、愤怒
RECORD.lx: She seemed rather piqued./r/n 她似乎很生气。/r/n When he realized nobody was listening to him, he left the room in a fit of pique./r/n 他发觉谁也没有听他讲话，一气之下就走了。/r/n
The sailor suddenly saw a pirate jumping onto the deck./r/n 那水手忽然看到一名海盗跳上了甲板。/r/n The design for the new dress collection is pirate in the far east./r/n 新式服装的系列设计在远东被非法翻印（剽窃）。/r/n
The runners were called back because one of them beat the pistol./r/n 赛跑运动员们被叫回来，因为他们中有一人抢跑了。/r/n A pistol shot rang out./r/n 响起了手枪的声音./r/n
Touch pitch, and you will be defiled./r/n 近朱者赤，近墨者黑。/r/n We planned to pitch our camps in the mountains./r/n 我们计划在山里扎营。/r/n
Touch pitch, and you will be defiled./r/n 近朱者赤，近墨者黑。/r/n We planned to pitch our camps in the mountains./r/n 我们计划在山里扎营。/r/n
Pitchers have ears./r/n （谚）隔墙有耳。/r/n Every morning I make a pitcher of ice tea./r/n 每天早晨我做一罐冰茶。/r/n
The road to the conquest of cancer is long and full of pitfall./r/n 战胜癌症的征途是漫长的，而且布满意想不到的困难。/r/n A concealed hole in the ground used as a trap; a pitfall./r/n 陷阱地上用做陷阱的隐藏的洞；陷阱/r/n
The pith of that theory is serving for people./r/n 那个理论的精髓是为人民服务。/r/n That was the pith of his argument./r/n 那就是他论据的要点。/r/n
A pithy comment./r/n 简练有力的一刻/r/n
That is the pivot of the whole argument./r/n 这是整个论据的关键。/r/n The whole discussion pivots on this one point./r/n 整个讨论内容均以此为中心。/r/n
The child had a placid disposition./r/n 这个孩子性情温和。/r/n His normally placid dog turned on him and bit him in the leg./r/n 他那条狗平日很温顺, 这次突然发作咬了他的腿./r/n
A great plague was then raging in the city./r/n 那时一场大瘟疫正在该城肆虐。/r/n The plague has broken out./r/n 突然发生了鼠疫。/r/n

The judge decided for/against the plaintiff./r/n 法官判决原告胜诉[败诉]./r/n Omission of a party, plaintiff, defendant, or cause of action that should have been included as a part of an action or a suit./r/n 应参加诉讼的当事人的不参预应该被包括在内作为一宗诉论或诉案的一部分的一方。原告、被告或诉讼的案件不履行法律责任/r/n
The song has plaintive melody./r/n 这首歌曲的曲调悲伤。/r/n I heard a plaintive cry./r/n 我听到一声悲伤的哭泣。/r/n
Her mother helped her to plait her hair./r/n 她的母亲帮她编辫子。/r/n She wore her hair in plaits./r/n 她把头发编成辫子。/r/n
Let's keep the conversation on a friendly plane./r/n 让我们友好地谈话。/r/n The quickest means of travel is by plane./r/n 最快的交通工具是飞机。/r/n
The deck of the sailing ship was made of thick planks./r/n 这艘帆船的甲板是用厚木板制作的。/r/n The party's main plank is reducing taxes./r/n 该党政纲的基点是减税。/r/n

Much to our surprise when the plankton entered the oyster tried very hard to expel the plankton. Within3-5 minutes, the movement of the heart became very abnormal and the oyster died at once./r/n 意想不到的是当浮游生物进入蚌体时，珠蚌的排异性非常强，3到5分钟之内，蚌的心脏运动异常并很快死亡。/r/n Plankton that remains free-swimming through all stages of its life cycle./r/n 终生浮游生物一种在其生命的所有阶段可自由游动的浮游生物/r/n
The doctor had to hold his broken arm with a plaster cast./r/n 医生不得不用石膏绷带来固定他断了的胳膊。/r/n The man looks like a cartoon character with a plaster on his temple./r/n 那人太阳穴上贴了一块膏药，看上去像个卡通人物。/r/n

The cracks in the ceiling have to be plastered up before you can start painting./r/n 在油漆天花板之前，先得用灰泥把裂缝填塞起来。/r/n The two decorators worked slowly to make mine that paint was plastered on the furniture evenly./r/n 两个装饰工人干得很慢，以确保家俱上的油漆被均匀地涂上。/r/n
Many items in daily use are made of plastic./r/n 很多日常生活用品是用塑料制成的。/r/n Plastic is sometimes used instead of leather./r/n 塑胶有时可以替代皮革。/r/n
It is their plasticity at certain temperatures that gives plastics their main advantage over many other materials./r/n 正是在一定温度下塑料所具有的塑性使它比其他许多材料更优越。/r/n
Sales have now reached a plateau./r/n 销售现已开始停滞不前。/r/n After a period of rapid inflation, price have now reach a plateau./r/n 经急剧通货膨胀之後物价现已趋於平稳。/r/n
A commonplace remark or notion; a platitude./r/n 陈词滥调陈腐庸俗的话或想法；陈词滥调/r/n It's no more than a platitude./r/n 无非是老生常谈。/r/n

I often go out with Cynthia but it's purely Platonic love between us./r/n 我经常和辛西娅外出，但那纯粹是精神上的相爱。/r/n Existing as an archetype or pattern, especially as a Platonic idea or perception./r/n 观念的，理念的以原型或固定形式出现的，特指柏拉图哲学中的观点或概念/r/n

The plausible talk of a crafty salesperson./r/n 诡计多端的推销员的花言巧语/r/n He trotted out a most plausible story, but most of us were inclined to doubt the truth of it./r/n 他提出了一个听起来很有道理的说法，但我们大多数人对此都持怀疑态度。/r/n

This playwright is very popular now./r/n 这位剧作家现在很受欢迎。/r/n The legal right granted to an author, a composer, a playwright, a publisher, or a distributor to exclusive publication, production, sale, or distribution of a literary, musical, dramatic, or artistic work./r/n 版权授予文学、音乐、戏剧或艺术作品的作者、作曲者、剧作者、出版商或独家经营出版、生产或销售的批发商的合法权利/r/n
We've booked you in at the Plaza for two nights./r/n 我们为你在普拉扎旅馆预订了两夜的房间./r/n
The girl charged with murder was said to be mad and unfit to plead./r/n 据说那个被指控谋杀的女孩是疯子，不能为自己申辩。/r/n Pleading ignorance of the law won't help you if you are caught./r/n 假若因犯法被抓住，藉口不知是犯法亦无济於事。/r/n
Press the pleats flat./r/n 把褶子熨平./r/n Accordion pleats; accordion blinds./r/n 褶状的裙边；褶状的遮阳物/r/n
This book has plebeian tastes./r/n 这本书有庸俗的味道。/r/n He was born of plebeian origins./r/n 他出身平民。/r/n
The report contained a plethora of detail./r/n 报告中细节过多./r/n
Pliable or impressionable./r/n 顺从的或易受影响的/r/n Capable of being bent or flexed; pliable./r/n 柔软的可弯曲或扭曲的；柔韧的/r/n
We plodded on through the rain for several hours./r/n 我们在雨中跋涉了几个小时。/r/n Labourers plodded home through the muddy fields./r/n 工人们穿过泥泞的田地走回家去。/r/n
I grow potatoes on my little plot of land./r/n 我在那一小块地上种土豆。/r/n They are plotting how to murder him./r/n 他们在密谋如何杀害他。/r/n
A maneuver, stratagem, or ploy, especially one used at an initial stage./r/n 策略尤指人在开始阶段所采用的计谋、策略、手法/r/n His ploy is to pretend to be ill./r/n 他的手法就是装病。/r/n
He plucked a rose for his lover./r/n 他为情人摘了一朵玫瑰花。/r/n She showed a lot of pluck in dealing with the intruders./r/n 她对付那些闯入的歹徒表现得十分勇敢。/r/n
Some plumage dropped from the bird./r/n 从鸟身上掉下来几根羽毛。/r/n Have you seen the brightly-coloured plumage of tropical birds?/r/n 你见过热带鸟类色彩斑斓的羽毛吗？/r/n
We begin to plumb the mysteries of the universe./r/n 我们开始探索宇宙的奥秘。/r/n He is just plumb crazy./r/n 他真是疯了。/r/n
He does not plume himself on these achievements./r/n 他并不因这些成就而自夸。/r/n Resembling a feather or plume./r/n 似羽毛的类似羽毛或大羽的/r/n
House prices have plummeted in this area./r/n 此地房价大跌./r/n Share price plummet or plunge on the news of the devaluation./r/n 一有贬值的消息，股票价格就暴跌了。/r/n
The ducklings plumped into the water./r/n 小鸭们突然跳进水中。/r/n He switched on the light and plumped up the cushions./r/n 他打开了灯，拍松了靠垫。/r/n
He escaped with his plunder./r/n 他带着赃物逃跑了。/r/n The enemy plundered the village./r/n 敌人抢劫村庄。/r/n
Made of or covered with plush./r/n 丝绒制的由长毛绒制成的或覆盖的/r/n
I plied him with questions about his novel./r/n 我就他的小说向他提问。/r/n This ship plies between London and Australia./r/n 这艘船定期往返于伦敦和澳大利亚之间。/r/n
Take care of getting pneumonia./r/n 小心得肺炎。/r/n He was indebted to her for nursing him through pneumonia./r/n 他感激她护理好了他的肺炎。/r/n
This kind of pea has a long pod./r/n 这种豌豆长着长豆荚。/r/n He is podding peas./r/n 他正在剥豌豆。/r/n
The speaker has to ad- lib his speech when his papers suddenly blow off the podium./r/n 当演讲稿突然掉下台时，演讲者不得不现编词。/r/n Blacked out at the podium./r/n 在指挥台上晕倒/r/n
The pointer flickered./r/n 指示针来回摆动。/r/n A graduated surface or face on which a measurement, such as speed, is indicated by a moving needle or pointer./r/n 标度盘有刻度的表面或面，在上面由活动的指针或指示器表示度量衡，比如温度/r/n
He poised the glass on the shelf./r/n 他把玻璃杯稳稳地放在架子上。/r/n We admired the graceful poise of the dancer./r/n 我们很欣赏那位舞蹈演员的优美舞姿。/r/n
He is poking the fire with a poker./r/n 他正用通条捅火。/r/n She poked her finger into the hole./r/n 她把手指插入孔中。/r/n
An instrument used to measure the rotation of the plane of polarization of polarized light passing through an optical structure or sample./r/n 偏振计；旋光计用来测量经过光学结构或样品的极化光的偏振平面旋转的一种仪器/r/n
He launched into a fierce polemic against the government's policies./r/n 他猛烈地抨击政府的政策./r/n
I polished my buttons with a handkerchief./r/n 我用手帕把钮扣擦亮。/r/n With this polish you can give a good high gloss to the wood./r/n 使用这种上光蜡可使木器表面极为光亮平滑。/r/n
There is a high pollen count in the air./r/n 空气中有很高的花粉计数。/r/n Anther is a part of a flower that contains the pollen./r/n 花药是花的雄蕊上带花粉的部分。/r/n

Even in closely contested elections, most of the pollsters have called the winners, often by margins close to vote tally. And the pollsters who missed were off by a hair./r/n 即使在胜负极为接近的选举当中，多数民意测验人员都测出了胜利者。胜负差距往往与点票结果接近。测验失误的人也所差微乎其微。/r/n

Mr.Gorbachev and his reformist Kremlin allies are prepared to tolerate, even encourage, moderate nationalists who challenge central control and demand autonomy. But Moscow rightly feels that, in a polyglot country with102 different nationalities, ethnic violence is beyond the pale./r/n 戈尔巴乔夫和他克里姆林宫改革派盟友们，准备容忍，甚至鼓励温和的民族主义分子向中央控制挑战并要求独立。可是莫斯科自有理由觉得：在一个操多种语言，由102个民族组成的国家里，族裔之间的暴力则属过分。/r/n
The king was crowned with great pomp./r/n 国王加冕，典礼极为壮观。/r/n Give me health a day, and I will make the pomp of emperor ridiculous./r/n 只要给我一天的健康，我会使皇帝的荣华变得荒谬可笑。/r/n
We should be modest, not be pompous./r/n 我们应该谦虚，不应该自大。/r/n He is a pompous official./r/n 他是个自命不凡的官员。/r/n
He pondered for some minutes before giving an answer./r/n 他思考了几分钟才作答复。/r/n They are pondering moving their offices outside London./r/n 他们正在考虑把办事处搬出伦敦。/r/n
I don't like his ponderous style of writing./r/n 我不喜欢他冗长乏味的文风。/r/n The elephant lowered its ponderous body into the water./r/n 大象把它那笨重的身躯浸入水里。/r/n
Rhett bought his daughter a pony to ride on./r/n 瑞德给他的女儿买了一匹小马来骑。/r/n Where do you stable your pony?/r/n 你那匹矮种马养在哪儿?/r/n
He had the support of large sections of the populace./r/n 他获得大多数民众的支持。/r/n The populace at large are opposed to sudden change./r/n 人民群众普遍反对突然实行的变革。/r/n
We live in a populous area near the coast./r/n 我们生活在沿海人口稠密的地区。/r/n
There is a porcelain figure on the table./r/n 桌子上有一个瓷像。/r/n The museum displays the specimen of ancient Chinese porcelain./r/n 这个博物馆展出中国古瓷器标本。/r/n
The hunter seized a porcupine./r/n 猎人捕获了一只豪猪。/r/n
In hot weather cloths made of a porous material like cotton are best./r/n 热天穿棉布之类有渗透性的材料制成的衣服最为适宜。/r/n He added sand to the soil to make it more porous./r/n 他往土里掺了些沙子以提高渗水性能。/r/n
Portable telephones are very popular nowadays./r/n 现今，移动电话非常普及。/r/n The new portable computers are going like hot cakes./r/n 新的便携式计算机卖得很快./r/n
His silence portends trouble./r/n 他沉默不语不是好兆头。/r/n It portends we are in danger./r/n 这预示我们陷入危险。/r/n
A sign of a future happening; a portent./r/n 前兆表明将来要发生的事情的现象；预兆/r/n Signs full of portent./r/n 充满凶兆的现象/r/n
I see a portentous thing to come./r/n 我预感不祥的事情要来到了。/r/n

A mathematical measure of the sensitivity of rates of return on a portfolio or a given stock compared with rates of return on the market as a whole. A high degree of such sensitivity indicates moderate or high price volatility./r/n 证券的β因素一种数学手段，对某有价证券或某种给定股票的回报率与整个市场回报率相比的敏感性进行测量。这种高程度敏感性表明其价位处于中度或高度易变状态/r/n He went through drawer after drawer and eventually searched out a dusty portfolio./r/n 他一个一个抽屉查找，后来终于找出了一份沾满灰尘的文件夹。/r/n
All the subjects are well posed./r/n 所有的东西都摆好了位置。/r/n The artist posed his model carefully./r/n 这个艺术家仔细地把他的模型放好。/r/n
Some people admired him greatly while others considered him a poseur./r/n 有的人对他佩服得五体投地, 而有的人则认为他装腔作势./r/n
In1909 Russia possessed over41000 miles of railway./r/n 1909年俄国有41000多英里的铁路。/r/n The police asked me if I possessed a gun./r/n 警察问我是否有枪。/r/n
It is a posterior view of the skull./r/n 这是颅骨背视图。/r/n The condition of being posterior in location or time./r/n 在后在位置上或时间上较靠后的状况/r/n
He left behind an immortal example to all posterity./r/n 他给后世留下了不朽的典范。/r/n He will be greater to posterity if he have be willing to be less great./r/n 如果他不自命不凡，那么对子孙后代来说，他就会更加伟大。/r/n
Dead men hear no tales; posthumous fame is an Irish bull./r/n 死人无耳，死后的名声等于风马牛。/r/n

He postulated that a cure for the disease will have been found by the year 2000./r/n 他推断到2000年能研究出治愈该病的方法./r/n The school building programme postulates an increase in educational investment./r/n 修建校舍的计画是在增加教育经费的前提下拟定的./r/n
One wonders also why Nature, with some snakes concocted poison of such extreme potency./r/n 人们也不知道大自然为何在一些蛇身上调制出这样高效的毒液来。/r/n
I was convinced by his potent arguments./r/n 他那有力的论据把我说服了。/r/n Potent liquor; a potent toxin./r/n 有效力的酒；有效力的毒素/r/n
People rose up against the despotic rule of their potentate./r/n 人们起来反抗君主的专制统治。/r/n
Those schoolboys like to play pranks on their teachers./r/n 那些小学生们喜欢作弄他们的老师。/r/n A playful or amusing act; a prank./r/n 诙谐开玩笑或滑稽的动作；开玩笑/r/n
Listen to him prating on about nothing./r/n 听他瞎唠叨./r/n I don't want to invest all my money in this business; it would mean prating all my eggs in one basket./r/n 我不想把所有的钱都投资在这项生意上，那是孤注一掷的做法。/r/n
The baby is prattling away happily in her cot./r/n 那幼儿在小床上呀呀自语，快活得很。/r/n She prattles on about the village gossip./r/n 她闲扯些村里的事。/r/n
The priest preached a sermon on the need of charity./r/n 牧师在布道会上宣讲慈爱的必要。/r/n Those people go around preaching revolution./r/n 那些人到处宣扬革命。/r/n
He launched into his statement without any preamble./r/n 他开门见山地发表言论./r/n He spoke without preamble./r/n 他没有开场白地讲起来。/r/n
She makes a rather precarious living as a novelist./r/n 作为小说家，她过着不太稳定的生活./r/n He was unable to get down from his precarious position on the rocks./r/n 他无法从岩石危险的位置上下来。/r/n
He came in, preceded by his wife./r/n 他和他的妻子一前一后地走了进来。/r/n He preceded his speech with a few words of welcome the special guests./r/n 他在演讲之前先说了几句对特邀来宾表示欢迎的话。/r/n

This intervention in another nation's affairs has set a precedent which we hope other countries will not follow./r/n 对别国事物的这种干涉开了一个先例，我们希望其他国家不要模仿。/r/n This decision creates a dangerous precedent./r/n 这个决定开创了一个危险的先例。/r/n
Example is better than precept./r/n st. 以身作则胜于口头教诲./r/n Just follow these few basic precepts and you won't go far wrong in life./r/n 只要按这几条格言行事，你一生就不会出大错。/r/n
In 1939 everyone felt Europe was on the edge of the precipice./r/n 在1939年，当时人人都感到欧洲处于极度危险的境地。/r/n Do not seat your love upon a precipice because it is high./r/n 不要因为峭壁是高的，便让你的爱情坐在峭壁上。/r/n
Fears about the solvency of the banks precipitated the great economic crash./r/n 对银行偿付能力出现恐慌更加速了经济的崩溃。/r/n They acted with precipitate haste./r/n 他们鲁莽仓促地采取了行动。/r/n

There will be precipitation on northern hills tonight./r/n 今夜北部山区有降雪。/r/n The treatment of metal or the separation of metal from ores and ore concentrates by liquid processes, such as leaching, extraction, and precipitation./r/n 水冶金术通过液体过程，象过滤，提炼，沉淀等方法处理金属，从矿石中或矿石浓缩物中分离出金属/r/n
We have a precipitous climb to the peak./r/n 我们向着陡峭山顶攀登。/r/n A precipitous path led down the mountainside./r/n 沿着山腰下来有一条陡峭的山路。/r/n
That will preclude him from escaping./r/n 那将阻止他逃走，那将使他无法逃走。/r/n My present finances preclude the possibility of buying a car./r/n 按我目前的财务状况我是不可能买车的。/r/n
His son is a precocious child who could play the piano at the age of three./r/n 他的儿子是一个三岁就能弹奏钢琴的早慧儿童。/r/n That child is far too precocious./r/n 孩子过于老成。/r/n
Common preconceptions about life in this district are increasingly being challenged./r/n 原先普遍存在著对那一地区生活的成见越来越站不住脚了./r/n

The precursor of the modern car was a horseless carriage with a petrol engine./r/n 现代汽车的前身是不用马拉的，装有汽油发动机的车子。/r/n British poet considered a precursor of romanticism. His best-known work, The Task(1785), praises rural life and leisure./r/n 科伯，威廉1731－1800英国诗人，被认为是浪漫主义的先锋。他的最杰出的作品任务赞美了农村生活和休闲/r/n

Young birds are very vulnerable to predators./r/n 幼小的鸟易受食肉动物伤害./r/n Cats are warm and affectionate creatures to us, but viewed through the eyes of birds and mice they are vicious predators./r/n 对我们来说，猫是热情又充满深情的动物，但是在鸟儿和老鼠看来，猫是恶毒的食肉动物。/r/n
It seemed that his failure was predestined./r/n 他的失败似乎是命中注定的./r/n She was obviously predestined to succeed./r/n 她显然注定了能成功./r/n
Your refusal puts me in an awkward predicament./r/n 你的拒绝让我感到十分为难。/r/n A loan of money would help me out of my predicament./r/n 只需一笔贷款就能帮我摆脱困境。/r/n
I knew you'd say that you're so predictable!/r/n 我早就知道你会这样说--果不其然!/r/n
A strong predilection for anything French./r/n 法国狂偏爱一切法国事物的强烈偏见/r/n
An antibody found in the blood of individuals having a genetic predisposition to allergies such as asthma and hay fever./r/n 反应素个体血液中的一种抗体，可以对诸如气喘病和光粉热这些变态反应产生预先的基因处理/r/n
Her predominant characteristic is honesty./r/n 她最为突出的特点是诚实。/r/n Which country is the predominant member of the alliance?/r/n 哪个国家在联盟中居于支配地位？/r/n
The council found that their traffic plans had been preempted by a government decision./r/n 市议会发现他们的交通规划已因政府先行作了决定而无法推行。/r/n
He's always preening himself on his success./r/n 他总是对自己的成功沾沾自喜。/r/n She preened herself upon her beauty./r/n 她为自已的美貌感到自满。/r/n
She prefaced her remarks with a few words of welcome to the guest./r/n 她先讲了几句对客人表示欢迎的话作为开场白。/r/n The preface of this diary recounted her life./r/n 这本日记的前言叙述了她的生活。/r/n
You are advised not to smoke during pregnancy./r/n 怀孕期间你最好不要吸烟。/r/n This is her first pregnancy./r/n 这是她第一次怀孕。/r/n
His words were followed by a pregnant pause./r/n 他说完话，接着是一段意味深长的停顿。/r/n She got pregnant and was turned out of the house by her parents./r/n 她怀孕了, 父母把她赶出了家门./r/n
A trial that becomes invalid because of basic prejudicial error in procedure./r/n 无效审判由于审判过程中根本性的偏见性错误而变得无效的审判/r/n
The lines form a prelude to his long narrative poem./r/n 这几行诗是他那长篇叙事诗的序诗./r/n The bankruptcy of several small firms was the prelude to general economic collapse./r/n 几家小商行倒闭了, 随之而来的是经济大萧条./r/n
A premeditated crime./r/n 有预谋的犯罪/r/n The crime was premeditated./r/n 犯罪是预谋好的。/r/n
We went to the premiere of their new presentation./r/n 我们去观看了他们的新剧目的首场演出。/r/n A galaxy of film stars attended the premiere./r/n 一群影星参加了首次公演。/r/n
The annual premium on my policy is 3000 yuan./r/n 我的保险单每年的保险费是三千元。/r/n The examiners put a premium on rational argument./r/n 评委们对以理服人的论据给以高度评价。/r/n

Deep in thought and heedless of present circumstances or activities; preoccupied./r/n 心不在焉的，茫然的陷入沉思且未注意到周围的情况或活动的；出神的/r/n Health worries preoccupied him for the whole holiday./r/n 整个假期里他一直为健康状况而担忧./r/n
Christians preponderate in the population of that part of the country./r/n 基督教徒在该国那一地区的人口中居多./r/n

Clean clothes and good manners are prepossessing./r/n 清洁的衣服和良好的举止能给人以好感。/r/n Perhaps the least prepossessing quality of Fox was that he cares too much about the ephemeral in politics: and Ford displays excessive zeal, to my mind, in teasing out these cares to the last twist and turn./r/n 也许福克斯最不逗人喜欢的一点就是他把短促的政治生命看得过于重了。而在我看来，福特在诱使福克斯说出他的这些关心时显得过分热情，手法千奇百怪，使尽了手段。/r/n
They are asking a preposterous price for the work./r/n 他们为该作品漫天要价。/r/n The result is preposterous./r/n 结果很可笑。/r/n
A sense of humour is prerequisite to understanding her work./r/n 要理解她的作品就必须具有幽默感。/r/n Good muscles are one of the prerequisites of physical fitness./r/n 肌肉发达是身体健康的一个必备条件./r/n
It's the Prime Minister's prerogative to decide when to call an election./r/n 决定大选的日期是首相的特权。/r/n A monarch has the prerogative of mercy for criminals./r/n 君主享有对罪犯的赦免权。/r/n
The clouds presage a storm./r/n 乌云预示着暴风雨的到来。/r/n Suddenly he had a presage about the near danger./r/n 他突然对即将到来的危险有了一种预感。/r/n

Having no prescribed destination. Used of mail./r/n 无姓名和地址的没有规定的目的地。用于邮政/r/n The act of adjusting, arranging, or shifting characters to the left or right to fit a prescribed pattern./r/n 为了适合规定的格式，将字符向左或向右进行调整、排列或移位的动作。/r/n
The doctor is writing a prescription./r/n 医生正在开处方。/r/n The prescription of drugs is a doctor's responsibility./r/n 开药方是医生的职责。/r/n
I think these interesting old customs should be preserved./r/n 我认为这些有趣的旧习俗应该保存下去。/r/n It's the duty of the police to preserve the public order./r/n 维护公共秩序是警察的职责。/r/n

For the first, the best preservative to keep the mind in health, is the faithful admonition of a friend./r/n 说到第一种，最能保人心神之健康的预防药就是朋友的忠言规谏。/r/n Salt is a common food preservative./r/n 盐是一种常用的食物防腐剂。/r/n
Some people believe that the Fates preside over man's destiny./r/n 有些人相信，命运之神支配人类的命运。/r/n The hostess presided at table with tact and urbanity./r/n 女主人招待客人进餐时风雅而又得体。/r/n
Press this button to start the engine./r/n 按这个按钮开动引擎。/r/n The child pressed her nose against the window./r/n 那小女孩把鼻子贴在窗户上。/r/n
I just turn the piece of wire in the lock and hey presto, the door open./r/n 我把金属丝伸到锁孔里一拧，嘿，那门就开了。/r/n
The presumable result is an election defeat./r/n 推测结果是竞选可能会失败。/r/n

The article has too many false presumptions./r/n 这篇文章中凭空臆测的东西太多。/r/n She was infuriated by his presumption in making the travel arrangements without first consulting her./r/n 他事先没有和她商量便作好旅行安排，她对他自作主张很生气。/r/n
I dislike that presumptuous young man./r/n 我不喜欢那个自以为是的年轻人。/r/n Having or showing excessive and arrogant self-confidence; presumptuous./r/n 冒昧的，放肆的拥有或显示过分的或傲慢的自信的；自行其事的/r/n
Bail was refused on the presupposition of his guilt./r/n 已料到他罪名成立而不准保释./r/n You have made several unjustified presuppositions./r/n 你作了一些毫无根据的假设./r/n
You can't keep up the pretence any longer./r/n 你不能再假装下去了。/r/n Don't listen to his pretences; he is lying./r/n 别听他的种种藉口，他在撒谎。/r/n
He is nothing but a hypocrite, pretending that he knows nothing about it./r/n 他是一个虚伪的人，假装对那件事一无所知。/r/n The young actor pretended to be Hamlet./r/n 那个年轻演员扮演哈姆雷特。/r/n
He has no pretensions to being an expert on the subject./r/n 他并不以这方面专家自居。/r/n His social pretensions make him appear ridiculous./r/n 他冒充上流社会人士而出尽洋相。/r/n
One who is insincere or pretentious./r/n 伪君子虚伪或自负的人/r/n Striving to be modern in appearance or style but lacking taste or refinement; pretentious./r/n 做作地追求现代的力求具有现代样式或外观但不雅观或缺少品味的；自命不凡的/r/n
We'll have to find a pretext for not going to the party./r/n 我们得找个借口不去参加聚会。/r/n He came to see me on the pretext of asking my advice./r/n 他以请我指教为借口来看我。/r/n
Misty weather prevails in this part of the country./r/n 该国的这一地区天气多雾。/r/n Sadness prevailed in our mind./r/n 我们的心中充满悲痛，/r/n
Product buy- back is a prevailing payment term at present./r/n 产品回购是目前流行的一种付款方式。/r/n Being in or conforming to the prevailing or current fashion; stylish./r/n 流行的符合流行的或现时的式样的；时髦的/r/n
Eye diseases are prevalent in some tropical countries./r/n 在一些热带国家，眼疾很流行。/r/n The prevalent opinion is in favour of reform./r/n 一般舆论都支持改革./r/n
Tell us exactly what happened and don't prevaricate./r/n 有什麽就原原本本地告诉我们吧, 别躲躲闪闪的./r/n Instead of admit his guilt, he prevaricate./r/n 他不但不承认，反而支吾其词。/r/n
Cares preyed upon her health./r/n 忧虑损害了她的健康。/r/n The lion seized its prey and ate it./r/n 狮子抓住猎物，把它吃了。/r/n
She pricked herself on a needle./r/n 她被针扎了一下。/r/n He felt a sharp prick when he stepped on a upturned nail./r/n 他一脚踩在一枚尖头朝上的钉子上，感到一阵剧痛。/r/n
The woollen cloth prickles (my skin)./r/n 穿毛料衣服（使我的皮肤）有被扎的感觉./r/n My scalp began to prickle as I realized the horrible truth./r/n 我了解到了那令人恐惧的事实, 顿时感到不寒而栗./r/n
Bearing or covered with spines or bristles; prickly./r/n 棘皮的具有或覆盖有针或刺的；多刺的/r/n The child's rubber ball punctured when it fell on a prickly bush./r/n 那小孩的皮球落在带刺的树丛上时被戳破了。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．自以为比别人更有道德的人
RECORD.lx: Charles thinks he's better than the rest of us, the self-righteous prig!/r/n 查尔斯认为他比我们大家都强，真是个自以为是的家伙！/r/n
You can't tell that joke to her she's much too prim and proper./r/n 可别给她讲那样的笑话--她这人过於古板和认真./r/n Prim and sedate./r/n 严肃沉闷的/r/n
The office, rank, or province of primate./r/n 首席主教（或都主教，大主教）的职责，阶层或教区/r/n The human being is a primate./r/n 人类是灵长类动物/r/n
A coat of primer should be made over the bare surface before the main painting./r/n 在喷涂主漆前，应在物品的表面刷一层底漆。/r/n Children learn knowledge from primers./r/n 孩子们从启蒙书上学习知识。/r/n
The primeval chaos out of which it was believed that the earth and sky were formed./r/n 混沌，洪荒原始的混沌状态，据信地球和天空由此形成/r/n Being first in time; original; primeval./r/n 最初的，原始的；远古的/r/n
Primitive man made himself primitive tools from sharp stones and animal bones./r/n 原始人用尖石块和兽骨为自己制作原始的工具。/r/n Small seashells were often used as a primitive kind of money./r/n 小贝壳常被用作简单的货币。/r/n
Play a primordial role./r/n 担任主要角色/r/n Life's primordial reality is spirit./r/n 生命的根本真实性是精神。/r/n
They paid me the princely sum of USD5000./r/n 他们慷慨地给我5000美元。/r/n That's a princely state./r/n 那是一个国王统治的国家。/r/n
I have priority over you in my claim./r/n 我的请求比你的优先。/r/n Rebuilding the area is a (top) priority./r/n 重建这一地区是当务之急./r/n
Pristine mountain snow./r/n 山上洁白的雪/r/n
It would be the greatest imaginable privation for her to have to leave London./r/n 对她来说, 不得不离开伦敦大概是能想像到的最大的损失./r/n She didn'tfind the lack of a car any great privation./r/n 她觉得没有汽车并非重大缺憾./r/n
It was a privilege to work with him./r/n 和他在一起工作是一项殊荣。/r/n She had led a life of luxury and privilege./r/n 她过著养尊处优的生活。/r/n

The Probation Officer got Andrew a job in the paper-mills and arranged board and lodging for him in the Working Boys’ hostel./r/n 缓刑犯监视员在纸厂里替安德鲁找到一份工作，并在职工宿舍安排了他的膳宿。/r/n The status of a person on probation./r/n 察看在服缓刑（或在受察看）的状况/r/n

Information about Venus obtained by Russian probes has been published on some magazines./r/n 许多杂志发表了由俄国航天探测器获得的有关金星的信息。/r/n The journalist was probing into several financial scandals./r/n 那记者正在调查几起财务丑闻。/r/n
The journalist was probing into several financial scandals./r/n 那记者正在调查几起财务丑闻。/r/n He was asking probing questions./r/n 他提出了一些盘根究底的问题。/r/n
Nobility of mind; probity./r/n 心灵的高贵；正直/r/n
Proceeds from the concert will go to charity./r/n 音乐会的收入将捐赠给慈善事业./r/n Most people sell their souls and live with a good conscience on the proceeds./r/n 大多数的人在出卖了自己的灵魂之后，就凭那收入过其心安理得的日子。/r/n
The troops walked in procession through the street./r/n 军队排成队伍走过街道。/r/n There was a bomb scare during the procession./r/n 在列队行进时因怀疑有炸弹而引起恐慌./r/n
He procrastinated until it was too late to do anything at all./r/n 他因循坐误, 一事无成./r/n
I hate the prodigal administration./r/n 我痛恨铺张浪费的行政机关。/r/n Those prodigals were put into prison./r/n 那些挥霍者被关进监狱。/r/n
We are all overwhelmed by his prodigious memory./r/n 我们都被他那惊人的记忆力折服了。/r/n That boxer is a prodigious feed./r/n 那个拳击家是个大肚汉。/r/n
A child prodigy./r/n 神童，少年天才/r/n Something amazing or marvelous; a prodigy./r/n 异常的人或事；奇异的事/r/n
His profane language annoyed us./r/n 他亵渎的言语激怒了我们。/r/n The soldiers profaned the church./r/n 士兵们玷污了教堂。/r/n
He uttered a stream of profanities./r/n 他说出了一连串下流话./r/n
She proffered him her resignation./r/n 她向他递交了辞呈。/r/n I gave her a proffer of help./r/n 我给了她一个援助性的建议。/r/n
The state or quality of being proficient; competence./r/n 熟练，精通熟练的性质或状态；内行/r/n After reading this book, you will be proficient in writing./r/n 读完这本书, 你会精于写作。/r/n
The government is trying to keep a low profile on this issue./r/n 政府力图在这个问题上保持低姿态。/r/n The huge trees were profiled against the night sky./r/n 在夜空的映衬下显出大树的轮廓。/r/n
Rent controls were introduced to prevent profiteering./r/n 为了防止牟取暴利而 实行了租金管制./r/n
One who wastes, especially one who wastes money; a profligate./r/n 浪费者浪费之人，尤指浪费钱财的人；败家子/r/n
He impressed his audience by the profundity of his knowledge./r/n 他知识渊博给听众留下了深刻的印象./r/n He impress his audience by the profundity of his knowledge./r/n 他知识渊博给听众留下了深刻的印象。/r/n
There are profuse blossoms./r/n 那儿有很多花朵。/r/n He made profuse apologies./r/n 他再三道歉。/r/n
Hundreds of flowers are blooming in profusion./r/n 百花怒放。/r/n The weeds grew in wanton profusion./r/n 遍地野草丛生./r/n
Marx is the progenitor of Communism./r/n 马克思是共产主义的创始人./r/n It is said that our progenitors are monkeys./r/n 据说我们的祖先是猴子。/r/n
He appeared, surrounded by his numerous progeny./r/n 他出现时，子女前呼后拥不计其数。/r/n
The prohibitive favorite to win the nomination./r/n 得到绝大多数投票获得提名/r/n The cost of travel to the far east is prohibitive./r/n 到远东旅游的费用高的令人不敢问津。/r/n
A whistling sound, as of an animal or a projectile./r/n 啭鸣声尖厉高音，如动物或发射物而发出的声音/r/n Such a projectile in a metal casing; a cartridge./r/n 弹药（筒）装在金属盒中的射弹。弹药/r/n
Our friend ship is built on proletarian, internationalism./r/n 我们的友谊是建立在无产阶级国际主义之上的。/r/n Proletarian revolutionaries always cleave to Marxist-Leninist principles./r/n 无产阶级革命者永远忠于马列主义的原则。/r/n
Apple trees are prolific./r/n 苹果树是多产植物。/r/n Last year was a prolific period in the composer's life./r/n 去年是作曲家一生中创作丰收的时期。/r/n
He began his prologue by saying "good night"./r/n 他以“晚上好”开始了他的开场白。/r/n The signing of the agreement was a prologue to better relations between the two countries./r/n 签定这一协议是两国关系加强的序幕。/r/n

The meeting may be prolonged into the evening because so many problems have to be solved tonight./r/n 会议可能要延长到夜里，因为今晚有太多问题要解决。/r/n How can we endeavor to prolong the brevity of human life?/r/n 我们怎样才能延长短促的人生？/r/n
After prolonged questioning, she finally confessed./r/n 她受到长时间的盘问之後，终於承认了。/r/n The crowd burst into prolonged cheering./r/n 人群中爆发出长时间的欢呼声。/r/n
He promenaded along the beach with his wife./r/n 他和妻子沿着海滩散步。/r/n She promenaded the children along the sea front after lunch./r/n 她午饭後领著孩子们沿著海滨区散步。/r/n
A person regarded as promiscuous./r/n 淫棍被认为性关系混乱的人/r/n A promiscuous man; a philanderer./r/n 好色者好色的男人；玩弄女性的男人/r/n
His evasive reply prompted me to ask him another question./r/n 他的含糊其词的答复促使我提出又一个问题。/r/n She's always prompt to criticize other people's ideas./r/n 她对别人想出的主意总是迫不及待地批评。/r/n
He did it without any prompting from me./r/n 他做这事完全不用我督促。/r/n The act of prompting or giving a cue./r/n 提醒，暗示提醒或给予暗示的行为/r/n
The king promulgate a decree./r/n 国王颁布了一项命令。/r/n
They stepped over his prone body./r/n 他们从他俯卧的身体上踩过去。/r/n People are more prone to make mistakes when they are tired./r/n 人们疲劳时更容易出差错。/r/n

The two words are spelled differently, but pronounced the same./r/n 这两个字拼写不同, 但发音相同./r/n Pronounced with the tongue in a middle position, neither high nor low, as the a in around./r/n 中性音的发音时舌头位于中间位置的，即不高也不低，如：around中的a音/r/n
It is not the government's policy to prop up declining industries./r/n 资助不景气的工业不是政府的政策。/r/n The invalid lay propped on the pillows./r/n 那病弱者倚靠在枕头上。/r/n
Most plants propagate by seed./r/n 大多数植物靠种子繁殖。/r/n They started a newspaper to propagate their ideas./r/n 他们办了一份报纸来宣传他们的主张。/r/n
His addiction to drugs propelled him towards a life of crime./r/n 他吸毒成瘾使他走上了犯罪的道路。/r/n We are propelled to go forward./r/n 我们被推着向前走。/r/n

Can you free the propeller from the weeds?/r/n 你能把螺旋桨上的草除掉吗?/r/n The distance that a propeller would travel in an ideal medium during one complete revolution, measured parallel to the shaft of the propeller./r/n 推进器转一圈的距离飞机螺旋桨旋转一次的前移距离，以其与螺旋桨相平行的距离衡量/r/n

A propensity for being displeased with anything that is not perfect or does not meet extremely high standards./r/n 完美主义对于任何不完美或未达到最高标准的事都有不满意的倾向/r/n A disposition to feel, do, or say; a propensity./r/n 意向感觉、做或说的意向；倾向/r/n
A prophylactic agent, device, or measure, such as a vaccine or drug./r/n 预防剂预防性的物质、器具或措施，比如疫苗或药物/r/n
The neighbours lived in close propinquity toeach other./r/n 这些邻居住得很近./r/n
They offered sacrifices to propitiate the gods./r/n 他们供奉祭品以求神息怒./r/n
It was not a propitious time to start a new business./r/n 这个时候开张不吉利。/r/n The circumstances were not propitious for further expansion of the company./r/n 这些情况不利于公司的进一步发展。/r/n
A closet proponent of a tax increase; a closet alcoholic./r/n 增加税收的私下倡议者；私下酗酒者/r/n One who originates or is the chief proponent of a heresy or heretical movement./r/n 异端创始或领导人异端邪说或运动的发起者或主要倡导者/r/n
One granted ownership of a proprietary colony./r/n 领主独占某殖民地所有权的人/r/n A proprietary hospital./r/n 一家私人医院/r/n
The way these tourists dress offends local standards of propriety./r/n 这些游客的穿着在当地人的眼中简直不成体统。/r/n We should observe the proprieties./r/n 我们应该遵守礼节。/r/n

This aircraft works by jet propulsion./r/n 这架飞机是喷气推进的。/r/n A part or surface, such as a wing, propeller blade, or rudder, whose shape and orientation control stability, direction, lift, thrust, or propulsion./r/n 翼剖面；机翼；翼面一个部件或平面，如机翼、螺旋桨叶、方向舵等，其形状或方位控制稳定性、方向、抬升、冲击或驱动/r/n
A quality or style that is prosaic./r/n 平淡无奇平凡的特点或风格/r/n The office seems so dull and prosaic after Pine Ridge./r/n 从松岭回来后，办公室似乎变得枯燥无味了。/r/n
The sale of narcotics is proscribed by law./r/n 法律禁止贩卖毒品./r/n
He was prosecuted for exceeding the speed limit./r/n 他被告发超速行驶。/r/n Trespassers will be prosecuted./r/n 闲人免进，违者必究。/r/n
The prosecutor brought an accusation of theft against him./r/n 检察官指控他偷窃。/r/n The incompatible offices of prosecutor and judge./r/n 检察官和法官的职位不能由一个人兼任/r/n
Tom is the prospective buyer of my house./r/n 汤姆是可能购买我的房屋的人。/r/n She is his prospective mother-in-law./r/n 她是他未来的岳母。/r/n

We hope to have a life of happiness and prosperity./r/n 我们希望拥有成功幸福的生活。/r/n The promise of prosperity in the United States encouraged many people to immigrate(that is, move to the United States)./r/n 兴旺发达的前景吸引了众多的移民到美国（也就是指，迁入了美国）/r/n
His business is prosperous./r/n 他的事业兴旺发达。/r/n The city at one time must have been prosperous, for It enjoyed a high level of civilization./r/n 这座古城在一个时期准是很繁荣的，因为它曾享有高度文明。/r/n
The principal character in opposition to the protagonist or hero of a narrative or drama./r/n 反面主角叙事文学或戏剧中与主人公或英雄相对立的主要人物/r/n
He protested his innocence./r/n 他声言自己无罪。/r/n They protested to the mayor that the taxes were too high./r/n 他们向市长提出抗议说税款过高。/r/n

A transmission control character used to indicate that one or more of the following bit patterns have no correct interpretations as characters in the code or link protocol of the system./r/n 一种传送控制字符，用于指明一个或多个后继的位模式不能正确地解释为系统编码或系统链路协议中的字符。/r/n Select the protocol tab and un-check all protocol except modem./r/n 选择Protocolstab，不要选取所有的协议，除Modem之外。/r/n
No matter how many prototype we make, we just can not get it right./r/n 不管做多少次样品，我们都无法获得满意的。/r/n An early form; a prototype./r/n 原形早期的形式；原形/r/n
Let's not protract the debate any further./r/n 我们不要再继续争论下去了./r/n
He managed to hang on to a piece of rock protruding from the cliff./r/n 他设法抓住了悬崖上向外伸出的岩石。/r/n Tending to protrude; protruding./r/n 突出的趋于伸出的；伸出的/r/n
A knob, knot, protuberance, or swelling./r/n 节，结，瘤球状物、结、节疤或肿瘤/r/n A rounded protuberance formed by the bones in a joint./r/n （屈指时）指节膨出部关节中由骨头形成的圆形突出物/r/n
The act of attributing, especially of establishing a particular person, place, or time as the creator, provenance, or era of a work of art./r/n 归属指归属的行为，尤指将一艺术作品的创作者、地域或时代归属为一特定人物、地点或时间/r/n
Some of the farmers had been provident in the good years but others were ruined by the bad harvests./r/n 有些农民在丰年节衣缩食有备无患, 但也有些农民由於歉收而陷入绝境./r/n
We admired his intellectual providence to acquire vast stores of dry information./r/n 我们钦佩他收集大量原始资料的远见卓识。/r/n It seemed like providence that they had survived the plane crash./r/n 他们幸免于空难似乎是天意。/r/n
His articles are published on the provincial newspaper./r/n 他的文章在省报上发表了。/r/n The man displayed provincial attitudes towards the theatre./r/n 这个人显示出对戏剧界的守旧态度。/r/n
Both sides should act according to the provisions of the agreement./r/n 双方都应按协议条款办事。/r/n They are making provision for their children's education./r/n 他们正为孩子的教育做准备。/r/n
We set out with enough provisions./r/n 我们带上足够的食品出发了。/r/n Both sides should act according to the provisions of the agreement./r/n 双方都应按协议条款办事。/r/n

The act of suspending the sentence of a person convicted of a criminal offense and granting that person provisional freedom on the promise of good behavior./r/n 缓刑对已被认定犯有某罪的人实行暂缓执行其刑罚，并在其保证良好行为的基础上给予暂时的自由/r/n A copy of the provisional agenda in enclosed for your information./r/n 随信寄上一份暂定议事的日程安排供参考。/r/n
They attacked our border guards without the slightest provocation./r/n 在事先未发生任何挑衅的情况下，他们便袭击我们的边防哨兵。/r/n A provocation to action; a stimulus./r/n 激励，刺激某种行动的刺激；激励/r/n
Harry claims to be an anarchist but he's really only striking an attitude to be provocative./r/n 哈里自称是一名无政府主义者，但是他实际上只是在装腔作势以引起人们的议论。/r/n
He tried to provoke them into fighting./r/n 他企图挑拨他们打架。/r/n Such a questionable assertion is sure to provoke criticism./r/n 这种有问题的主张肯定会招致非议。/r/n
It is very provoking of her to be so late./r/n 她到得这麽晚真叫人生气。/r/n The act of provoking or inciting./r/n 激怒挑衅或煽动的行动/r/n
The soldiers sang a song of victory, describing their prowess in battle./r/n 战士们唱起了歌颂他们英勇战斗的凯歌。/r/n Simon's always talking big about his prowess on the golf course./r/n 西蒙总是吹嘘自己在高尔夫球场上的杰出才能。/r/n

An explosive device used to destroy enemy personnel, shipping, fortifications, or equipment, often placed in a concealed position and designed to be detonated by contact, proximity, or a time fuse./r/n 地雷，水雷一种用来摧毁敌军部队、船舰、碉堡或装备的爆破装置，通常安放在隐蔽处，由于接触、靠近或定时而引爆/r/n
She was such a prude that she was even embarrassed by the sight of naked children./r/n 她正经得出了格, 甚至见了赤身露体的孩子也难为情./r/n Don't be such a prude you can carry modesty too far!/r/n 别那麽拘谨－－你谦虚得太过分了。/r/n
An instance of prudish behavior or talk./r/n 假正经过分拘谨的行为或言谈的一个事例/r/n The state or quality of being prudish./r/n 过分拘谨过分拘谨的状态或品质/r/n
His prudence saved his life./r/n 他的谨慎救了他一命。/r/n Arising from or characterized by prudence./r/n 审慎的由于谨慎的，或以谨慎为特征的/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．梅干(用李子“plum”做的干果)v.修剪
RECORD.lx: The gardener pruned the dead branches./r/n 园丁剪去枯枝。/r/n The teacher pruned the student's article of its superfluities./r/n 老师删去这个学生文章中的多余内容。/r/n

She showed a prurient interest in the details of the rape case./r/n 她对那强奸案的细节津津乐道./r/n Something, such as language or printed matter, considered obscene, prurient, or immoral./r/n 猥亵的东西被认为猥亵的、荒淫的或淫荡的东西，例如语言或印刷物/r/n
I don't want them prying into my affairs./r/n 我不愿他们打听我的私事。/r/n They tried to use an iron bar to pry open the lock./r/n 他们试图用一根铁棒撬开锁。/r/n

You can find this psalm in the Bible./r/n 你可以在圣经上找到这篇赞美诗。/r/n A hymn or psalm sung when the ministers enter at the opening of a service, especially in the Anglican Church./r/n 圣餐礼开始时唱的赞美诗牧师开始宗教仪式时，特别是在英国圣公会教堂中唱的圣歌或赞美诗/r/n
George Eliot was the pseudonym of Mary Ann Evans./r/n 乔治·艾略特是玛丽·安·埃文斯的笔名./r/n She writes under a pseudonym./r/n 她用笔名发表作品./r/n

Is aggression an essential part of the human psyche?/r/n 损人利己是否是人心灵的主宰?/r/n In psychoanalysis, the division of the psyche that is conscious, most immediately controls thought and behavior, and is most in touch with external reality./r/n 自我在精神分析学中指有意识的最直接地控制思想和行为，与外部世界联系也最多的那部分自我/r/n

Development of a physical disorder or illness resulting from psychic, rather than physiological, factors./r/n 精神起因一种由心理因素而不是生理因素引起的身体机能失调或疾病/r/n A period of life characterized by physiological and psychic change that marks the end of the reproductive capacity of women and terminates with the completion of menopause./r/n 绝经期，更年期生命的一个阶段，特征是标志妇女生殖能力终结及以停经完成为结束的生理、心理变化/r/n
Mescalin and LSD are psychedelic drugs./r/n 仙人球毒 和麦角酸二乙基 胺都是迷幻药./r/n The subculture associated with psychedelic drugs./r/n 迷幻世界与迷幻药有关的亚文化/r/n

It must be so small that present methods of psychiatric diagnosis cannot find it./r/n 这一定很小，目前精神病的诊断方法还发现不了。/r/n The method of psychiatric therapy originated by Sigmund Freud in which free association, dream interpretation, and analysis of resistance and transference are used to explore repressed or unconscious impulses, anxieties, and internal conflicts./r/n 心理分析由西格蒙德·弗洛伊德创立的一套精神治疗的方法，用自由联系、对梦的阐释和对抵抗和移情的分析来研究被压抑或无意识的冲动、焦虑和内心冲突/r/n
A licensed practitioner of psychoanalysis./r/n 心理分析医生有开业许可证的心理分析医生/r/n In psychoanalysis, the conscious./r/n 觉察力在精神分析中所指的觉察力/r/n

Tending to induce hallucinations, delusions, or other symptoms of a psychosis. Used of a drug./r/n 拟精神幻觉的能引起幻觉、幻想或其它精神病症状的，用于药物/r/n Is the word `psychosis' part of your idiolect?/r/n 在你的个人言语中使用psychosis这个词吗?/r/n

Any of various depressant drugs used to reduce tension or anxiety and to treat psychotic states./r/n 安定药镇定性药物，用来减轻紧张状态或焦虑并治疗精神病症/r/n A psychotic disorder characterized by delusions of persecution or grandeur, often strenuously defended with apparent logic and reason./r/n 妄想狂，偏执狂一种通常用表面的逻辑和道理来设想的具烦扰或夸大妄想特征的精神错乱症/r/n
A boy's voice cracks (ie becomes deeper) at puberty./r/n 男孩在青春期嗓音改变（声音变粗）./r/n Reaching or having reached puberty./r/n 快到或已经到青春期的/r/n
A large, usually printed placard, bill, or announcement, often illustrated, that is posted to advertise or publicize something./r/n 海报通常印刷而成的大布告、招贴或公告，常附有插图，张贴以用来宣传或公布某事/r/n
The child's face puckered up and he began to cry./r/n 那孩子脸一皱哭了起来。/r/n The dress fitted badly and puckered at the waist./r/n 这件连衣裙不合身，腰部很皱。/r/n
The puddle is full of water./r/n 水坑里充满了水。/r/n He stepped lightly over the puddle./r/n 他敏捷地跨过泥水坑。/r/n
John made mincemeat of all her arguments, and said that he had never heard anything so puerile before./r/n 约翰把她的论点驳得体无完肤，并说他从来没有听过这样幼稚可笑的道理。/r/n
A pugnacious, unyielding, or determined person./r/n 好斗者好斗的、不屈服的或有毅力的人/r/n

The pulley of the clothes line jumped the track and Mother's washing fell down./r/n 晾衣服绳子的滑轮脱绳了，妈妈洗的衣服掉了下来。/r/n A rope passed through an overhead pulley, as at the top of a mast, that is used for hoisting./r/n 吊绳用于提升事物的穿过高架滑轮的绳索，如在杆的顶端/r/n
A banana is mainly pulp, except for its skin./r/n 香蕉除了果皮之外，主要是果肉。/r/n These vegetables have been boiling too long; they're cooked to a pulp./r/n 这些蔬菜煮的时间太长了，都煮成糊了。/r/n
The air seemed to pulsate with the bright light./r/n 空气似乎随着亮光而颤动。/r/n
He pulverized the opposition with the force of his oratory./r/n 他能言善辩把对方驳得体无完肤./r/n
The child pummelled his mother angrily as she carried him home./r/n 那孩子因其母带他回家而生气地捶打著母亲./r/n The child pummels his mother angrily as she carries him home./r/n 那孩子因其母带他回家而生气地捶打著母亲。/r/n
They cut holes on the sheet of metal with a punch press./r/n 他们用冲床在金属板上打孔。/r/n The conductor punched his bus ticket./r/n 售票员用剪票夹在他的汽车票上打孔。/r/n

I've got a puncture and my spare is flat too!/r/n 我的车胎扎破了, 备用的也瘪了!/r/n I had a narrow shave yesterday when I had a puncture on the motorway, but fortunately I was able to keep the car in control until I could pull over and stop./r/n 昨天在公路上行驶时，我的车轮胎被戳破了，我真是死里逃生，幸好我能控制住车直到停下。/r/n
The pundits disagree on the best way of dealing with the problem./r/n 如何妥善处理这一问题, 专家众说纷纭./r/n A political pundit./r/n 政治评论家/r/n
He exhaled the pungent odor of garlic./r/n 他散发出刺鼻的大蒜味。/r/n Sharp or pungent to the smell./r/n 浓烈的气味辛辣或浓烈的/r/n
What a puny creature!/r/n 多瘦小啊！/r/n They laughed at my puny efforts at rock-climbing./r/n 他们取笑我在攀岩活动中的那可怜劲儿。/r/n
He managed to secure a loan to purchase a house./r/n 他设法弄到一笔贷款买了一栋房子。/r/n She made several purchases in the dress shop./r/n 她在服装店里买了几样东西。/r/n
We may purge water by distillation./r/n 我们可以用蒸馏法使水净化。/r/n A dose of this stuff will purge you!/r/n 这种药只须一剂就能让你通便!/r/n
Take some purgative and it will help you purge your bowels of bad matter./r/n 吃点泻药有助于你将肠胃中的有害物质除去。/r/n Causing evacuation, especially of the bowels; purgative./r/n 排泄的，排除的引起腹泻，尤指肠泻的；净肠的/r/n
The purport of the statement is that the firm is bankrupt./r/n 该项声明大意是说该商行已经破产。/r/n The purport of what he said is that he is right./r/n 他说话的涵义是说他是对的。/r/n
The helicopter lifted up the steel pylon, transported it to the site, and dropped it gently into place./r/n 直升飞机把高压电缆铁塔吊起，运至工地，然后轻轻放下使之就位。/r/n
He is a quack doctor./r/n 他是个庸医。/r/n A quack cure./r/n 庸医般的治疗/r/n
We quaffed wine last night./r/n 我们昨晚畅饮了一次酒。/r/n He is quaffing his beer by the pint./r/n 他论品脱地大喝啤酒。/r/n
I quailed with fear at the thought of telling her the bad news./r/n 想到要告诉她这个坏消息，我就害怕得发抖。/r/n A group of animals or birds, especially larks or quail./r/n 一群动物，一群鸟一群动物或鸟，尤指云雀或鹌鹑/r/n

He had/felt no serious qualms about concealing the information from the police./r/n 他向警方隐瞒实情而并未感到十分不妥./r/n Emma herself suffered from no such qualms, for she was certain that Mr. Elton was as much in love with Harriet as Harriet---through Emma's instigation---was with him./r/n 爱玛自己倒是心安理得，因为她确信埃尔顿先生对哈里特十分钟情，而哈里特——在她的鼓动之下——对他也有同样的爱慕之心。/r/n
I am in a quandary, for this situation is totally unforeseen./r/n 我陷入困惑，因为这个局面完全没有被预料到。/r/n I was put in a great quandary./r/n 我陷于进退两难的窘境。/r/n

Liability was admitted by the defendant, but the case went to trial because they could not agree the quantum of damages./r/n 被告承认有责任，但案子还是拿到法庭审判，因为双方当事人不能就损害赔偿金金额达成协议。/r/n This discovery marks a quantum leap forward in the fight against cancer./r/n 这一发现标志著治疗癌症的 一大突破./r/n
He had been kept in quarantine for a week./r/n 他接受了一星期的检疫隔离。/r/n Quarantine restriction have been lifted on import animal from that country./r/n 对来自那个国家的进口动物的检疫限制已被解除。/r/n
They are quarrying in old manuscripts./r/n 他们正在旧手稿中寻找资料。/r/n Detectives kept the quarry under surveillance for weeks./r/n 侦探们监测那个目标已有好几个星期了。/r/n
They are quarrying in old manuscripts./r/n 他们正在旧手稿中寻找资料。/r/n Detectives kept the quarry under surveillance for weeks./r/n 侦探们监测那个目标已有好几个星期了。/r/n
This quartet represents a major new trend in modern music./r/n 这首四重奏的曲子反映了现代音乐中一种主要的新趋向./r/n The string quartet is a kind of delicate chamber music./r/n 弦乐四重奏是一种优雅的室内乐。/r/n
The applicant seek judicial review to quash the bind-over order./r/n 申请人请求司法检查以便废除责令某人守法的命令。/r/n The appeal court quash the care order make by the juvenile court./r/n 上诉法院宣布少年法院发出的照看命令无效。/r/n
Her queer way of dressing attracted the attention of the passerby./r/n 她古怪的着装方式引起了过路人的注意。/r/n There is something queer about him./r/n 他有些古怪。/r/n
The government's reassurances have done nothing to quell the doubts of the public./r/n 政府的再次保证并没有消除公众的疑虑。/r/n The police have been called in to quell a minor disturbance./r/n 警察奉命出动以平息一场小规模的骚乱。/r/n
Hot steel is quenched to harden it./r/n 烧热的钢淬火使它坚硬。/r/n Water will quench a fire./r/n 水可以灭火。/r/n
The minister was queried about his plans for the industry./r/n 有人向部长提出了工业计划问题。/r/n Your interesting report raises several important queries./r/n 你的精彩报告引出了几个重要问题。/r/n
The quest for gold was difficult./r/n 寻找金矿是很困难的。/r/n The lawyer was on a quest for further evidence./r/n 律师正在到处找寻更多的证据。/r/n
We queued up for the bus./r/n 我们排队等公共汽车。/r/n People are queuing to buy tickets./r/n 人们正排队买票。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．遁词，吹毛求疵的反对意见
RECORD.lx: A petty distinction or objection; a quibble./r/n 遁辞微不足道的区别或反对；遁辞/r/n An equivocation; a quibble./r/n 遁辞模棱两可的话；遁辞/r/n
It is unlikely that such an extremist organization will remain quiescent for long./r/n 这种过激的组织是不太可能长期沉默的./r/n Quiescent. Used especially of a disease./r/n 静止的静止的。尤指一种疾病/r/n
The duke wrote a letter with a quill pen./r/n 公爵用一根羽毛笔写信。/r/n
He is the quintessence oftact and politeness./r/n 他处世谦恭得体./r/n Her book captures the quintessence of Renaissance humanism./r/n 她的书抓住了文艺复兴时期人文主义的精髓./r/n
He have a strange quirk of addressing his wife as Mrs Smith./r/n 他很怪，把自己的妻子称作史密斯夫人。/r/n By a quirk of fate they have booked into the same hotel./r/n 由於命运的捉弄，他们住进同一家旅馆。/r/n
I've asked you to do this for me because I know you're not a quitter./r/n 我要求你为我做这件事, 因为我知道你做事不虎头蛇尾./r/n
The old man quivered with rage./r/n 这位老人气得发抖。/r/n He felt a quiver of excitement./r/n 他感到激动得发抖。/r/n
The rabbles met on the square to oppose their new mayor./r/n 平民们在广场上集会反对他们的新市长。/r/n The rabble soon grew violent and unmanageable./r/n 暴民们很快地变得狂暴和无法控制。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．患狂犬病的，疯的，失去理性的
RECORD.lx: A rabid football fan./r/n 狂热的足球迷/r/n

German soldier and raconteur known for his fantastic stories about his adventures as a hunter, sportsman, and soldier./r/n 闵希豪生，卡尔·弗雷德里希·希伦穆斯·冯1720－1797德国士兵，以善讲有关他做为猎人、运动员和士兵的冒险经历的荒诞故事而闻名/r/n His grandfather was a fine raconteur, dredging up quite effortlessly, and with a great wealth of detail, scenes and incidents from his early life./r/n 他的祖父是位很好讲故事的人，不废吹灰之力，就把他年轻时事情、场景，极详细地描绘出来。/r/n
Her face with radiance absorbed me./r/n 她那容光焕发的脸庞吸引了我。/r/n The radiance of the sunset died away./r/n 夕阳的余辉渐渐地消失了。/r/n
Five roads radiate from this roundabout./r/n 有五条道路以这个环状交叉路为中心向各方伸展开。/r/n Eight roads radiate from the square./r/n 八条大道从广场呈辐射形伸展出去。/r/n
The news of the radiation leak caused widespread public alarm./r/n 辐射泄露的消息引起了公众的普遍恐慌。/r/n The most terrifying aspect of nuclear bombing is radiation./r/n 核弹轰炸最可怕的一面是辐射。/r/n
The big rafter is visible in this room./r/n 这间屋子粗大的椽子可以看得见。/r/n
He was mad with rage./r/n 他快要气疯了。/r/n The young girl has a rage for pop music./r/n 这个年轻的女孩对流行音乐有狂热爱好。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．破烂的，（表面）凹凸不平的
RECORD.lx: The sheep were herded into a ragged line./r/n 这些羊被赶在一起，排成歪歪扭扭的一行。/r/n The old man's ragged coat showed his poverty./r/n 那个老人褴褛的衣衫表明他很穷困。/r/n
A security guard was killed in the bank raid./r/n 这次银行抢劫案中有一名保安遇害。/r/n The police will carry out a dawn raid./r/n 警方将在拂晓展开突然搜查。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．栏杆，铁轨，v．咒骂，猛烈指责
RECORD.lx: We'll travel by rail./r/n 我们将坐火车旅行。/r/n We installed a stainless steel towel rail on the wall./r/n 我们在墙上装了一个不锈钢的挂毛巾的横杆。/r/n
The girl always complains about lacking suitable raiment./r/n 这个女孩总是抱怨没有合适的衣服。/r/n
They rallied to their leader's cause./r/n 他们团结一致支持领袖的事业。/r/n Her spirits rallied on hearing the good news./r/n 她听到这个好消息精神又振作起来。/r/n
I like rambling around in the country./r/n 我喜欢在乡间漫步。/r/n The old man rambled about the past./r/n 老者在聊过去的事情。/r/n
The mob rampaged through the village./r/n 这夥暴徒在村中横冲直撞./r/n
Sickness was rampant in the country./r/n 疾病在这个国家猖獗。/r/n Deplored the rampant consumerism of contemporary society./r/n 对当代社会中狂热的拜金思想深感遗憾/r/n
The rampart was destroyed totally./r/n 壁垒被彻底摧毁了。/r/n Surrounded with or as if with a rampart./r/n 用城墙围绕的用城墙围绕的或类似于为城墙围绕的/r/n
The butter has gone/turned rancid./r/n 这黄油已经哈喇了./r/n The grocer took back the rancid butter./r/n 杂货店老板让把变了味的黄油退给了他。/r/n
Bitterness of feeling; rancor./r/n 深仇积怨感情上的怨恨；敌意/r/n I have no rancor against him./r/n 我对他无怨无仇。/r/n
The insult still rankles in his mind./r/n 他对那次受辱仍然耿耿于怀。/r/n The insult still rankled in his mind./r/n 他对那次受辱仍耿耿於怀./r/n
The family paid a ransom of 50000 dollars for the child's release./r/n 那家人为了赎回孩子付了5万美元。/r/n They had to ransom the kidnapped diplomat./r/n 他们不得不赎回被绑架的外交官。/r/n
A greedy, rapacious person./r/n 贪心的或贪婪的人/r/n A person of a rapacious, predatory, or profiteering nature./r/n 贪婪的人具有贪婪、凶残或逐利性格的人/r/n
They fell into the seething waters of the rapids./r/n 他们跌进了汹涌的急流中。/r/n The boat shot the rapids./r/n 那条船穿过急流。/r/n
Father and son have a great rapport./r/n 父子情深./r/n The actor developed a close rapport with his audience./r/n 该演员与观众建立了密切的关系./r/n
The mother gazed with rapture at her new born baby./r/n 母亲着迷地凝视着她刚出生的婴儿。/r/n He fall into rapture over classic music./r/n 他对古典音乐喜爱若狂。/r/n
Her new novel was greeted by reviewers with rapturous applause./r/n 她的新小说备受书评家推崇./r/n
That valour which is not found on prudence call rashness./r/n 未经深思熟虑的勇武只能称作轻率。/r/n Rashness is the result of ignorance, hesitation of think./r/n 轻率是无知的结果，犹豫是思考的产物。/r/n
I do not understand the rationale behind the decision to sell the warehouse./r/n 我不明白在出售仓库的决定后面有什么原由。/r/n
He wrote a rave review of that book./r/n 他写了一篇对那本书大捧特捧的评论。/r/n You can rant and rave at the fine, but you'll still have to pay it./r/n 你闹也好, 骂也好, 罚金还是得交./r/n
Where's dinner? I'm ravenous!/r/n 饭呢？我饿极了！/r/n The ravenous lion tore the quarry./r/n 饥饿的狮子撕碎了猎物。/r/n
The river had worn a ravine between the hills./r/n 那条河在两山之间已造成一个深谷。/r/n My horse jump across the deep ravine, but all the others balk./r/n 我的马跃过深谷，但其余的马都突然停止不动。/r/n
He was ravished by her beauty./r/n 她的美貌使他倾倒。/r/n I was ravished by her beauty./r/n 我被她的美貌迷住了./r/n
He was ravished by her beauty./r/n 她的美貌使他倾倒。/r/n I was ravished by her beauty./r/n 我被她的美貌迷住了./r/n

A rope or rawhide halter with a wide band that can be lowered over a horse's eyes, used in breaking horses to a bridle./r/n 辔头一种绳索或生皮笼头，带有一条宽带，可以用来遮住马的眼睛，用于勒停马匹/r/n A time Hera, Poseidon, Apollo, and all the other Olympians, except Hestia, surrounded him suddenly as he lay asleep on his couch and bound him with rawhide thongs, knotted into a hundred knots, so that he could not move./r/n 有一次，赫拉、波塞冬、阿波罗和除了赫斯提外所有的奥林波斯神祗乘宙斯躺在床上熟睡之际一拥而上，用生牛皮绳把他捆绑起来并打上一百个绳结，使他动弹不得。/r/n
I shave with an electric razor./r/n 我用电动剃须刀刮胡子。/r/n The razor has a very keen edge./r/n 这把剃刀有锋利的口。/r/n
He's lining up with the most reactionary people in his party./r/n 他在同自己党内最反动的人物结成同盟。/r/n The reactionary classes never give up power voluntarily./r/n 反动阶级从来不会自动放弃政权。/r/n
He mixed the two reagents, though I had told him not to./r/n 他把这两种试剂混起来了，虽然我曾告诉他不要混起来。/r/n
He writes reams of verse./r/n 他写很多的诗。/r/n
My father taught me how to operate a reaper./r/n 我父亲教我怎样使用收割机。/r/n A rabbit get catch in the blade of the reaper./r/n 一只兔子被卷到收割机的刀刃中去了。/r/n
The police reassured her about the child's safety./r/n 警察让她放心，她的孩子很安全。/r/n A glance in the mirror reassured him that his tie wasn't crooked./r/n 他照了一下镜子，领带确实没有戴歪。/r/n
A good doctor combines reassurance with fellow feelings for his or her patients./r/n 好医生善于把对他（或她）的病人的同情与消除疑虑结合起来。/r/n
It made my day when I received a￡500 tax rebate./r/n 我收到500英镑税款折扣时乐不可支。/r/n He get a tax rebate at the end of the year./r/n 他在年底得到了一笔退回的税款。/r/n
Those rebellious teenagers are hard to control./r/n 那些反叛的青少年很难管教。/r/n Rising in revolt against civil authority or a government in power; rebellious./r/n 起义的，造反的起来反抗当局或当权的政府的；反叛的/r/n
He rebuffed all my offers of friendship./r/n 他拒绝了我的一切友好表示。/r/n Her kindness to him was met with a cruel rebuff./r/n 她一片好心却遭到他冷酷的拒绝。/r/n
He received a stern rebuke from his superior./r/n 他受到上司的严厉斥责。/r/n You will hear about this (ie will receive a formal rebuke about it) later./r/n 这件事你就等瞧吧（要受到严厉斥责）./r/n
Stubborn and intractable; recalcitrant./r/n 执拗的顽固和不受影响的；执拗的/r/n Resistant to authority or discipline; recalcitrant./r/n 难驯服的不屈服于权力或权威的；暴烈的/r/n
Let me just recapitulate (on) what we've agreed so far./r/n 让我仅扼要重述一下到目前为止我们已取得的一致意见./r/n So much for the detailed argument, I will now recapitulate./r/n 详细理由业已说完，我现在简述要旨。/r/n
As the tide receded we were able to look for shells./r/n 潮水退去，我们就能寻找贝壳了。/r/n The prospect of bankruptcy has now receded./r/n 破产的危险已经减少了。/r/n
Please find me a receptacle for sugar./r/n 请给我找一个放糖的容器。/r/n

One that receives or is receptive./r/n 接受者，接受器接受或容易接受的人或物/r/n The periodic state of sexual excitement in the female of most mammals, excluding human beings, that immediately precedes ovulation and during which the female is most receptive to mating; heat./r/n （雌性动物的）动情，动情周期大多数哺乳动物（包括人类）的雌性产生的周期性的性冲动，在此期间内雌性具有排卵的优势，所以该期间最适合性交；刺激/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．壁凹（墙上装架子，柜子等凹处），休假
RECORD.lx: The committee is going into recess for a couple of weeks./r/n 委员会打算休会几个星期。/r/n An open recess for holding a fire at the base of a chimney; a hearth./r/n 壁炉用于在烟囱底部燃火的敞口的凹窝；炉床/r/n
If we can pull through this recession, we will be in good shape./r/n 如果我们能渡过这段经济不景气的时间，我们就会好多了。/r/n The recession have cause thousands of bankruptcy./r/n 经济不景气造成数千万的破产。/r/n
Brown eyes are dominant and blue eyes are recessive./r/n 棕色眼睛是显性的，蓝色眼睛是隐性的。/r/n
They show reciprocal affection to each other./r/n 他们表达了彼此之间的爱慕。/r/n They have a reciprocal agreement to combat terrorism./r/n 他们有相互配合的协定，共同与恐怖主义作斗争。/r/n
He reciprocated by wishing her good luck./r/n 他也祝她交好运./r/n I reciprocate your good wishes./r/n 我也同样祝福你./r/n

The pianist gave a long and varied recital, with a couple of encores for good measure./r/n 那钢琴家的独奏演出会时间长、节目多，还加奏了两支曲子。/r/n Her recital led off/She led off her recital with a Haydn sonata./r/n 她在独奏会上首先演出的是海顿的奏鸣曲./r/n
His brother is a reckless gambler./r/n 他的弟弟是个不计后果的赌徒。/r/n He's quite reckless of his own safety./r/n 他完全不顾及自己的安全。/r/n
Her mission was to reclaim former criminals./r/n 她的任务是感化过去的罪犯。/r/n You may be entitled to reclaim some of the tax you paid last year./r/n 你或许有权要求退回去年你交付的部分税金。/r/n
This recluse shunned all company./r/n 这位隐士不与任何人来往。/r/n The condition of being a recluse./r/n 隐居处于做隐士的状况/r/n
He tends to recoil from making difficult decisions./r/n 他在难以作出决定时往往踌躇不前。/r/n She recoiled at the sight of the snake./r/n 她一见到蛇就往后缩。/r/n
The insurance company will recompense his loss./r/n 保险公司将赔偿他的损失。/r/n
How can he reconcile it to his conscience?/r/n 他怎能问心无愧呢？/r/n We tried to reconcile her with her family./r/n 我们试图让她和她的家庭和好。/r/n
He brought about reconciliation between former enemies./r/n 他使旧时的仇敌和解了。/r/n We've tried our best to effect reconciliation between the two parties./r/n 我们已尽了最大努力希望促成双方和解。/r/n
The squadron flew a reconnaissance mission./r/n 该空军中队执行一侦察任务./r/n Photographic aerial reconnaissance especially of military targets./r/n 空中照相侦察空中照相侦察，尤指军事目的的/r/n
They had to recount the vote./r/n 他们不得不重新计算选票。/r/n The defeated candidate demanded a recount./r/n 落选的候选人要求重新计算选票。/r/n
You recreant knave!/r/n 你这个不义之徒!/r/n

His only recreations are drinking beer and working in the garden./r/n 他仅有的消遣是喝啤酒和在花园里种花草。/r/n In other words, we had better take sufficient recreation to relax after work./r/n 换句话说，我们最好工作后，消遣消遣来轻松一下。/r/n
It's natural to recriminate against someone who has tried to put the blame on you./r/n 对企图加罪于你的人进行反责，这是很正常的。/r/n
We are having difficulties in recruiting well-qualified staff./r/n 我们难以招募到素质好的职员。/r/n New recruits to our music club are always welcome./r/n 我们的音乐俱乐部随时欢迎新会员参加。/r/n
I made a mistake that can not be rectified./r/n 我犯了一个无法改正的错误。/r/n He cleaned the bottle with rectified spirit./r/n 他用精馏酒精清洗瓶子。/r/n
Rectification means the whole Party studying Marxism through criticism and self-criticism./r/n 整风就是全党通过批评和自我批评来学习马克思主义。/r/n
He is still recuperating from his operation./r/n 他动手术後仍在恢复中./r/n
A sudden attack, recurrence, or intensification of a disease./r/n 发作突然的发作、复发或疾病的加剧/r/n The quality or state of being periodic; recurrence at regular intervals./r/n 周期性周期出现的性质或状态；以固定的间隔而发生/r/n
He was trying to redeem himself for his earlier failure./r/n 他试图挽回他早些时候的失败。/r/n She redeemed her reputation with a powerful speech to the party convention./r/n 她由于向党代表大会做了有力的演说而挽回了自己的声誉。/r/n
The boy is beyond redemption./r/n 这个男孩子不可救药了。/r/n He had finished the redemption of his promises./r/n 他已经履行完他的诺言了。/r/n
He is redolent of evil./r/n 他浑身充满了邪气。/r/n
You must seek redress in the law courts for the damage to your car./r/n 你的车子受到了损坏，你应当通过法律途径要求赔偿。/r/n He did all that he could do to redress these wrongs./r/n 他尽可能地补偿这些错误。/r/n
In the sentence" She lives alone by herself", the word" alone" is redundant./r/n 在“她独自一人单独生活中”这个句子中，＂单独”是多余的。/r/n There will be no question of anyone being made redundant./r/n 决不可能裁掉任何人./r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．过剩，似乎多余其实重要的后备力量
RECORD.lx: The takeover cause250 redundancy./r/n 接管移交造成250人的裁员。/r/n A cyclic code with minimum redundancy used to check errors in a set of characters./r/n 一种用于检查一组字符的错误、并且具有最小冗余度的循环码。/r/n
The referee awarded a free kick./r/n 裁判员判定罚一个任意球。/r/n The referee counted him out in the first round./r/n 裁判判定他在第一回合被击败。/r/n
Her mother is a woman with great refinement./r/n 她母亲是一个非常文雅的女人。/r/n The new car has many added refinements such as air-conditioning and anti- blocking brakes./r/n 这辆新车有许多精巧的附加装置，如空调和防抱死装置。/r/n
The results reflect the greatest credit upon all concerned./r/n 这些成绩带给所有有关人员最大的荣誉。/r/n The sunlight was reflected in the water./r/n 日光由水面反射出来。/r/n
On further reflection she saw her mistake./r/n 进一步细想后，她明白了自己的错误。/r/n The cat felt curious when she saw her own reflection in the mirror./r/n 小猫看到自己在镜子中的倒影，感到很好奇。/r/n
Not reflective; unthinking./r/n 不加思虑的；不思考的/r/n
The state or quality of being stubborn or refractory./r/n 顽固，倔强顽固、固执或倔强的状态或性质/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．抑制，避免 n．歌曲的反复句，叠句
RECORD.lx: Let's hope they will refrain from hostile actions./r/n 希望他们不采取敌对行动。/r/n I carefully refrained from looking at him./r/n 我留意着避免朝他看。/r/n
The flat will be refurbished for the new tenants./r/n 这套房间将重新粉刷以接纳新房客./r/n
I was able to refute his argument./r/n 我能驳倒他的论点。/r/n As for the Flat Earth theory, I believe I could refute it./r/n 至于地平学说，我相信我能驳斥它。/r/n
The regal lady had made a deep impression on him./r/n 那位雍容华贵的妇人给他留下了深刻的印象。/r/n Royal or imperial; regal./r/n 贵族或皇室的；帝王的/r/n
She regaled us with an account of her school-days./r/n 她讲她上学时的往事把我们逗得不亦乐乎./r/n
The party soon regenerated under her leadership./r/n 该党在她的领导下很快焕然一新./r/n Their aim is to regenerate British industry./r/n 他们的目的是复兴英国的工业./r/n
The regent carried out an advanced system in his country./r/n 摄政者在他的国家推行了一套先进的制度。/r/n His address be248 regent street, right?/r/n 他的住址是摄政街284号，对吗？/r/n
Things will change under the new regime./r/n 在新政权下，事情将会发生变化。/r/n The people have been kept down for years by a brutal regime./r/n 人民多年遭受野蛮制度压迫./r/n
Teenagers don't like being regimented./r/n 十几岁的青少年不喜欢被严格管教。/r/n His son is a soldier in a cavalry regiment./r/n 他的儿子是骑兵团的一名战士。/r/n

A type of schizophrenia, usually starting at puberty, characterized by foolish mannerisms, senseless laughter, delusions, hallucinations, and regressive behavior./r/n 青春期痴呆一种精神分裂症，通常始发于青春期，其特征为举止痴呆、傻笑、妄想、幻觉以及退化的举止/r/n
Accidents sometimes happen even in the best regulated families./r/n 即便是在管理最好的家庭，事故有时也会发生的。/r/n Your watch is always slow; it needs to be regulated./r/n 你的手表总是慢，需要校准一下。/r/n
She was fined for driving above the regulation speed./r/n 她因超速开车而被罚款。/r/n The convocation held at four o'clock had passed a regulation./r/n 四点举行的会议通过了一项规章制度。/r/n
Punishment intended to rehabilitate or improve./r/n 处罚为复原或提高而进行的惩罚/r/n
The whole cast broke off for coffee in the middle of rehearsal./r/n 全体演员在排练休息时喝咖啡。/r/n Carlin has been so out of it at rehearsal that week./r/n 卡琳那个星期彩排的时候一直醉得不省人事。/r/n
He reigned over the country for forty years./r/n 他统治了这个国家四十年。/r/n Silence reigned everywhere./r/n 万籁俱寂。/r/n
All expenses will be reimbursed (to you)./r/n 一切费用都能（给你）报销./r/n We will reimburse the customer for any loss or damage./r/n 我们愿赔偿顾客受到的一切损失和损害./r/n
This horse reins well./r/n 这匹马易于驾驭。/r/n He pulled at the reins./r/n 他使劲拉住缰绳。/r/n
Our defences must be reinforced against attack./r/n 我们必须加强防御设施以抵御进攻。/r/n This evidence reinforces my view that he is a spy./r/n 这个证据证实了我认为他是间谍的这一看法。/r/n
His supporters failed in their attempt to reinstate the President in the White House./r/n 他的支持者试图使总统重新入主白宫的努力失败了。/r/n
The captain reiterated the command to us./r/n 上尉对我们重申了那项命令。/r/n The teacher reiterates that rule./r/n 老师重申了那条规则。/r/n
We rejoiced at the good news./r/n 我们为这个好消息而高兴。/r/n They all rejoiced to hear the happy news./r/n 他们都很乐于听到这个令人高兴的消息。/r/n
"Yes, " I said, rejoicing with him./r/n "是的。"我真替他高兴。/r/n The good news rejoiced the cockles of my heart./r/n 这好消息使我从心坎里感到高兴。/r/n

You're wrong!' she rejoined./r/n ｀你错了!＇她答道./r/n "I'll have you both licked when I get out, that I will, " rejoined the boy, beginning to snivel. "Two can play at that game, mind you, " said Tom./r/n "等我走出学校，我要叫人把你们俩狠狠揍一顿，我一定要，"那孩子回答说，开始哭鼻子。"你叫人，我们也会叫人，你不要忘记。"汤姆说。/r/n
`No!' was his curt rejoinder./r/n 他草率地回答了一声｀不!＇/r/n
Nothing could rekindle her extinct passion./r/n 她激情已逝, 无从心回意转./r/n
Would you like to have some relaxation after swimming?/r/n 游完泳后你愿意放松一下吗？/r/n Fishing is his favorite relaxation./r/n 他最喜爱的消遣是钓鱼。/r/n
Will Spurs be relegated to the third division?/r/n 斯珀尔斯队会降为丙级队吗?/r/n Mr. Taylor relegate his project to his son after he have ret./r/n 泰勒先生退休后把他的事业移转给儿子。/r/n
At first she threatened to dismiss us all, but later she relented./r/n 起初她威胁要解雇我们所有的人，但是后来她态度软化了。/r/n The police will not relent in their fight against crime./r/n 警方在跟犯罪分子的斗争中决不手软。/r/n
He was relentless in demanding repayment of the debt./r/n 他冷酷无情地要求偿还那笔债。/r/n
I really can't see what relevance is has, I'm afraid./r/n 恐怕我确实看不出那有什么关系。/r/n Having logical, precise relevance to the matter at hand./r/n 有关系的，相关的对即将到来的事情有合乎逻辑且明确的关联/r/n
Don't place too much reliance on his advice./r/n 别太相信他的意见。/r/n Reliance on something in the future; hope./r/n 期待，期望对某事未来的信赖；希望/r/n
This stone axe is a relic of ancient times./r/n 这把石斧是古代的遗物。/r/n This ruined bridge is a relic of the Civil War./r/n 这座毁坏的桥是南北战争时的遗迹。/r/n
She relinquished possession of the house to her sister./r/n 她把房子的所有权让给了她妹妹。/r/n I had relinquished all hope that she was alive./r/n 我已经放弃了她还活着的一切希望。/r/n
His wife won't relish having to wash all those dishes./r/n 他的妻子不会喜欢洗这一大堆碟子的。/r/n He drank up the wine with relish./r/n 他津津有味地把酒喝光了。/r/n
He spent the remainder of his life in the country./r/n 他在乡村度过余生。/r/n Nine people came in and the reminder stayed outside./r/n 9个人进来，余下的人留在外面。/r/n
The remains of the supper were taken away./r/n 晚餐吃剩的东西被收去了。/r/n The girls screamed when the grisly remains of the half-eaten corpses on the screen were shown./r/n 当屏幕上显示出尸体被吃掉一半的恐怖残骸时，女孩子们尖叫起来。/r/n
Old friends like to reminisce about the"good old days"./r/n 老朋友们总喜欢谈论那“美好的往昔”。/r/n
He entertained us with reminiscence of his childhood./r/n 他追述他的童年时代，从而使我们高兴起来。/r/n

Critics have charged that the department was remiss in not trying to dialogue with representatives of the community before hiring the new officers./r/n 在雇用新的官员之前，评论家们已指责该部门在与社会代表的对话中对自己的职责有疏忽/r/n It is remiss of her to forget to pay the bill./r/n 她忘了付帐，真粗心大意。/r/n
The company gained remission from tax payments./r/n 这家公司获准免税。/r/n He got a remission of six months./r/n 他获减刑六个月。/r/n
The storm has been remitted./r/n 暴风雨开始减弱了。/r/n He remitted some money to his mother./r/n 他给他母亲寄了一些钱。/r/n
He has returned the completed form with your remittance./r/n 他已经把填好的表格连同你的汇款一并寄回了。/r/n Sorry, your remittance have not reach us yet./r/n 对不起，您的汇款还没有到我们这儿。/r/n
The beautiful curtain is made of remnant materials./r/n 这个漂亮的窗帘是用零头布做的。/r/n I will sell this remnant to you, at cost./r/n 我愿将此剩货照成本卖给你。/r/n
I made remonstrance against his rudeness./r/n 我对他的粗暴提出抗议。/r/n
I remonstrated with him about his rudeness./r/n 他粗暴无礼, 我给他提了意见./r/n
He was filled with remorse after hitting the child./r/n 他打过孩子后感到悔恨不已。/r/n He was in an agony of remorse./r/n 他处于悔恨的海洋中。/r/n
He is in a very remunerative job./r/n 他有个报酬高的工作。/r/n
Leonardo da Vinci is a famous artist in the Italian Renaissance./r/n 利奥纳多·达·芬奇是意大利文艺复兴时期的一位知名画家。/r/n These are the cultural legacies of the Renaissance./r/n 这些是文艺复兴时期的文化遗产。/r/n
The party was rent in two./r/n 这个政党分裂成两派。/r/n Infants were rent from their mother's arms./r/n 婴儿被从母亲怀里抢走了。/r/n
You've rendered me a service./r/n 你帮了我的忙。/r/n His fatness renders him unable to bend down./r/n 他太胖了，以致于弯不下腰。/r/n

Rendering poetry into other languages is difficult./r/n 翻译诗歌是很困难的./r/n The account is subject to10% discount if settled within fifteen days of rendering, after which it is strictly net./r/n 提交清算书后15日内付款可打10％的折扣；超过15日，依全额付清。/r/n
That spring he surprised his wife and Laroche-Mathieu at a rendezvous./r/n 这一年春天，他在妻子与拉罗哲·马底欧幽会时出其不意地将他们捉了双。/r/n He didn't tell me the rendezvous./r/n 他没有告诉我约会时间与地点。/r/n
He renounced his religion and became a Muslim./r/n 他宣布脱离他原来的宗教而成为了一名穆斯林教徒。/r/n He renounced his claim to the property./r/n 他放弃了对财产的要求。/r/n
He won renown as a pianist./r/n 他赢得钢琴家的声誉。/r/n Something conferring honor or renown./r/n 荣耀的事授予荣誉或声誉的事/r/n
The French are renowned for their cooking./r/n 法国人擅长烹饪./r/n A man of renowned power or authority./r/n 王握有权柄或有权威的男子/r/n
I rent a room from her./r/n 我向她租了一个房间。/r/n She rents out rooms to students./r/n 她出租房间给学生住。/r/n
The Congress decided to repeal the law./r/n 议会决定废除那项法令。/r/n Mps are pressing for the repeal of the immigration act./r/n 下院议员正在施加压力使移民法得以废止。/r/n
She was repelled by the dirty room./r/n 肮脏的房间使她厌恶。/r/n The crew repelled the attack./r/n 船员击退了进攻。/r/n
Rub some of this mosquito-repellent on your legs./r/n 你在腿上搽点驱蚊剂吧./r/n Disgusting, loathsome, or repellent./r/n 令人生厌的，令人反感的，引起厌恶的/r/n
He repented what he has done./r/n 他懊悔他的所作所为。/r/n Have you nothing to repent of?/r/n 你没有可懊悔的事吗？/r/n
We finally forgave him when he expressed his repentance with tears./r/n 当他流着泪表达他的悔恨时，我们终于原谅了他。/r/n Sudden friendship, sure repentance./r/n 仓促结友谊，肯定悔莫及。/r/n
He is repentant of his folly./r/n 他对自己的愚蠢行为而懊恼。/r/n The church is always willing to welcome repentant sinners back to the fold./r/n 教会总是乐意欢迎忏悔的罪人回到信徒的行列中来。/r/n
The president's death had unexpected repercussion./r/n 总统的逝世引起出乎意料的反响。/r/n A sharp reaction; a repercussion./r/n 强烈反应后果，影响/r/n
A pianist's wide-ranging repertoire; a wide-ranging interview./r/n 钢琴家内容丰富的曲目；内容广泛的采访/r/n
He repined against his unhappy lot./r/n 他自叹命运多舛。/r/n

The replacement of one image by another during a period of time by the motion of a boundary separating the visual parts of the two images./r/n 在图象显示期间，一幅图象由另一幅图象取代。同一屏幕上，两幅图象的可见部分有一分界线，移动这一分界线，把一幅图象逐渐抹掉（划出），逐渐显示另一幅图象（划入）。/r/n Good job they have get a replacement for him./r/n 他们把他替换下来真不错。/r/n
We need to replenish our stocks of coal./r/n 我们需要再次补充煤的储备。/r/n
His story was replete with falsehood./r/n 他的报导充满了虚伪。/r/n
I had a replica in little of Independence Hall./r/n 我有一件独立纪念堂的小型复制品。/r/n
The chameleon's skin replicates the pattern of its surroundings./r/n 变色龙的皮肤可随环境改变颜色./r/n
Don't repose too much confidence in that man./r/n 不要对那人过于相信。/r/n The owl hunts while you repose in bed./r/n 你躺在床上安然入睡时，猫头鹰却要去觅食。/r/n
My father is a repository of interesting facts./r/n 我父亲有说不完的趣事./r/n Object repository support for creating shared, reusable form and data module./r/n 用于创建共享、可重用窗体和数据模块的对象储存库支持。/r/n
I've been authorised by the court to repossess this property./r/n 我得到法庭认可重新拥有这笔财产。/r/n
Your conduct/attitude is most reprehensible./r/n 你的行为[态度]的确应该受到批评./r/n Morally reprehensible; bad./r/n 道德败坏的道德上应受指责的；坏的/r/n
His childhood was repressed and solitary./r/n 他的童年是压抑而孤独的。/r/n All protests are brutally repressed by the government as illegal./r/n 所有的抗议活动都遭到当局的野蛮镇压，并被宣布为非法。/r/n
The people are held down by a vicious and repressive military regime./r/n 人民受著凶恶而专制的军政权的压迫./r/n
The prisoner won a last-minute reprieve./r/n 那囚犯在临刑前获得了缓刑。/r/n A temporary immunity or exemption; a reprieve./r/n 宽恕；赦免临时性的豁免或免除；缓期，暂减/r/n

He felt more like laughing at the child's escapade than scolding him, but, solemn as an owl, he got through the necessary reprimand./r/n 那孩子的恶作剧与其说让他责骂，倒不如说让他啼笑皆非，然而，他还是起来进行了必要的惩戒。/r/n The principal reprimand the student for his chronic lateness./r/n 校长斥责那个学生不该接二连三地迟到。/r/n
In those days, objections would only invite reprisals./r/n 在那时候，提出反对意见只会引起报复。/r/n
His reply sounded to me like a reproach./r/n 他的回答在我听来象是责备。/r/n She reproached her husband for having forgotten their wedding anniversary./r/n 她责怪丈夫忘了他们的结婚周年纪念日。/r/n
The quality of reproduction isn't very good on this recording./r/n 这次录音复制的质量不怎么好。/r/n This is not the original; it's only a cheap reproduction./r/n 这不是原作，它只不过是廉价的复制品。/r/n
You can scarcely expect to escape reproof for such irresponsible behavior./r/n 你这样不负责任的行为，不能不受到责备。/r/n Impatient of reproof, he left his parents and went away./r/n 忍受不了责难，他离开父母出走了。/r/n
She reproved him for telling lies./r/n 她骂他说谎。/r/n I stand corrected and reprove myself./r/n 我承认有错并予自责。/r/n
He repudiated the court's decision to offer bail./r/n 他不接受法庭的保释裁决./r/n
The idea of accepting a bribe was repugnant to me./r/n 我一想到受贿这种事就非常反感./r/n I find his racist views totally repugnant./r/n 我十分厌恶他的种族主义观点./r/n
I cannot overcome my repugnance to eating snails./r/n 吃蜗牛真恶心，我可受不了。/r/n Feeling repugnance or loathing./r/n 感到厌恶的，感到憎恨的/r/n
I repulsed her kindness./r/n 我拒绝了她的好意。/r/n She repulsed his proposal./r/n 她拒绝了他的求婚。/r/n
You repulsive little toad!/r/n 你这个讨厌的癞蛤蟆!/r/n
It's a highly reputable firm./r/n 这是一家有名气的公司。/r/n She is a reputable expert./r/n 她是个有声望的专家。/r/n
