This store has an excellent reputation for fair dealing./r/n 这家商店因公平交易而获好名声。/r/n He earned a high reputation for his learning./r/n 他在学识方面享有很高的声誉。/r/n

But to Mozart--- at that time sick, depressed, haunted by the thought of death--- the stranger seemed a messenger from the other world, bidding him write his own requiem./r/n 但是，对莫扎特来说——此时他身体不好，情绪低落，整天想着死——这个陌生人无异是从另一个世界派来的使者，来命令他写下他自己的安魂曲。/r/n
I must buy some toilet requisites./r/n 我必须买些卫生间必需品。/r/n She expect to achieve the requisite two-thirds majority for nomination./r/n 她期望得到获得提名所必需的三分之二多数。/r/n
The town hall was requisitioned as army headquarters./r/n 市政厅徵用作了军队的指挥部。/r/n The army requisition all the truck to carry supplies./r/n 军队征用了所有卡车，目的是为了运输车需品。/r/n
One's due, reward, or punishment; requital./r/n 报偿，报应一个人应得报酬、报答、惩罚；补偿，赔偿/r/n A full requital of his striving pain./r/n 这是对他艰苦努力的圆满回报。/r/n
Our kindness and trust was requited only with dishonesty on their part./r/n 对我们的善意和信任，他们以欺诈来回报。/r/n I'll requite you for your help./r/n 我想报答你的帮助。/r/n
There is a degree of resemblance between the two boys./r/n 这两个男孩有某些相似之处。/r/n Your story shows little resemblance to the facts./r/n 你说的与事实相去甚远。/r/n
I resent having to get his permission for everything I do./r/n 我讨厌做每件事都要得到他的许可。/r/n I bitterly resent his attempts to interfere in my work./r/n 我非常讨厌他企图干涉我的工作。/r/n
He has a deep-seated resentment at the way he has been treated./r/n 他因受到如此对待而深怀怨恨。/r/n The resentment festered in his mind./r/n 他心中的愤恨有增无减。/r/n
He still reserved his opinion on some points./r/n 在一些问题上，他仍然保留自己的意见。/r/n Please reserve a seat for me./r/n 请为我预定一个座位。/r/n
He still reserved his opinion on some points./r/n 在一些问题上，他仍然保留自己的意见。/r/n She is not usually so reserved./r/n 她通常不如此缄默。/r/n

It's amusing to watch members jockeying for the Prime Minister's attention prior to Cabinet reshuffle./r/n 看到政府官员在内阁改组之前耍弄花招以讨得首相欢心是很有趣的。/r/n Who let out the details of the reshuffle in the department?/r/n 是谁泄漏了部门重组的细节?/r/n
He married an English woman and took up his residence in London./r/n 他与一名英国女子结婚并且定居在伦敦。/r/n They have a summer residence in the countryside./r/n 他们在乡间有夏季住宅。/r/n

The debate over the residual powers of the States has been long drawn out./r/n 有关美国剩余的权力的争论已是旷日持久的了。/r/n Residual deposits of soil, dust, and rock particles produced by the action of the wind./r/n 残积层由于风力所产生的土壤、灰尘和岩石细粒的堆积物/r/n
The residue of estate belongs to his son./r/n 剩余财产属于他的儿子。/r/n The residue after an ore or other material has been washed./r/n 洗后的渣矿物或其他物质洗后剩下的渣滓/r/n
We haven't yet received his resignation./r/n 我们尚未收到他的辞呈。/r/n I'll accept my fate with resignation./r/n 我将听天由命。/r/n

She resigned her children to the care of a neighbor./r/n 她委托邻居照顾她的孩子。/r/n A lot of people would have resigned in the face of such accusations, but he stayed and toughed it out./r/n 面对这样的指责，许多人都会辞职的，然而他却留下并硬是挺了过来。/r/n
Her natural resilience helped her overcome the crisis./r/n 她生性乐观有助於她渡过难关。/r/n Rubber has more resilience than wood./r/n 橡胶有比木头更大的弹性。/r/n
A loud, resonant, metallic sound./r/n 铿锵声大而洪亮的金属般的声音/r/n A deep resonant sound, as of an explosion./r/n 隆隆声低沉而有回响的声音，比如爆炸声/r/n
Resonance would occur again, but not so strong as before./r/n 共振会再次发生，但不如先前那么强。/r/n
If other means fail we shall resort to force./r/n 如果其他手段均告失败，我们将诉之武力。/r/n You should have resorts to your parents./r/n 你应该求助于你的父母。/r/n
Death is no respecter of persons./r/n 死亡是不分贫富贵贱的。/r/n The teacher is no respecter of his students./r/n 这位老师不偏袒任何学生。/r/n

The three men were given work according to their respective abilities./r/n 这三个人根据各自的能力被分配了工作。/r/n Product name is trademark or registered trademark of their respective owner./r/n 产品名称为它们各自所有者的商标或注册商标。/r/n

Respiration becomes difficult at great heights./r/n 在很高的地方呼吸就变得困难了。/r/n German biochemist. He won a1931 Nobel Prize for research on the respiration of cells./r/n 瓦尔堡，奥托·亨利希1883－1970德国生化学家。因其对细胞呼吸的研究而获得1931年的诺贝尔奖/r/n
The noise went on all night without a moment's respite./r/n 噪音一刻不停地持续了一整夜。/r/n A welcome respite from hard work./r/n 刻苦工作后令人愉快的短暂休息/r/n
We are enjoying the resplendent colors of the New England woods in the autumn./r/n 我们欣赏着秋天里新英格兰树林的瑰丽色彩。/r/n The princess arrived, resplendent in a new white dress./r/n 公主光彩照人地穿着一身雪白的新礼服来了。/r/n
Formal reply to an allegation make in court, especially defence make by a respondent to a divorce petition/r/n 答辩状，对在法庭所作断言的答复，尤指被告对离婚起诉的抗辩。/r/n
Highly aware of and responsive to what is fashionable and up-to-date./r/n 赶时髦的，新潮的对于流行的和时新的东西很敏感的并且积极响应的/r/n Not responsive, as to treatment or stimuli./r/n 无感应的对治疗或刺激没有反应的/r/n
Another hour passed and the crowd grew/became restive./r/n 又过了一个小时, 人们有些不耐烦了./r/n
An invigorating, refreshing, or restorative agent or influence./r/n 增强物增加活力、精神或帮助恢复的物品或影响/r/n Nature has an exhilarative and restorative effect./r/n 大自然具有使人畅快并恢复体力的效果。/r/n
I couldn't restrain my anger./r/n 我无法抑制我的愤怒。/r/n She tried to restrain her sobs./r/n 她设法抑制住自己的悲泣。/r/n
His rage was beyond restraint./r/n 他怒不可遏。/r/n Restraint in artistic expression./r/n 束缚艺术表达的限制/r/n
Please send a detailed resume to our company./r/n 请给我们公司寄一份详细的简历。/r/n The collapse of the strike enabled the company to resume normal bus services./r/n 罢工的失败使公司恢复了正常的公共汽车营业。/r/n
That noise is enough to resurrect the dead!/r/n 那噪音都能把死人吵活!/r/n
He had a resurrection of hope./r/n 他的希望复苏了。/r/n His resurrection frightened us./r/n 他的复活吓坏了我们。/r/n
Who is responsible for retailing these rumors about him?/r/n 是谁散布这些有关他的流言蜚语的？/r/n I bought the milk retail./r/n 我以零售方式买来这些牛奶。/r/n
The retailer has to absorb the cost of wastage./r/n 零售商须承受耗损的费用./r/n The retailer accepted the shipment on consignment./r/n 零售商接受了运来的寄售物品/r/n
If we impose import duties, other countries may retaliate against us./r/n 我们若徵收进口税, 别的国家就可能报复我们./r/n He slapped his sister, who retaliated by kicking him./r/n 他打了妹妹一巴掌, 他妹妹回敬他一脚./r/n
Lack of sun retards plant growth./r/n 光照不足则植物生长缓慢./r/n Cold weather retards the growth of the crops./r/n 寒冷的天气妨碍了庄稼生长。/r/n
Lack of sun retards plant growth./r/n 光照不足则植物生长缓慢./r/n A substance that retards or arrests a chemical reaction./r/n 反催化剂延缓或阻碍化学反应的物质/r/n
He seems unduly reticent on the subject of his past./r/n 他似乎对他过去的事情讳莫如深。/r/n
She is a retinue of doctor./r/n 她是医生的助手。/r/n The Queen was flanked by a retinue of bodyguards and policemen./r/n 女王左右有保镖和警察护卫着。/r/n
Joanna had a gentle retiring disposition./r/n 乔安娜性格温柔而腼腆。/r/n Retiring early from his job freed him to join several local clubs./r/n 他早早退休, 摆脱了工作的羁绊而加入了当地的几个俱乐部./r/n
He retorted that it was my fault as much as his./r/n 他反驳说我的错误并不比他的小。/r/n He retorted, "it's entirely your fault."/r/n 他反驳说：“这完全是你的错误。”/r/n
He often retraces the happy time during his young age./r/n 他经常回忆起年轻时代的幸福时光。/r/n The police retraced the movements of the murder victim./r/n 警方追溯了被谋杀者当时的动作。/r/n
The undercarriage on light aircraft does not always retract in flight./r/n 轻型飞机飞行时起落架不一定缩回./r/n The accused refused to retract (his statement)./r/n 那被告拒不撤消（其供述）./r/n
The soldiers had to retreat when they were beaten in battle./r/n 士兵们在战斗中受挫，不得不撤退。/r/n You can't retreat from the responsibility in this affair./r/n 你不能回避在这一事件中的责任。/r/n
The president promised swift and effective retribution against the terrorists./r/n 总统答应会迅速有效地惩罚恐怖分子。/r/n Retribution is at hand./r/n 惩罚就要到来/r/n

A word, symbol, or number used as a descriptor for retrieval of information from a collection, especially in a coordinate indexing system./r/n 用作描述符的一种字、符号或数，用于从某一集合中，特别是从某一配位标引系统中检索信息/r/n A unit of a computer that preserves data for retrieval./r/n 存储器存储数据以备日后查用的计算机部件/r/n
The company is fighting to retrieve its market share./r/n 这个公司正在为恢复其市场份额（占有率）而奋斗。/r/n I should like to retrieve my umbrella which I left in the car./r/n 我想取回我留在车上忘记带走的雨伞。/r/n
One's school life seems happier in retrospect than in reality./r/n 人们的学校生活回想起来要比实际上的快乐。/r/n One's school life seem happier in retrospect than in reality./r/n 学校生活回忆起来显得比实际上要快乐。/r/n
The legislation was made retrospective./r/n 该项法规具有追溯效力。/r/n
The revelation of his scandalous past led to his resignation./r/n 他那不光彩历史的揭露导致了他的辞职。/r/n Have you read the ex-minister's amazing revelations in the newspaper?/r/n 你看了前任部长在报上揭露的那些惊人的事实没有？/r/n
The revelries went on all the night./r/n 狂欢活动通宵达旦。/r/n It seems sounds of drunken revelry./r/n 那似乎是酗酒作乐的吵闹声。/r/n
I did not do it out of revenge./r/n 我做那件事并不是出于报复。/r/n The knight swore he would revenge his father's death./r/n 骑士发誓要为他父亲向敌人报仇。/r/n

The government's revenue is made up chiefly of the money we pay in taxes./r/n 政府的收入主要来源是靠我们所交的税。/r/n The Inland Revenue have sent me a tax bill for more than a hundred pounds, but they can't get blood out of a stone because I just haven't got the money./r/n 国内税务署寄给我一张100多英镑的税单，不过他们不可能从石头里榨出油来，因为我并没有那么多钱。/r/n
The roar of the train reverberated in the tunnel./r/n 火车的轰隆声在隧道里回荡./r/n The room reverberated with the noise of the shot./r/n 房间里回响著枪声./r/n
These students have reverence for their teacher./r/n 这些学生很尊敬他们的老师。/r/n Feeling reverence, dread, or awe./r/n 敬畏的感到尊敬，害怕或崇拜的/r/n
They all maintained a reverent silence./r/n 他们都保持肃静。/r/n The reverent love and devotion accorded a deity, an idol, or a sacred object./r/n 崇拜对神、偶像或神圣物体带有敬畏或惊异的热爱与热诚/r/n
He is indulging in reveries about the future./r/n 他正沉浸于对未来的幻想之中。/r/n She fell into a reverie about her childhood./r/n 她沉浸在对童年往事的遐想中。/r/n
These financial reverses will prevent my taking a holiday./r/n 这些经济上的挫折使我不能去度假了。/r/n The 50p coin has a crowned lion on its reverse./r/n 50便士硬币反面的图案是个戴皇冠的狮子./r/n

A reversion to a former type or ancestral characteristic./r/n 返祖恢复到从前的类型或祖先的特征/r/n Reversion of land held under feudal tenure to the manor in the absence of legal heirs or claimants./r/n 无继承人的土地规领主缺少法定继承人或继承申请者的封地的所有权的转归领主/r/n
Their much reviled system in fact works far better than many highly praised ones elsewhere./r/n 他们那套遭到许多非难的设备操纵起来实际上要比别的地方许多备受赞扬的设备好得多。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．使复活，使重新充满活力
RECORD.lx: I think we have to revitalize our society./r/n 我觉得我们的社会需要新生。/r/n
The unreasonable rules were revoked./r/n 不合理的规则被废除了。/r/n His driving licence was revoked after the crash./r/n 他撞车后驾驶执照被吊销了。/r/n
Human nature revolts at such a crime./r/n 人性厌恶这样的罪行。/r/n The colonists revolted against their British ruler./r/n 殖民地人民反抗他们的英国统治者。/r/n
His feet smelt revolting./r/n 他双脚散发的气味让人恶心./r/n He was the prime mover in the revolt against the government./r/n 他是这场反政府叛乱的煽动者./r/n
The guests went into rhapsodies over the food./r/n 宾客对食物交口称赞./r/n
The sentence contains impassioned rhetoric./r/n 这个句子含有富有表现力的修辞。/r/n I am tired of the empty rhetoric of politicians./r/n 我讨厌政客们的花言巧语。/r/n
A small, glittering ornament, such as a rhinestone or a sequin, applied to fabric or a garment./r/n 亮片一种用于织物或服装上的闪闪发光的小饰物，比如像水晶或金属闪光片/r/n
"Won't you grow any fruit? " "No. only rhubarb, God's gift to Scotland and lazy gardeners."/r/n "你们这里种水果吗？""不种，只种大黄，这是上帝对对苏格兰人和懒人的恩宠。"/r/n

A foot of verse used in lyric poetry having two unstressed syllables flanked by the two rhythmic stresses marking the first and last syllables of the foot./r/n 扬抑抑扬格一种应用于抒情诗诗体中的音步，由两个轻音节夹在两个有节奏的重音之间构成，用于表示该音步的第一个和最后一个音节/r/n The rhythmic stamping of the heels characteristic of Spanish flamenco dances./r/n 踢达舞西班牙弗拉曼柯舞中特有的有节奏地踏足/r/n
How many ribs does a man have?/r/n 一个人有几条肋骨？/r/n It is not true that woman is made from man's rib; she is really made from his funny bone./r/n 女人并非真的以男人的肋骨来造成的；其实，她是由男人的“笑骨”[尺骨]造成的。/r/n

The chairman had to call the meeting to order after the ribald comments of one of the members caused uproar among the others./r/n 会议成员之一说的下流话在其他成员中引起了一阵骚动，主席只得叫大家遵守会议秩序。/r/n A variety show characterized by broad ribald comedy, dancing, and striptease./r/n 粗俗的表演各种以下流粗俗的喜剧、舞蹈和脱衣舞为特征的表演/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．脊（如屋脊，山脊等），隆起物
RECORD.lx: His forehead was ridged with anxiety./r/n 他的前额因焦虑而布满了皱纹。/r/n The floor of the atlantic ridge in the middle from north to south./r/n 大西洋洋底在中部形成由北向南的海脊。/r/n
Fraud, violence, war at home and abroad were rife./r/n 欺诈、暴力、对内对外的战争四处猖獗。/r/n His thesis is rife with errors./r/n 他的学位论文错误连篇。/r/n
He was appointed captain of a company of rifles./r/n 他被任命为步枪连连长。/r/n The soldier told us where the firing mechanism of a rifle is./r/n 那个士兵告诉我们哪儿是步枪的击发装置。/r/n
Healed the rift between us./r/n 弥补我们之间的裂痕/r/n
He looked rather out of place when he turned up in full ceremonial rig./r/n 当他穿着全套大礼服露面的时候，显得和整个场合很不协调。/r/n They rigged the little boy out as a sailor./r/n 他们把小男孩打扮成水手模样。/r/n
He deserves to be punished with the full rigor of the law./r/n 他应该受到法律最严厉的惩罚。/r/n The expedition suffered all the rigors of a Canadian winter./r/n 这支探险队饱受了加拿大严冬的折磨。/r/n

Now her teachers corps, called Teach for American is off and running. After a rigorous competition,500 recent college graduates won places out of a field of2, 500 applicants, proving Ms.Kopp's theory that making the corps selective would enhance its appeal to college students./r/n 现在她的教师工作团——名为教师报国团——已迅速展开工作。经过一番激烈竞争之后，2500名申请人中，500名刚从大学毕业的被录取。证明了柯普女士的理论：工作团从严录取将可在大学生中增加号召力。/r/n Rigorous or ceremonious adherence to established forms, rules, or customs./r/n 拘泥形式遵照或顺从已被确认的形式、规则或习俗/r/n
Those apple rinds are green./r/n 那些苹果的皮是绿的。/r/n Please help me to cut off the rinds of lemons./r/n 请帮我去掉柠檬的皮。/r/n
Her hair hung down in ringlets./r/n 她的头发呈许多小发卷下垂着。/r/n The child's hair fell in ringlets./r/n 小孩的卷发自然下垂/r/n
You may use hot water to rinse the congealed fat off the dinner plates./r/n 你可以用热水把菜盘上凝结的油污冲洗掉。/r/n Rinse the clothes./r/n 把衣服涮一涮。/r/n
We spent a riotous night at Christmas./r/n 圣诞节我们度过了一个狂欢之夜。/r/n He was charged with riotous behaviour./r/n 他被控聚众闹事。/r/n
I ripped my stocking on a nail./r/n 一个钉子挂破了我的袜子。/r/n The poster had been ripped to pieces./r/n 那张广告画已被撕得粉碎。/r/n
The entire proposal is risible: it will never be accepted./r/n 这个建议完全是荒唐可笑的, 根本不可能采纳./r/n
Did you go to their marriage rites?/r/n 你参加他们的婚礼了吗？/r/n The sacrament or rite of ordination./r/n 神职仪式神职的任命或神职任命仪式/r/n

An ancient ritual in modern dress./r/n 以现代风貌包装的古代仪式/r/n A person trained in Jewish law, ritual, and tradition and ordained for leadership of a Jewish congregation, especially one serving as chief religious official of a synagogue./r/n 犹太的法学博士在犹太法律、仪式及传统方面受过训练的人，并被任命主持犹太教集会，尤指在犹太教堂中作为主要神职的人员/r/n
We stood riveted to the spot./r/n 我们寸步不移的站在那儿。/r/n I was absolutely riveted by her story./r/n 她的故事完全把我吸引住了。/r/n
Only by riveting her attention on her word could she forget her worries./r/n 只有全身心投入到工作上她才能忘记烦恼。/r/n Can I fasten these metal plates with rivets?/r/n 我可以用铆钉把这些金属板固定在一起吗？/r/n
You should put a robe on if you go out in a cold day./r/n 冷天出门时要披上披肩。/r/n He robes himself in moonlight./r/n 他沐浴在月光下。/r/n
Being in robust and sturdy good health./r/n 强壮的，健康的强壮的和身体健康的/r/n The old veteran could lay flat the most robust sportsman./r/n 这位沙场院老将能把最强壮的运动员拖得筋疲力尽。/r/n

The local council are advertising for a Rodent Operator, which in common parlance means a rat catcher./r/n 该地方议政会登广告征聘一个啮齿动物的手术施行者，按一般说法就是要找一个耗子捕捉者。/r/n The squirrel, an example of a rodent; introduced each new word with examples of its use./r/n 松鼠，啮齿类动物的代表；举例介绍每一个生词的用法/r/n
We will serve smoked cod's roe at the dinner./r/n 宴会上我们将上一道熏鳕鱼子。/r/n Roes comes out with the strangest remarks at times./r/n 罗斯不时地发表些极怪的议论。/r/n
He gave her a roguish look./r/n 他调皮地看了她一眼./r/n
Curse, like chicken, come home to roost./r/n 诅咒像鸡雏，必回栖息木。/r/n Her selfishness will come home to roost someday./r/n 她的自私总有一天会得到报应。/r/n
Don't talk with him; he is a rooster./r/n 别理他，他太狂妄自负了。/r/n The cap of a jester, decorated to resemble the comb of a rooster./r/n 小丑的帽子小丑的帽子，装饰得像公鸡的肉冠/r/n
The coach scratched three names from the players' roster./r/n 教练从选手名单上勾掉了3个名字。/r/n

The gardener asked me for a rotary lawn mower./r/n 园丁向我要一台旋转式割草机。/r/n A device for transmitting rotary motion, consisting of a handle or arm attached at right angles to a shaft./r/n 曲柄一个传递转动的部件，包括一个手柄或把手与一个轴直角相连/r/n
He used to learn everything by rote./r/n 他过去总是死记硬背。/r/n He can say the whole of the English Bible by rote./r/n 他能把整本英语《圣经》硬背出来。/r/n
We drove home by a roundabout route./r/n 我们绕远道驾车回家。/r/n At the roundabout, take the third exit./r/n 在环状交叉路口，从第三条出路驶出。/r/n
They routed the enemy./r/n 他们打败并赶走了敌人。/r/n Our party was routed at the election./r/n 我们党在竞选中被彻底击败了。/r/n
He rove about his student./r/n 他扫了他的学生一眼。/r/n His eyes roved around the room./r/n 他的眼睛扫视着房间的每个角落。/r/n
They were chucked out of the pub for being too rowdy./r/n 他们因为太吵闹被撵出酒馆./r/n I have to sit on the class when they get too rowdy./r/n 班上学生太闹时，我就得管一管。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．皇室，版税（付给著作人的钱）
RECORD.lx: The writer gets a 10% royalty on each copy sold of his book./r/n 作者从每本卖出的书中可得10%的版税。/r/n The flag is only raised when royalty are present./r/n 只有在王室成员在场的时候才升起这面旗帜。/r/n
A mild, white Italian cheese that has a rubbery texture and is often eaten melted, as on pizza./r/n 白干酪一种味淡的、白色的并有弹性的意大利奶酪，通常融化放在比萨饼上吃/r/n
Rubble covered the pavement./r/n 人行道上铺了碎石块./r/n The ceiling collapsed and rubble poured into the room./r/n 天花板坍塌了, 碎砖破瓦掉落到了屋里./r/n
Thesheets on my bed have rucked up./r/n 我床上的床单有褶子了./r/n He was eager to get out of the (common) ruck and distinguish himself in some way./r/n 他渴望出人头地, 在某方面与众不同./r/n
She shouldered her rucksack and set off along the road./r/n 她背起帆布背包就上路了./r/n She swung the rucksack (up) onto her back./r/n 她把帆布背包转到身後./r/n

The wood rudder of the ship was broken./r/n 船的木头舵坏了。/r/n A part or surface, such as a wing, propeller blade, or rudder, whose shape and orientation control stability, direction, lift, thrust, or propulsion./r/n 翼剖面；机翼；翼面一个部件或平面，如机翼、螺旋桨叶、方向舵等，其形状或方位控制稳定性、方向、抬升、冲击或驱动/r/n
He looked at the children's ruddy cheeks and smiled./r/n 他看着孩子们红润的脸颊，笑了。/r/n The fire cast a ruddy glow over the city./r/n 这场火把城市上空映得一片通红。/r/n

I have only a rudimentary grasp of physics./r/n 我对物理学仅有初步的了解。/r/n Sylvia's rudimentary knowledge of chess was more than enough to beat Peter, who had seldom played the game before; on the country of the blind…./r/n 西尔维尔的象棋基础知识足以战胜彼得，因为彼得以前很少参加比赛，山中无老虎，猴子称王…。/r/n
I have mastered the rudiments of economics./r/n 我已精通经济学的基本原理。/r/n
He'll rue the day he married her./r/n 他将会因为和她结婚而抱恨终身。/r/n I rue never having been to university./r/n 我后悔从未上过大学。/r/n
He thought of her with a rueful smile./r/n 他苦笑着回想她。/r/n He was rueful for joining the army./r/n 他感到后悔去参军。/r/n
A hired ruffian; a thug./r/n 打手一个被雇的恶棍；暴徒/r/n He is one of the greatest ruffians who ever cheated the gallows./r/n 他是一个曾经逃过绞刑的最坏的恶棍。/r/n
The bird ruffled up its feathers./r/n 鸟儿惊恐地竖起了羽毛。/r/n A flag ruffled in the breeze./r/n 旗帜迎风飘扬。/r/n
Leather made from the hide of the African and Asian ruminant./r/n 羚皮革非洲、亚洲的羚羊皮做的皮革/r/n
He is ruminating on recent events./r/n 他正在思考最近发生的事。/r/n The cow began to ruminate after eating up grass./r/n 牛吃完草后开始反刍。/r/n
He ruptured himself lifting a bookcase./r/n 他抬书柜时出现了疝./r/n He'll rupture a muscle if he goes on dancing like that!/r/n 他要是继续那样跳舞，会跳得皮开肉裂！/r/n

The rural scenery was so beautiful that he decided to stay one more week./r/n 乡村风光太美了，以致于他决定再多呆一星期。/r/n Resembling or having the characteristics of country life; rural./r/n 农村的象农村生活的，具有农村生活特点的；乡下的/r/n
His rage was soon calmed down by the rustic peace./r/n 乡村的宁静很快就使他的怒气平静下来。/r/n His rustic speech and ways made him uncomfortable in the city school./r/n 他土里土气的语言和生活方式使他在城里的中学感到不舒服。/r/n
She wore her sable stole./r/n 她戴着带有貂皮的披肩/r/n Down the sable flood they glided./r/n 他们在黑黝黝的洪水中随波逐流。/r/n

The branch of an intelligence service charged with keeping sensitive information from an enemy, deceiving that enemy, preventing subversion and sabotage, and collecting political and military information./r/n 反情报组织情报组织的一个分支，任务是使敌人得不到高级机密，欺骗敌人，避免颠覆和阴谋破坏并收集政治和军事情况/r/n Several acts of sabotage are committed against radio station./r/n 发生好几起对电台财产的蓄意破坏。/r/n
I use a heavy sabre in fencing./r/n 我在击剑时用的是把重剑。/r/n
If you are late again the boss will give you the sack./r/n 如果你再迟到，老板就会把你解雇。/r/n There is a sack of potatoes at the corner of the room./r/n 屋子一角有一袋马铃薯。/r/n
She received the sacrament./r/n 她领了圣餐。/r/n The sacrament or rite of ordination./r/n 神职仪式神职的任命或神职任命仪式/r/n
Nothing is sacred to these wild youths./r/n 这些狂野的年轻人什么都不尊重。/r/n This area was hallowed by sacred memories./r/n 这个地区由于宗教上的纪念意义而被视为圣地。/r/n
You can't cut spending on defence that's sacrosanct!/r/n 国防开支可削减不得--那可是关天关地的事!/r/n My weekends are sacrosanct./r/n 我的周末是很宝贵的。/r/n
He saddled up his horse and rode away./r/n 他给马装上鞍子便骑马离去了。/r/n The boss saddled her with all the most difficult customers./r/n 老板把那些最难应付的顾客全推给她了。/r/n
A team of African bearers came with us on safari./r/n 有一队非洲脚夫和我们一起进行狩猎旅行./r/n A team of african bearer come with us on safari./r/n 有一队非洲脚夫和我们一起进行狩猎旅行。/r/n
We will introduce legal safeguards against fraud./r/n 我们要采取法律保护措施，制止诈骗活动。/r/n We make copies of our computer disks as a safeguard against accidents./r/n 我们复制了计算机磁盘以防意外。/r/n
The villagers shored up sagging huts./r/n 村民们撑起摇摇欲坠的茅棚。/r/n The chair sagged down under the fat man's weight./r/n 椅子经这胖人一坐便压弯了。/r/n
This new novel is an absorbing family saga./r/n 这部新小说是一部引人入胜的家世小说。/r/n The novelist had issued many saga novels./r/n 那个小说家已经发表了很多长篇小说。/r/n
The leader made a sagacious decision./r/n 领导做了英明的决定。/r/n He is a sagacious person./r/n 他是个精明的人。/r/n
Sagacity, unlike cleverness, may increase with age./r/n 睿智与机灵不同，前者可随着年龄增加。/r/n The judge has excellent sagacity./r/n 那个法官有敏锐的洞察力。/r/n
What a sage reply you gave!/r/n 多聪明的回答啊！/r/n Confucius is considered the greatest of the ancient Chinese sages./r/n 孔子被认为是中国古代最伟大的圣贤。/r/n
The salient point of his plan is summed up in this report./r/n 他的计划的要点在这个报告中酌此概括。/r/n
Saliva helps one chew and digest food./r/n 唾液能帮助咀嚼和消化食物。/r/n Saliva is secretion of the salivary glands./r/n 唾液是唾液腺的分泌物。/r/n
She is ill with a sallow face./r/n 她病了，面色发黄。/r/n
He planed to go fishing for salmon on Sunday./r/n 他计划星期天去钓鲑鱼。/r/n We dined on smoked salmon./r/n 我们晚餐吃的是熏鲑鱼./r/n
The accident is a salutary reminder of the danger of climbing./r/n 这一事故有益的一面是提醒了我们攀登活动是有许多危险的。/r/n
He raised his hat in salutation./r/n 他举起帽子致意。/r/n We usually begin a letter with a salutation./r/n 我们通常用称呼作为一封信的开头。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．v．（从灾难中）抢救，海上救助
RECORD.lx: The government tried to salvage several business companies from bankruptcy./r/n 政府设法把这几个商业公司从破产境地中拯救出来。/r/n Salvage of the wreck is made difficult by bad weather./r/n 船遇难後因天气恶劣救援工作十分困难。/r/n

After so much dry weather, the rain has been the farmer's salvation./r/n 天气干旱了这么久，这场雨成了农民的救星。/r/n But above all, if he has St. Paul's perfection, that he would wish to be anathema from Christ, for the salvation of his brethren, it shows much of a divine nature, and a kind of conformity with Christ himself./r/n 最后，如果一个人竟能像《圣经》中的圣保罗那样，肯为了兄弟们的得救甚至甘于忍受神的诅咒；那么他就必定超越了凡人，而且有真正基督徒的品格了。/r/n
She paid the repair bill as a salve to her conscience./r/n 她付了维修费以减轻内疚感。/r/n This kind of salve is used on wounds./r/n 这种药膏是用在伤口处。/r/n
The minister can only act in this matter with the sanction of Parliament./r/n 部长只有得到国会批准才能就此事采取行动。/r/n Western nations imposed tough sanctions on the country./r/n 西方各国对这个国家实行了严厉制裁。/r/n

It is a classic sanctuary in which the rationalist fancy may take refuge./r/n 这是一所古雅的圣殿，理性主义者可以躲在其中。/r/n The ancient privilege of sanctuary was transferred to the Christian temple./r/n 古代的庇护特权转移到了基督教的教堂。/r/n
I was allowed once into his inner sanctum./r/n 我有一次获准进入他的内室./r/n
It's hard to stay sane under such awful pressure./r/n 处于这种可怕的压力之下，不疯才怪呢。/r/n She have a sane attitude towards diving and never go too fast./r/n 她对於跳水的态度很明智，从不操之过急。/r/n
His strange remarks planted doubts in our minds about his sanity./r/n 他那些怪话使我们心中生疑，不知他精神是否正常。/r/n
He is not very sanguine about our chances of success./r/n 他对我们成功的机会不太乐观。/r/n We are sanguine that we shall be succeeding./r/n 我们自信会成功。/r/n

Sanitary conditions had deteriorated to such an extent that there was widespread danger of disease./r/n 卫生条件恶化到了如此程度，到处都有发生疾病的危险。/r/n Epidemic disease is often in connection with bad sanitary conditions./r/n 流行病通常是和不良的卫生条件有关的。/r/n
The people lived in that city can keep sanitation clean./r/n 住在那个城市的人们能保持公共卫生的清洁。/r/n
Her long illness gradually sapped her strength./r/n 长期的患病使她的体力渐渐衰竭。/r/n The sap flowed out when he broke the stem of the flower./r/n 他把花茎折断，汁液就流了出来。/r/n
It's our duty to protect the saplings./r/n 保护树苗是我们的责任。/r/n She cut down the sapling with one chop./r/n 她一斧子就把树苗砍倒了./r/n
Her sapphire necklace attracted everyone's attention./r/n 她的蓝宝石项链吸引了每个人的注意。/r/n She had the sapphire set in a gold ring./r/n 她把那枚蓝宝石镶在金戒指上了./r/n
He was totally flattened by her sarcasm./r/n 她说的挖苦话使他无地自容./r/n "It was a good idea to tell my mother you didn't like her dress", she said with sarcasm./r/n "跟我母亲说你不喜欢她的衣服，那可真是个好主意，"她讽刺地说。/r/n
She talked with him with sarcastic tones./r/n 她用挖苦的语调和他说话。/r/n He could feel their sarcastic tone about his poor work./r/n 他能感觉到他们对他拙劣作品的讽刺语调。/r/n
Our windows have double-pane sashes./r/n 我们的窗户有双层的玻璃窗框。/r/n The officer wears sashes on his shoulders./r/n 这名军官的肩上佩戴着肩带。/r/n

American writers closed ranks yesterday behind Satanic Verses' author Salman Rushdie, with at least two demonstrations planned for tomorrow and called for President Bush to take action./r/n 美国作家昨天团结一致支持《撒旦诗篇》的作者拉什迪，计划明天至少举行两起示威，并要求布什总统采取行动。/r/n
She sated with sleep./r/n 她睡腻了。/r/n Nothing could sate the careerist's greed for power./r/n 什么也满足不了这个野心家的权力欲。/r/n
She pushed her chair back from the table, satiated./r/n 她把椅子从餐桌向后挪了挪，再也吃不下了。/r/n He was satiated with pleasure./r/n 他厌倦了享乐。/r/n
His new play is a satire on the fashion industry./r/n 他的新剧本是一部讽刺时装业的作品。/r/n The party in power soon learns what it's like to be on the receiving end of political satire./r/n 执政党很快就尝到了遭受政治讽刺的滋味./r/n

A satirical imitation or burlesque of the heroic manner or style./r/n 嘲弄地模仿英雄风格的作品对英雄行为或风格的讽刺的模仿或戏谑/r/n English poet and diplomat known for his epigrams and light satirical verse./r/n 普赖尔，马修1664－1721英国诗人和外交官，以其机智的短诗和略带讽刺的诗闻名/r/n

These civilizations flourished while Europeans were still savages living in caves./r/n 当欧洲人还是居住在洞穴中的野蛮人时，这些地方的文化早已十分繁荣昌盛。/r/n Today's newspapers made a savage attack on the unions for their refusal to negotiate./r/n 今天的报纸就工会拒绝谈判一事对工会进行了猛烈的抨击。/r/n
He drank the wine slowly, savoring every drop./r/n 他慢慢地喝着酒，细细品尝着每滴酒的滋味。/r/n Life seems to have lost most of its savor for him./r/n 对他来说，生活似乎已失去了一切乐趣。/r/n
The loveliest doll in the last analysis is merely sawdust./r/n 说到底，最可爱的布娃娃也只不过是锯末做成的。/r/n A thin mattress filled with straw or sawdust./r/n 木屑床垫填满草杆或木屑的一床薄垫子/r/n
Her scabrous novels shocked the public./r/n 她的小说淫秽不堪, 公众十分震惊./r/n
He made a very beautiful scabbard for his knife./r/n 他为他的刀做了一个漂亮的鞘。/r/n The scabbard is content to be dull when it protects the keenness of the sword./r/n 刀鞘保护刀的锋利，它自己则满足于它的迟钝。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．脚手架（造房时搭的架子）
RECORD.lx: The worker fell down from the scaffold./r/n 那个工人从脚手架掉了下来。/r/n The brick-layer at the top of the scaffold is calling for more mortar./r/n 脚手架顶上的砌砖工人喊着要人再送些灰浆上去。/r/n
She was scalded when the boiler exploded./r/n 锅炉爆炸时她被烫伤了。/r/n This is an ointment for burns and scalds./r/n 这是治疗烧伤和烫伤的药膏。/r/n
The coffee was scalding hot./r/n 这咖啡是滚烫的。/r/n As if scalding her arm wasn't enough, she went and broke her ankle the next day./r/n 她烫伤了手臂还不算，竟然在第二天出去摔伤了踝节部。/r/n
Scale the fish before cooking them./r/n 烧鱼之前先去掉鱼鳞。/r/n We are seeing unemployment on an unprecedented scale./r/n 我们现在正经历规模空前的失业现象。/r/n
Scale the fish before cooking them./r/n 烧鱼之前先去掉鱼鳞。/r/n We are seeing unemployment on an unprecedented scale./r/n 我们现在正经历规模空前的失业现象。/r/n
You've just about scalped me!/r/n 你把我的头发剃得太短了！/r/n The Indians came back with their enemy's scalps./r/n 印地安人带着敌人的头皮回来了。/r/n
The doctor finished the operation, but his success depended on the backroom boys who had invented the new laser scalpel./r/n 医生做完了手术，但他的成功有赖于那些发明了新型激光手术刀的研究人员。/r/n
Giggling, the children scampered back into the house./r/n 孩子们咯咯笑着，蹦蹦跳跳地跑回屋里。/r/n The children were scampering around the garden./r/n 孩子们在花园里嬉戏奔跑。/r/n

The President is at the center of a recent scandal over revelation about his financial interests./r/n 总统因近来被揭露涉嫌金融权益问题而成为丑闻的主角。/r/n The recent scandal has provided the government's opponents with plenty of ammunition./r/n 最近的丑闻给政府的反对派提供了大量的炮弹。/r/n
We are surprised by his scandalous behaviour./r/n 我们很震惊他那令人反感的举止。/r/n The book contains scandalous text./r/n 该书含有诽谤性的内容。/r/n
He paid scant attention to what was said./r/n 他没怎么听讲。/r/n The movers gave me a scant hour's notice of their arrival./r/n 搬家的人只通知给我们短短的一小时，他们就来了。/r/n
The child was scared of the fierce looking dog./r/n 这孩子害怕那条外表凶恶的狗。/r/n The dog scared the thief away./r/n 狗把小偷吓走了。/r/n
She wore a woolen scarf around her neck./r/n 她脖子上戴了一条羊毛围巾。/r/n She threw a scarf over her shoulders./r/n 她在肩上披上一块肩巾。/r/n
The report is scathing about the lack of safety precaution./r/n 该报道对缺乏安全预防措施一事严加指责。/r/n The scathing editorial simply boils down to an exercise in partisan politics./r/n 措词强烈的社论可以简单地归结为政党政治的纲领/r/n

He is just fit for a job as scavenger./r/n 他正好当个清道夫之职。/r/n A small fraction of the creatures that die are preserved in this way before decay sets in or, even more likely, before scavengers eat them./r/n 只有一小部分死掉的生物在开始腐烂前，或者更可能的情况是，在食腐动物吃掉它们之前如此地保存起来。/r/n

It looked ominously like we were about to repeat the earlier scenario./r/n 而且看上去很不妙，好象我们又得重复上次那一幕了。/r/n For the rest of the day the port presented a scenario of furious productivity, guaranteed to warm the cockles of the dock boss's heart./r/n 那天其余的时间里，码头掀起了戏剧化的生产高潮，保证让船坞老板心满意足。/r/n
The police are on the scent of the thieves./r/n 警察发现了小偷的线索。/r/n There is a lavender scent and rosemary scent in the air./r/n 空气中有熏衣草和迷迭香花的味道。/r/n

He examined the wiring scheme carefully./r/n 他仔细检查线路图。/r/n She saw the possibilities of the scheme from the beginning./r/n 她从一开始就预见到这计画可能成功。/r/n

The long drought scorched the grass./r/n 久旱使青草枯萎。/r/n The meat will scorch if you don't lower the gas./r/n 如果你不把煤气调小一点，肉就要焦了。/r/n
He drew back from the scorching heat./r/n 他从灼人的热气中退了回来。/r/n It's scorching hot./r/n 天气热得火烧似的。/r/n

He poured scorn on my suggestion./r/n 他对我的建议表示轻蔑。/r/n She scorned our offers of help./r/n 她不屑接受我们的帮助。/r/n
A scorpion has a poisonous sting in its long jointed tail./r/n 蝎子的长尾巴上长着一个有毒的蛰针。/r/n The sting of a scorpion is in its tail./r/n 蝎子的毒钩在其尾部./r/n
The doctor scotched her false story./r/n 医生戳穿了她的骗局。/r/n Anyway, there never was any one more Scotch in this wide world./r/n 不管怎样，普天之下没有人比他更像一个苏格兰人了。/r/n

The police scoured the area looking for the lost child./r/n 警方搜遍这个地区寻找这个走失的孩子。/r/n He scoured off the dirt from the floor./r/n 他擦去地板上的污垢。/r/n

It's quite a scramble to get to the top of the hill!/r/n 要往上爬很长一段路才能到达山顶呢！/r/n People were scrambling madly for shelter./r/n 人们疯了似的抢着往隐蔽处跑。/r/n
You ought to scrap the old bike and buy a new one./r/n 你应该扔掉这辆旧自行车，买一辆新的。/r/n There is not a scrap of truth in what he says./r/n 他说的话没有半点是真的。/r/n

A less scrupulous man wouldn't have given the money back./r/n 换个不甚诚实的人是决不会把钱归还的。/r/n You must take the most scrupulous care to keep the wound free from the dirt./r/n 你必须非常小心地护理，以免伤口沾上污物。/r/n

A solid food prepared from the pressed curd of milk, often seasoned and aged./r/n 奶酪从经压缩过的牛奶凝聚物制成的固体食物，经常是风干的并且是陈年的/r/n The leaves of this plant, used as a seasoning./r/n 这种植物的叶子，可用作调料/r/n

She secludes herself in her study to work./r/n 她把自己关在书房里埋头研究./r/n You can't seclude yourself from the world./r/n 人不能与世隔绝./r/n
Hidden from view; secluded./r/n 隐退的隐藏不让看见的；隐退的/r/n A secluded structure, such as a bower, in a garden./r/n 凉亭一种在花园中建造的隐蔽性建筑物，如凉亭/r/n

The Hindu or Moslem system of sex segregation, practiced especially by keeping women in seclusion./r/n 深闺制度尤指使妇女处于隔离状态的印度或穆斯林的性隔离系统/r/n She lives in seclusion apart from her friend./r/n 她远离朋友，过隐居生活。/r/n

You should not drink the wine with a gritty sediment./r/n 不要喝有沙粒状沉淀物的葡萄酒。/r/n He emptied out the water barrel to clear it of sediment./r/n 他把水桶倒空以清掉桶底的沉淀物。/r/n

The seedling was frozen to death./r/n 幼苗被冻死了。/r/n The seedling have shrivel up a bit in the hot sun./r/n 在炎热的太阳光下，幼苗已有一点乾枯。/r/n

He keeps forgetting things: I think he's getting senile./r/n 他总忘事, 我看他是老了./r/n He may belong to senile residents who stray from home./r/n 他可能是那种离家迷失在外的昏聩老年人。/r/n

The soldier rigged up a shanty for a night's rest./r/n 士兵们临时胡乱搭起了一间小屋过夜。/r/n A trip through the shanty town brought home to me just how poor the people are./r/n 棚户区之行使我深切地感到那里的人民何等的贫穷。/r/n
He resigned in the face of mounting pressure from the shareholder./r/n 面临来自股东们日益增长的压力，他辞职了。/r/n The principal shareholder ask for a meeting./r/n 主要股东们要求召开会议。/r/n

Slender, curved wood shavings used especially for packing./r/n 细刨花尤用于包装的细长而弯曲的薄木屑/r/n A structural material made of wood fragments, such as chips or shavings, that are mechanically pressed into sheet form and bonded together with resin./r/n 碎料板由碎木，如木屑或创花制成的一种结构材料，用合成树脂粘合在一起并用机器压成板状/r/n
I gave her a knitted shawl as a Christmas gift./r/n 我送给她一条编织的披肩作圣诞礼物。/r/n She gathered the shawl round her/round her shoulders./r/n 她用披肩把自己[肩头]裹紧./r/n
The speaker had a sheaf of notes on the desk in front of him./r/n 演讲者在他面前的桌子上放着一叠笔记。/r/n
All her curls have been shorn off./r/n 她的一头卷发被剪得精光。/r/n With a few quick snips of the shears he pruned the bush./r/n 他用大剪刀几下子就把灌木给修剪好了./r/n
He is cutting the branches with a pair of shears./r/n 他正用一把大剪刀剪树枝。/r/n One that cuts, shears, or clips./r/n 修剪工切、剪或削的人/r/n

The sheath of connective tissue enclosing a bundle of nerve fibers./r/n 经来膜包裹住神经纤维的膜状结缔组织/r/n The innermost layer of the cortex that forms a sheath around the vascular tissue of roots and some stems./r/n 内皮层皮层的最内层，在根、茎的导管组织周围形成一道叶鞘（茎衣）/r/n
Where is the tool shed?/r/n 工具棚在哪？/r/n It's too late to change your mind now; so there is no point in shedding tears./r/n 你现在改变主意已经太迟了，所以为此而伤心落泪是毫无用处的。/r/n
Her face glowed with a healthy red sheen./r/n 她的脸上闪着健康的红光。/r/n The pearly sheen absorbed many people./r/n 珍珠的光泽吸引了很多人。/r/n
Those rare books are shelved in the East Library./r/n 那些珍贵的书籍都放在图书馆东馆的架子上。/r/n They had to shelve their holiday plans because their son was ill./r/n 他们不得不把度假计划搁置，因为他们的儿子病了。/r/n

The sheriff ordered the policemen to gather./r/n 警察局长命令警察集合。/r/n An official who assists a British sheriff and who has the power to execute writs, processes, and arrests./r/n 司法官协助英国执行官的官员，有权执行令状、发传票以及逮捕/r/n
A lazy or shiftless person, especially one who seeks to live solely by the support of others./r/n 懒鬼，游手好闲的人一个懒惰或得过且过的人，尤指靠别人施舍过生活的人/r/n
The hot pavement sent up shimmers./r/n 晒热的道路浮起热气晃动的景象。/r/n
I prefer a sandy beach to a shingle one./r/n 我喜欢沙滩，不喜欢遍布小石子的海滩./r/n The roof of our house is covered by shingles./r/n 我家的屋顶是用木瓦铺的。/r/n

The large room where the boys slept was all shipshape and Bristol fashion for the visitors inspection. It was tidier than I had ever seen it before./r/n 为了让访问者参观，男孩子们的大寝室弄得很整齐。它要比我们以前看到的更加整齐。/r/n I get the house all shipshape while he is away./r/n 他不在的时候，我把房子打扫得乾乾净净，整整齐齐。/r/n
You're supposed to tidy up, so stop shirking and do it!/r/n 要你来整理就别躲著了, 干吧!/r/n She is shirking going to the dentist./r/n 她躲著不愿意去治牙./r/n
Shoals of tourists come here in the summer./r/n 这里夏季常有大批游客。/r/n The boat struck a shoal and fetched up all standing./r/n 那艘船撞上浅滩突然停了下来。/r/n

Our new washing-machine keeps breaking down it's entirely due to shoddy workmanship./r/n 我们的新洗衣机老出毛病－－完全是因为做的质量太差。/r/n That salesman really took us for a ride, these goods are very shoddy./r/n 那个推销员真的欺骗了我们，这些都是劣质商品。/r/n
He started shoving clothes into drawers./r/n 他开始把衣服乱塞在抽屉里。/r/n Don't try to shove all the work onto me!/r/n 别把工作都推给我！/r/n
He put a shovel of coal on to the fire./r/n 他往火炉里加了一铲煤。/r/n They were shoveling food into their mouths./r/n 他们正大口大口地往嘴里塞食物。/r/n
A bauble is a showy ornament of little value./r/n 廉价珠宝是华而不实的装饰品。/r/n A showy manner or display./r/n 炫耀炫耀的态度或展示/r/n
He is a shrewd and sometimes ruthless adversary./r/n 他是个精明的、有时候冷酷无情的对手。/r/n It was a shrewd assessment and probably pretty close to the truth./r/n 这个评估很有道理，可能相当正确。/r/n
My sister gave a shriek of delight./r/n 我妹妹高兴地尖叫起来。/r/n She shrieked in alarm./r/n 她惊恐地尖叫起来。/r/n
Shrill protests about the new taxes filled the air./r/n 广播中充斥着对新税法的尖锐抗议。/r/n The boys broke into shrill, excited cheering./r/n 男孩子们突然迸发出刺耳的兴奋的欢呼声。/r/n

Florence is the shrine of the Renaissance./r/n 佛罗伦萨是文艺复兴的圣地。/r/n A religious building of the Far East, especially a many-storied Buddhist tower, erected as a memorial or shrine./r/n 塔，宝塔一种远东的宗教建筑，尤指一种多层的佛塔，作为纪念塔或神龛而建立/r/n
He had a tendency to shrink up whenever attention was focused on him./r/n 当别人注意他时，他就会退缩一旁。/r/n The economy is shrinking instead of growing./r/n 经济正在萎缩而不是在增长中。/r/n
The leaves shriveled up in the sun./r/n 叶子在阳光下都蔫了。/r/n The dry air shrivels the leather./r/n 因空气干燥皮子都皱了。/r/n
The doctor wanted us to use the sheet for a shroud./r/n 医生想让我们用床单当裹尸布。/r/n The whole jail was shrouded in darkness./r/n 整座监狱笼罩在黑暗之中。/r/n
She gave a shrug and walked away./r/n 她耸了耸肩就离开了。/r/n I really admire the way she is able to shrug off unfair criticism./r/n 我很佩服她能对错误的批评意见不予理会。/r/n
He must shuck off the bad habits./r/n 他应该改掉过去的坏习惯。/r/n It's not worth shucks./r/n 那种东西一文不值。/r/n
Who is going to shuffle?/r/n 该谁洗牌了？/r/n Don't shuffle, give me a clear answer./r/n 别支支吾吾，给我一个明确的答复。/r/n
This recluse shunned all company./r/n 这位隐士不与任何人来往。/r/n His friends shunned him./r/n 他的朋友都避开他。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．使（火车）转到另一轨道，转移方向
RECORD.lx: She tried to shunt the blame onto Miss Williams./r/n 她试图把责任推至威廉姆斯小姐身上。/r/n Can we shunt the talks onto a new topic?/r/n 我们谈话换个新话题好吧？/r/n
I have two brothers and a sister: three siblings in all./r/n 我有两个哥哥和一个妹妹: 共有三个兄妹./r/n Inferior craft; felt inferior to his older sibling./r/n 低等的手工艺品；感到比他的兄妹们低一等/r/n
The army has laid siege to the city several months./r/n 部队包围了这城市好几个月。/r/n Joan of Arc led a large army to raise the siege of Orleans in1429./r/n 贞德在1429年率大军解除了英军对奥尔良的围攻。/r/n
She is sieving the rice in order to sieve out the stones./r/n 她正在把米过筛，好把石头筛出。/r/n We can separate the stones out with a sieve./r/n 我们可以用一个筛子把石头分离出来。/r/n
Sift the flour before making the cake./r/n 做蛋糕前先把面粉筛一下。/r/n Snow sifted through the crack in the roof into the room./r/n 雪从屋顶上的裂缝飘进屋里。/r/n

Solidifying chiefly as a minor intrusion, especially as a dike or sill, before reaching the earth's surface. Used of rocks./r/n 半深成的，浅成的在到达地球表面之前的主要作为小型岩石群固化的，尤其象岩脉或岩床的凝固用于指岩石/r/n A thin plank fastened to the side of a boat or to the sill of a port to keep out the sea and the spray./r/n 挡水板，防浪板缚于船边或港基的薄木板。用来阻挡海水及其喷溅/r/n
The harbor is being up with silt./r/n 那海港被淤泥阻塞了。/r/n A concrete wall is built to stop silt from leaking to the conservation land./r/n 一道水泥墙修筑起来，用以防止泥沙流进保留地。/r/n
Her style is rich in simile./r/n 她的文体中用很多比喻。/r/n There are many daring similes in this book./r/n 这本书中使用了很多明喻。/r/n

An apparatus in which human beings or animals are enclosed and which is revolved to simulate the effects of acceleration in a spacecraft./r/n 航天试验离心机人和动物在其里面并旋转以模仿宇宙飞行器的加速作用的一种仪器/r/n Some moths simulate dead leaves./r/n 有些蛾拟态为枯叶。/r/n

In such a simulated environment, one would have an immersed sense./r/n 人在这个仿真的环境中，有一种“身临其境”的感觉。/r/n A large-scale tactical exercise carried out under simulated conditions of war./r/n 对抗演习在模拟战争状态下所进行大型战术训练/r/n
The simultaneous demonstrations are held in London and New York./r/n 在伦敦和纽约同时举行示威游行。/r/n The explosion was timed to be simultaneous with the plane's take-off./r/n 爆炸的时间定在飞机起飞的时刻。/r/n
The athletes waited, with all their sinews tensed./r/n 运动员都在等待著, 全身肌肉十分紧张./r/n A country's sinews are its roads and railways./r/n 公路和铁路是国家的命脉./r/n
The man has sinewy muscles./r/n 那男子有着强壮有力的肌肉。/r/n I admire her sinewy prose style./r/n 我钦佩她那强劲有力的散文风格。/r/n
The iron's too hot, you'll singe the dress./r/n 熨斗太热了, 你会把衣服烫焦的./r/n The rug singed because it was too near the fire./r/n 地毯太靠近壁炉已烤焦了./r/n
He showed his sinister motive at last./r/n 他终于露出了他那邪恶的用心。/r/n His sinister look frightened them./r/n 他那阴险的神情吓坏了他们。/r/n
A sinuous path, line, or marking./r/n 弯弯曲曲的道路、线条或记号/r/n Marked by or moving in a wavelike form or motion; sinuous./r/n 波状的或以波浪式运动的；起伏不平的/r/n
Bees sip honey from flowers and hum their thanks when they leave./r/n 蜜蜂从花中啜蜜，离开时营营地道谢。/r/n I sipped at the coffee./r/n 我啜饮咖啡。/r/n
An ambulance was racing along with its sirens wailing./r/n 救护车响着警报急驰而过。/r/n We all heard the air-raid siren./r/n 我们都听到了空袭警报器的声音。/r/n
Whew! What a sizzler!/r/n 唷! 多热的天哪!/r/n
She passed me a skein of wool./r/n 她递给我一绞毛线。/r/n
The leader had the gift of being able to infuse enthusiasm into the most skeptical member of the group./r/n 那位领导人很有天赋，能使团体中最持怀疑态度的人都充满热情。/r/n
Your essay gives a rather sketchy treatment of the problem./r/n 你的文章只粗略地涉及到这个问题./r/n Information about the crisis was sketchy and hard to get./r/n 关於这次危机的消息所知甚少并且很难获得./r/n
The picture is a bit skew./r/n 这幅画有点歪./r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．（烤肉用的）串肉杆v．用杆串好
RECORD.lx: He skewered his foot on a nail./r/n 他的脚踩在钉子上了./r/n
Rub up the skillet please./r/n 请把长柄锅擦亮。/r/n
They have to skimp on fuel in winter./r/n 冬天他们得节省燃料./r/n Use plenty of oil. Don't skimp!/r/n 多用些油. 别省著!/r/n
This area is peaceful except for a few skirmishes in the distance./r/n 除了远处的零星的小冲突之外，这个地区是和平的。/r/n The skirmish grew into a major battle./r/n 小冲突扩大形成大战斗。/r/n
The victim's skull had been stove in by a heavy instrument./r/n 遇害者的头颅是用重物击穿的./r/n The farmer turned up a human skull while ploughing the field./r/n 那农民 地时挖出一个人类的头颅骨./r/n
Did she also take the skunk to her bosom?/r/n 她把臭鼬也抱在怀里吗？/r/n Exclusiveness is a characteristic of recent riches, high society, and the skunk./r/n 排他主义，是为了近来的有钱人家、上流阶级以及臭鼬等的特色。/r/n
Prices skyrocketed./r/n 物价飞涨。/r/n
The top of the table was formed by a stone slab./r/n 桌面是一块石板。/r/n A slab of stone laid flat over a grave./r/n 平放在墓上的纪念碑石/r/n
Please slacken the tent rope before it rains./r/n 下雨前，请将帐篷的绳索放松。/r/n The train slackened speed as we approached the station./r/n 当我们快到车站时，火车减慢了速度。/r/n

Some come off in the form of gases, others collect as slag./r/n 有的化成气体跑掉了，有的结成了熔渣。/r/n The limestone absorb impurity from the ore and form a fluid slag which floats on the surface of the heavier molten iron./r/n 石灰石吸咐了铁矿石中的杂质，形成浮在较重的铁水表面上的流动渣。/r/n
Hasn't NATO slaked his lust for blood?/r/n 难道北约还没有满足他的血腥的欲望吗？/r/n We had to slake ourselves with rainwater in the desert./r/n 在沙漠中我们不得不用雨水解渴。/r/n

A plaintiff's interpretation in a libel suit of allegedly libelous or slanderous material./r/n 对被告诽谤言辞的解释在诽谤案件中，原告对所称的诽谤的或谣言的材料的解释/r/n Containing or implying calumny; slanderous or defamatory./r/n 栽赃的含有或隐含有明知故犯嫌疑的；诽谤或中伤的/r/n
Most handwriting slants to the right./r/n 大多数手写体都向右斜。/r/n We slanted across the river./r/n 我们斜渡过河。/r/n
I've no change, could you put these eggs on the slate?/r/n 我没零钱，能把这些蛋钱记在帐上吗？/r/n The falling slate sliced into his arm./r/n 落下来的一块石片划破了他的手臂./r/n
The dealer was slavering over some precious stones./r/n 那商人对一些宝石垂涎欲滴./r/n Stop slavering over thatbaby!/r/n 别总看著人家的孩子了!/r/n
The report is scathing about the lack of safety precaution./r/n 该报道对缺乏安全预防措施一事严加指责。/r/n The scathing editorial simply boils down to an exercise in partisan politics./r/n 措词强烈的社论可以简单地归结为政党政治的纲领/r/n
Your jokes slay me./r/n 你的笑话笑死我了。/r/n Two visitors were brutally slain yesterday./r/n 昨天有两名游客惨遭杀害。/r/n
Printing business cards on a thirty-inch press is using a sledgehammer to crack a nut./r/n 在30英寸印刷机上印刷名片简直是大材小用，得不偿失。/r/n
The lion's fur is sleek./r/n 狮子的毛皮整洁而光亮。/r/n He sleeked back his hair with water before going in to meet her./r/n 他进去见她之前，用水将头发梳理得很光亮。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．巧妙手法，巧计，灵巧（分割
RECORD.lx: Manual skill and dexterity in the execution of tricks; sleight of hand./r/n 手法敏捷变戏法时手法的熟练和敏捷；戏法/r/n
The car slewed round on the icy road./r/n 车在结冰的路上打滑了。/r/n The captain could not slew the ship round in time to avoid an accident./r/n 船长没能及时地掉转船头避免事故发生。/r/n
A basket, an enclosure, or an instrument sling suspended from and carried aloft by a balloon./r/n 气球吊篮悬在空中吊在气球下的篮子，封闭舱或仪器舱/r/n The line of flags was slung up between two trees./r/n 一排旗帜悬挂在两棵树之间。/r/n
The thief slunk down the dark alley./r/n 那个贼偷偷钻进黑胡同里./r/n The dog slunk out when I shouted at him./r/n 我向那条狗一喊, 它就溜出去了./r/n
She slit cloth into strips./r/n 她把布撕成细条。/r/n The rider's jacket is slit up the back to make it more comfortable to wear when riding./r/n 骑手的夹克后背上开着长叉，使他骑在马上穿着更舒服。/r/n
The glass slivered when it fell./r/n 玻璃杯掉在地上摔碎了./r/n A sliver of citrus peel twisted over or dropped into a beverage for flavoring./r/n 橘子皮放入或加入饮料中调味的一小块橘子皮/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．口水，v．流口水，粗俗地表示
RECORD.lx: Baby has slobbered his bib./r/n 婴儿已经把围兜弄湿了。/r/n
An enemy frigate bore down on the sloop./r/n 一艘敌驱逐舰向这只护航舰逼过来。/r/n
It's sloppy job you're doing./r/n 你这活干得太稀松了。/r/n
Sloths live in trees and move very slowly./r/n 树獭生活在树上而且行动缓慢。/r/n He has kept sloth out./r/n 他已经克服了懒惰。/r/n
Every spring this snake sloughs off its skin, as it has grown too big for it./r/n 每年春天这条蛇都要蜕去旧皮，因为它身体长大，旧皮不适用了。/r/n The name of the slough was Despond./r/n 这个深渊名叫绝望。/r/n
There is a sluggish stream./r/n 那有一条流速缓慢的溪流。/r/n These tablets make me feel rather sluggish./r/n 我吃了这些药片感到困倦无力。/r/n
Water sluiced out of the hole./r/n 水从洞口流出。/r/n The stables were sluiced out with water from a hose./r/n 马厩已经用水管子冲洗过了。/r/n
The volcano had slumbered for years./r/n 这火山已经很多年不活动了。/r/n The baby slumbered in his cradle./r/n 婴儿安睡在摇篮里。/r/n
The slump hit his business hard./r/n 物价暴跌使他的生意大受打击。/r/n The current economic slump is an earnest of the major recession to come./r/n 当前的经济滑坡预示着一次大的衰退即将来临。/r/n
She slurred over the high cost of her plan./r/n 她避而不提她这一计画费用之巨./r/n A curved line indicating such a phrase; a slur./r/n 连线表示这个乐句的弧线；连线/r/n
We smeared cream on our faces./r/n 我们在脸上搽雪花膏。/r/n This accusation of bribery is a vile smear on an honorable citizen./r/n 这项有关贿赂的指控是对一个正直公民的无耻诽谤。/r/n
The ore is smelted in this large factory./r/n 这个大型工厂里熔炼矿石。/r/n The newly ploughed fields smelt sweet./r/n 新犁过的土地散发着芳香。/r/n
A guilty smirk; a guilty secret./r/n 罪恶的假笑；罪恶的秘密/r/n Come on, professor, does not smirk at me like that./r/n 拜托！老师，你不要那样对着我假笑。/r/n
If you put too much coal on the fire at once you'll smother it./r/n 在火上一下子添上很多煤, 反而能把火闷死./r/n Smother the flames from the burning pan with a wet towel./r/n 用湿毛巾把锅里的火扑灭./r/n
They smuggled Swiss watches into China./r/n 他们走私瑞士表进中国。/r/n He was arrested for smuggling out currency./r/n 他因携带货币出境而被捕。/r/n
She was wearing a snappy little red number./r/n 她身著一款时髦的红色连衣裙./r/n Pack your bags and make it snappy; we leave in five minutes./r/n 赶快把东西装进你们的包里，5分钟后我们就走。/r/n
He fell into a snare laid by his enemy./r/n 他落入敌人设的圈套。/r/n A snare or trap for game./r/n 狩猎用的陷阱或圈套/r/n
Traffic was badly snarled up near the accident./r/n 车祸现场附近交通极为混乱。/r/n The dog snarled at the milkman./r/n 那条狗对著送牛奶的人低声吠叫./r/n
Traffic was badly snarled up near the accident./r/n 车祸现场附近交通极为混乱。/r/n The machine snarled the material up./r/n 机器把材料搅在一起了./r/n
The hawk snatched the chicken and flew away./r/n 老鹰抓住小鸡飞走了。/r/n He snatched up his gun and fired./r/n 他突然拿起枪来射击。/r/n
He sneaked a chocolate from the box./r/n 他从盒子里偷拿了一块巧克力。/r/n The cat ate the food and sneaked off./r/n 猫吃完食物就偷偷跑了。/r/n
James loves sneaking up on his sister to frighten her./r/n 詹姆斯喜欢溜到妹妹身後吓她一大跳。/r/n James love sneaking up on his sister to frighten her./r/n 詹姆斯喜欢溜到妹妹身后吓她一大跳。/r/n
He paid no attention to their sneers./r/n 他对他们的嘲笑置之不理。/r/n Don't sneer at their religion./r/n 不要嘲笑他们的宗教。/r/n
Her shabby appearance drew sniggers from the guests./r/n 她样子寒酸, 客人不禁暗自发笑./r/n What are you sniggering at? Haven't you seen people kissing before?/r/n 你们笑什麽? 没见过接吻吗?/r/n
He snipped off the corner of the milk carton./r/n 他剪掉牛奶袋的边角。/r/n He snipped the string and untied the parcel./r/n 他剪断绳子，解开包裹。/r/n
He is not a snob and therein lay his downfall./r/n 他不是个势利小人，而他失败的原因正在于此。/r/n This part of the town has a lot of snob appeal./r/n 该城的这一区很能吸引自视甚高的人./r/n

Jane feels she can never compete with these snobbish, elegant people./r/n 简·爱感到她永远无法同这些高雅却势利的人们竞争。/r/n It is strange that he should fall in love with such a snobbish girl./r/n 说来真怪，他居然与那位高傲的女孩子坠入情网。/r/n

The house perfects often snoop around our campus at night./r/n 学生纠察队经常夜间在校园里巡逻。/r/n I say you kiss my wife! what have you to say.- Do not let me catch you snoop again!/r/n 我说你跟我老婆亲嘴！你有什么话说。——可别让我再看到你偷偷摸摸的探头头脑！/r/n
The dad-blamed car got stuck in a snowdrift./r/n 该死的汽车陷在雪堆里了。/r/n In the severe winter of1947, farmers had to dig their livestock out of huge snowdrifts./r/n 在1947年严峻的冬天，农民们不得不挖开大雪堆把他们的家畜救出来。/r/n

The second snub settled his hash./r/n 第二次碰壁使他不敢再找麻烦了。/r/n I know the way we were snubbed still rankles, but it's got to be put behind us now. We must cooperate with these people./r/n 我知道，他们过去那样冷落我们，至今仍然令人气愤，但是现在我们应该把它置之脑后，因为我们必须同这些人合作。/r/n
He sat in a snug little room./r/n 他坐在一个舒适的小房间里。/r/n Snug, comfortable, and warm./r/n 舒适的、惬意的和温暖的/r/n
They snuggled up (together) in bed./r/n 他们依偎著躺在床上./r/n The child snuggled up to her mother./r/n 那孩子紧贴在母亲身边./r/n
Are you in favour of soaking the rich?/r/n 你赞成向富人多徵税吗？/r/n Don't stand out there: you'll get soaked through./r/n 你别站在外边，要不全身都要湿透了/r/n
The rain had soaked through his coat./r/n 雨把他的大衣淋透了./r/n The blood soaked through his shirt and stained his jacket./r/n 他的血透过衬衫染污了上衣./r/n
He sobered up quickly when he heard the terrible news./r/n 他听到这个坏消息，马上就清醒过来了。/r/n The bad news had a sobering effect on all of us./r/n 对我们大家来说，这个坏消息是发人深省的。/r/n
The speaker really socked it to them!/r/n 发言的人给他们个迎头痛击!/r/n Can't you put a sock in it? I'm trying to work./r/n 别出声了好不好? 我要工作呢./r/n
My shoes are sodden from walking in the rain./r/n 我在雨里这么一跑，鞋都湿了。/r/n
If you boil the vegetables too long, they'll go soggy./r/n 要是你把蔬菜煮得太久，菜就糊了。/r/n Resembling a marsh; soggy./r/n 沼泽地的象沼泽地的；湿润的/r/n
She makes her living from the soil./r/n 她以务农为生。/r/n What shall we grow in this alkaline soil?/r/n 我们应该在碱性土壤里种什么？/r/n
He sojourned with a friend in Wales for two weeks./r/n 他在威尔士一个朋友那儿住了两个星期./r/n
I found solace from troubles in listening to music./r/n 我听音乐，以便在烦恼时得到安慰。/r/n The sick man found solace in music./r/n 那男病人从音乐中获得了安慰./r/n
He soldered the wire back on./r/n 他把金属丝重新焊上去了。/r/n
The judge took up the gavel with solemnity./r/n 法官严肃地拿起了小木槌。/r/n Solemnity is a trick of the body to hide the faults of the mind./r/n 一本正经的态度，是肉体为了掩饰精神上的缺陷而作出的一手花招。/r/n

She was fined for soliciting./r/n 她因拉客而被罚款./r/n An employee who stands before the entrance to a show, as at a carnival, and solicits customers with a loud, colorful sales spiel./r/n 大声叫卖者在巡回演出时，站在入口处以大声叫喊或各种各样降价推销招徕顾客的雇员/r/n
I accepted the gifts at her solicitation./r/n 在她的恳求之下，我接受了礼物。/r/n His selfishness caused him to refuse my solicitation./r/n 他的自私让他拒绝了我的请求。/r/n
She is so solicitous and persistent that she virtually kills you with kindness./r/n 她非常关心而固执，以致她的善意实际上反而使人感到尴尬。/r/n I am solicitous of his help./r/n 我渴得到他的帮助。/r/n
A solitary rider was seen in the distance./r/n 远处有个孤零零的骑马的人。/r/n The trapper leads a solitary life in the mountains./r/n 那个设陷阱捕猎的人孤独地生活在山里。/r/n
I am not fond of solitude./r/n 我不喜欢孤独。/r/n The scientist has spent six months in the solitudes of the Antarctic./r/n 这位科学家已经在人迹罕至的南极待了六个月了。/r/n
The piano solo was well rendered./r/n 那支钢琴独奏曲弹得真好。/r/n The concert began with a piano solo./r/n 音乐会以钢琴独奏曲拉开序幕。/r/n

The hypothetical universal solvent once sought by alchemists./r/n 万能溶剂炼金术士曾一度寻求的假想的万能溶剂/r/n The chemical process by means of which a change in physical condition, as in pressure or temperature, or the action of a solvent causes a molecule to split into simpler groups of atoms, single atoms, or ions./r/n 离解（作用）在物理状态下，如在压力或温度下的变化，或在溶剂的作用下，使分子分离为更简单的一组原子、单原子或离子的化学过程/r/n
Fears about the solvency of the banks precipitated the great economic crash./r/n 对银行偿付能力出现恐慌更加速了经济的崩溃。/r/n
She looked up staring at the somber December sky./r/n 她抬起头来，凝望着十二月份阴沉沉的天空。/r/n A funeral is a somber occasion./r/n 葬礼是个忧郁的场合。/r/n
The noise of the stream had a pleasantly somnolent effect./r/n 小河潺潺的流水声有宜人的催眠效果./r/n
Her recital led off/She led off her recital with a Haydn sonata./r/n 她在独奏会上首先演出的是海顿的奏鸣曲./r/n The first part of a composition in sonata form that introduces the themes./r/n 呈示部奏呜曲式音乐作品中表现主旋律的第一部分/r/n
There is a sonorous bell in the tower./r/n 塔里有一口洪亮的钟。/r/n The sonorous voice of the priest resounded in the church./r/n 教士那圆润低沉的声音在教堂里回响。/r/n
She is sweeping the soot off the chimney./r/n 她正把烟筒里的黑灰扫掉。/r/n You'vegot a smudge of soot on your cheek./r/n 你脸上有块煤灰污迹./r/n
He won the argument by sophistry./r/n 他靠诡辩赢了那场争论./r/n Deception by trickery or sophistry./r/n 圈套通过诡计或诡辩进行的欺骗/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．老于世故的，（仪器）精密的
RECORD.lx: As far as defense is concerned, we need to buy more sophisticated weapons./r/n 就防御的观点来说，我们需要购买更多精密的武器。/r/n The electronics aboard the new aircraft are very sophisticated./r/n 安装在新飞行器上的电子器件非常复杂/r/n
Inducing sleep or sedation; soporific./r/n 安神的，麻醉的，镇静的/r/n Inducing sleep; soporific./r/n 睡眠的产生睡眠的，引起酣睡的/r/n
The young soprano was taken up by a famous conductor./r/n 那年轻的女高音歌手受到一著名指挥家的提携./r/n It's a soprano of great compass and of great purity./r/n 这是一种音域宽广，高度纯正的女高音。/r/n
The house was disappeared by sorcery./r/n 这座房子被魔法变没了。/r/n At that time most people believe in sorcery and witchcraft./r/n 那时候大多数人相信巫术和魔法。/r/n
He lived in a sordid slum./r/n 他生活在一个污秽的贫民窟。/r/n He has sordid motives on us./r/n 他对我们有卑鄙的动机。/r/n
After lying on the street for two hours the souse sober up and walk home./r/n 在街上躺了两个小时後，酒鬼醒了过来走回家去。/r/n Souse fish used to be one of her favorite dish./r/n 腌鱼曾经是她最喜欢吃的菜之一。/r/n
I have no idea what will be a good souvenir from a ski trip./r/n 滑雪之旅回来时，买什么纪念品好，我一点主意也没有。/r/n I bought this bag as a souvenir of my visit to London./r/n 我买了这个袋子作为访问伦敦的纪念品。/r/n
When did it become a sovereign country?/r/n 这个国家是什么时候成为主权国的？/r/n Character is of sovereign importance./r/n 人品最为重要。/r/n

The sovereignty of these islands is in dispute./r/n 这些岛屿的主权有争执。/r/n An Australian-administered island in the eastern Indian Ocean south of Java. It was annexed by Great Britain in1888 and came under Australian sovereignty in1958./r/n 圣诞岛爪哇岛南部印度洋东部的一座岛屿，由澳大利亚管辖。在1888年由英国吞并，1958年主权归澳大利亚/r/n
These seeds should be sown in April./r/n 这些种子应在四月播种。/r/n His words had sowed the seeds of suspicion in their minds./r/n 他的话已在他们心中播下怀疑的种子。/r/n
In its spacious halls are displayed over8000 priceless relics./r/n 在它宽敞的大厅里，展出了8000多件珍贵文物。/r/n The systematic arrangement of chairs makes the hall look spacious./r/n 座椅按照顺序排列，这使得礼堂里显得很宽敞。/r/n
The boy got a sound spanking./r/n 那男孩的屁股著实挨了一顿巴掌./r/n
The boy got a sound spanking./r/n 那男孩的屁股著实挨了一顿巴掌./r/n The ship is spanking along./r/n 船在平稳前进。/r/n
Can you spare me five minutes?/r/n 你能抽出五分钟和我谈谈吗？/r/n It was a horrible accident---I'll spare you the details./r/n 这是一次令人毛骨悚然的事故，我就不告诉你细节了。/r/n
There was a wild spark in his eyes./r/n 他的两眼炯炯发光。/r/n The vital spark in him makes him an artist./r/n 他的生气勃勃的活力使他成为一个艺术家。/r/n
The wet grass sparkles in the sun./r/n 太阳使湿草闪闪发光。/r/n I like the sparkles in her eyes./r/n 我喜欢她眼睛的光彩。/r/n
He has a sparse beard./r/n 他长着稀疏的胡子。/r/n The television coverage of the event was rather sparse./r/n 电视上对这件事报道很少。/r/n
They burst into a spasm of laughter./r/n 他们爆发出一阵笑声。/r/n The muscles in the athlete's leg went into spasm./r/n 那运动员的腿抽筋了。/r/n
The abnormal, spasmodic swallowing of air, especially as a symptom of hysteria./r/n 吞气症异常的痉挛性吞气，特指歇斯底里的症状/r/n A sudden reflexive or spasmodic muscular movement./r/n 抽搐，痉挛突然反射或痉挛的肌肉运动/r/n
There is only a spat between the brother and sister./r/n 那只是兄妹间的小吵小闹。/r/n Her parents always have spats./r/n 她的父母经常有些小的口角。/r/n
After the storm all the rivers were in spate./r/n 暴雨过後河水都上涨了./r/n
He scraped the mixture out of the bowl with a plastic spatula./r/n 他用塑料铲把盆里的混合料刮了出来./r/n She levelled the surface of the cake mixture with a metal spatula./r/n 她用金属铲抹平了蛋糕配料./r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．（鱼等）卵子，v．大量产卵，大量生产
RECORD.lx: The computer industry has spawned a lot of new companies./r/n 由于电脑工业的发展，许多新公司纷纷成立。/r/n I found a mass of spawn in the fish before cooking./r/n 烧鱼前，我发现鱼里有很多鱼籽。/r/n
The fisher used a spear as his weapon./r/n 渔夫用矛作为武器。/r/n The spear curved through the air./r/n 标枪在空中沿曲线运动./r/n
It also incorporate new optimization specific to particular server and local database format./r/n 它也把新的优化细节合并到特殊服务器与本地数据库格式中。/r/n He gave us very specific instructions./r/n 他给我们做了非常明确的指示。/r/n
The museum displays the specimen of ancient Chinese porcelain./r/n 这个博物馆展出中国古瓷器标本。/r/n He is still a fine specimen of health./r/n 他仍是健康的典范。/r/n
The debate aroused not a speck of public interest./r/n 这次争论没有引起公众丝毫的兴趣。/r/n You can't eat bread covered with dark specks./r/n 你可不能吃满是黑斑的面包啊。/r/n
The new play was a spectacular success./r/n 这出新戏获得了巨大的成功。/r/n The goalkeeper made a spectacular dive to save the goal./r/n 守门员做了一个精彩的鱼跃动作救回一球./r/n
The specter of unemployment hunted the country./r/n 失业的幽灵在这个国家作祟。/r/n A supernatural being; a ghost or specter./r/n 下凡的神仙超自然力的灵魂；鬼魂或幽灵/r/n
There's a wide spectrum of opinions on this problem./r/n 对这个问题的说法众说纷纭，莫衷一是。/r/n Red and violet are at opposite ends of the spectrum./r/n 红色和紫色位于光谱相对的两端。/r/n
He makes some unprofitable speculations./r/n 他在做些无利可图的投机生意。/r/n They have much speculation over the cause of the air crash./r/n 他们对飞机坠毁原因有多方推测。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．连续的一段时间，一阵子
RECORD.lx: After a short spell in hospital she was soon back at work./r/n 她在医院住了一段时间后，很快又回来上班了。/r/n The Americans spell some words differently from the British./r/n 美国人拼写某些单词不同于英国人。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．狮身人面像，谜一样的人
RECORD.lx: I've always found her rather sphinx-like./r/n 我总觉得她像个谜一样, 难以捉摸./r/n
There are many sharp spikes on the railings in the park./r/n 公园的栏杆上有很多尖头。/r/n A pointed tool, such as a spike or chisel, used for breaking rock or ore./r/n 钢楔一种如尖铁或凿子等有尖的，用于劈裂岩石或砂石的工具/r/n
He's too spineless to ask for more money./r/n 他没有勇气要求更多的钱。/r/n
The spinster is very sad./r/n 那个老处女很悲伤。/r/n In America law and custom alike is based upon the dream of spinster./r/n 在美国，法律与风俗习惯一样，是把基础置于老处女的梦想之上。/r/n
A snail's shell is spiral in form./r/n 蜗牛壳是螺旋形的。/r/n The smoke spiraled upwards./r/n 那股烟袅袅上升。/r/n
We could see the spire of the church in the distance./r/n 我们可以看到远处教堂的尖塔。/r/n The spires of churches are to be seen pricking up through the greenery./r/n 透过葱翠的树林可以看见那耸立着的教堂的塔尖。/r/n
I went shopping in spite of the rain./r/n 尽管下雨，我还是出去买东西了。/r/n I'm sure he took my parking space just to spite me./r/n 我认为他侵占我的停车位肯定是有意和我作对。/r/n
We had a splendid holiday./r/n 我们度过了一个极好的假期。/r/n Their weeding was a splendid affair./r/n 他们的婚礼富丽堂皇。/r/n

We admired the splendor of the mountain scenery./r/n 我们赞赏着壮丽的山景。/r/n In the afternoon of that first seeing day, I should take a long walk in the woods and intoxicate my eyes on the beauties of the world of Nature trying desperately to absorb in a few hours the vast splendor which is constantly unfolding itself to those who/r/n 那能看见的第一天的下午，我要在树林里长久地散步，让我的目光陶醉在大自然世界的美景之中。在几个小时中，试图拼命地吸收那无穷的壮丽，这对那些能看见的人却是一条小路。/r/n
Have you heard?John's just got spliced./r/n 听说了吗? 约翰刚结了婚./r/n He can splice together the broken ends of ropes quickly./r/n 他能把断了的绳子头快速接起来。/r/n
Some splinters of glass had got into his feet./r/n 他的脚上扎了一些碎玻璃屑。/r/n I got a splinter in my finger while I was moving the boxes./r/n 我在搬箱子的时候手指头上扎了一根刺。/r/n
If I tell where I'm going, promise you won't split on me?/r/n 如果我告诉你我去哪，你愿意保证守口如瓶吗？/r/n Suddenly the box split open and a puppy jumped out./r/n 箱子突然打开，从里面蹦出只小狗。/r/n
I had a splurge and bought two new suits./r/n 我大手大脚花了一笔钱买了两套新衣服./r/n She won 100 and then splurged it all on new clothes./r/n 她赢了100英镑, 都挥霍在买新衣服上了./r/n
He spoke to the class about the dangers of smoking./r/n 他给班上学生讲了吸烟的危害性。/r/n She always spoke kindly to the children./r/n 她总是亲切地和孩子们说话。/r/n
There grows some spongy moss on the stone./r/n 石头上长着一些柔软的苔藓。/r/n Drank the fresh air; spongy earth that drank up the rain./r/n 呼吸新鲜空气；饱浸雨水的绵软泥土/r/n
She shows a spontaneous gaiety of manner./r/n 她露出天真愉快的神态。/r/n Spontaneous fellowship and sympathy among a number of people./r/n 本能的友情一群人自然产生的友谊和同情/r/n
You've been spoofed./r/n 你上当了./r/n
I need one more spool of thread before finishing the embroidery./r/n 再来一轴线我就可以完成这幅刺绣了。/r/n The film flew off the spool and wound itself round the projector./r/n 电影胶片从卷轴滑出缠绕在放映机上了./r/n
Despite the sporadic disturbances the dictator was still riding high./r/n 虽不时有骚动事件，该独裁者仍能控制局势。/r/n
Football is my favorite sport./r/n 足球是我最喜欢的运动。/r/n Sport is being debased by commercialism./r/n 体育运动的价值受商业化的影响而逐渐下降。/r/n
Water is spouting out of the pipe./r/n 水正从管子里喷出来。/r/n The spout of the teapot is jammed by tea./r/n 茶壶的壶口被茶叶堵住了。/r/n
The doctor ordered the man who had sprained his ankle to keep quiet a few days./r/n 医生命令那扭伤足踝的人静养几天。/r/n My sprained ankle has been acting up badly all week./r/n 我的脚扭伤了, 整整难受了一个星期./r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．n．伸展手足而卧，懒散地躺
RECORD.lx: He lay in a sprawl over the desk./r/n 他手脚摊开趴在书桌上。/r/n They were sprawled out in front of the fire./r/n 他们摊开手脚烤火。/r/n
He decorated the chicken with sprigs of parsley./r/n 他用欧芹的嫩枝点缀在鸡上。/r/n

The patient smiled when he heard the sprightly music on the radio./r/n 听到收音机里传来的轻快乐曲，这个病人笑了。/r/n A usually sprightly or mischievous or sometimes spiteful person./r/n 恶作剧的人，狡诈的人，恶毒的人通常活泼的或恶作剧的或怀有恶意的人/r/n

A container with small holes in the top for sprinkling ground pepper./r/n 胡椒瓶一种顶部有很多倒胡椒粉小孔的容器/r/n The ceremony of sprinkling the altar, clergy, and congregation with holy water./r/n 洒圣水礼用圣水泼洒圣坛、教士及教众的仪式/r/n
He sprinted past the other runners just before reaching the tape./r/n 他在到达终点之前全速冲刺, 超越了其他赛跑者./r/n You'll have to sprint if you want to catch the train./r/n 你要想赶上火车, 就得快跑几步./r/n
Leaves began to sprout from the trees./r/n 树上开始长叶子了。/r/n These potatoes have begun to sprout./r/n 这些马铃薯开始发芽了。/r/n
Spruce and pine are evergreen trees./r/n 云杉和松树都是常绿树木。/r/n They all spruced up for the party./r/n 他们打扮得漂漂亮亮去参加聚会。/r/n
Spunk up before the public at least./r/n 至少你要在公众面前打起精神来。·/r/n Spunk up, everything will be all right./r/n 别恢心，一切都会好起来的。/r/n
Characterized by adulteration; spurious./r/n 掺假的以掺假为特征的；伪造的/r/n Spurious writings, especially writings falsely attributed to biblical characters or times./r/n 伪经伪造的经文，尤指假托圣经人物或圣经时代所写的经文/r/n
I spurn your offer./r/n 我拒绝你的提议。/r/n Carl had been from his childhood a ball of fortune to spurn at./r/n 自从童年时起卡尔就一直是一个被命运跑踢来踢去的球，饱经沧桑。/r/n
A cheap or squalid theater./r/n 跳蚤窝低劣的或肮脏的剧院/r/n A squalid or filthy condition./r/n 肮脏污秽或肮脏的状态/r/n
There is indescribable squalor in those books./r/n 那些书简直污秽不堪。/r/n
He has squandered all his savings on drink./r/n 他把存的钱全买酒喝了。/r/n Don't squander your affection on him, he'll never love you./r/n 不要把感情浪费在他身上，他是永远不会爱你的。/r/n
He sat on his hat and squashed it flat./r/n 他坐在自己的帽子上，把它压扁了。/r/n The cat got run over by the lorry and squashed./r/n 那只猫被卡车碾死了。/r/n
Can you find somewhere to squat?/r/n 你找个地方坐下好吗?/r/n The old man squatted down by the fire./r/n 老人蹲在炉火旁。/r/n
The army get bogged down in the thick squelch mud./r/n 军队都陷入泥沼中，行进时烂泥扑哧作声。/r/n She squelched along the muddy path./r/n 她沿着泥泞小径格吱格吱地走。/r/n
She stabbed him in the leg with a kitchen knife./r/n 她拿菜刀捅伤了他的腿./r/n The killer stabbed him with a knife/stabbed a knife into him./r/n 凶手用刀刺他./r/n
The unexpected blow did not stagger his resolution./r/n 这个意外的打击并没有动摇他的决心。/r/n The drunk man staggered across the room./r/n 那个醉汉摇摇晃晃地穿过房间。/r/n
The soldier receive no staggering wind from any of the three shot./r/n 三枪中的任何一枪都没使这个士兵受到什麽惊人的枪伤。/r/n He was staggering across the room and had obviously had a few./r/n 他在房间里摇摇晃晃地走着，很显然他已喝醉了。/r/n
Due to low investment, our industrial output has remained stagnant./r/n 由于投资少，我们的工业生产一直停滞不前。/r/n Business was stagnant last month./r/n 上个月生意萧条./r/n
The room was decorated with stagy opulence./r/n 那房间装饰得富丽堂皇, 像戏台似的./r/n
I always thought of him as a rather staid old gentleman./r/n 我一直以为他是个相当古板的绅士。/r/n They showed a staid mood in that accident./r/n 那次事件中他们的情绪很稳定。/r/n
He stained the family honor./r/n 他玷污了家族的荣誉。/r/n Such a man is a stain to humanity./r/n 这种人是人类的耻辱。/r/n
I have staked all my hopes on you./r/n 我已经把我所有的希望都寄托在你身上了。/r/n He staked a claim to the land where he'd found the gold./r/n 他在发现黄金的那块土地上立下界标以表明他的所有权。/r/n
The beer is stale./r/n 啤酒走了气了。/r/n They had nothing to eat but stale bread./r/n 除了陈面包外，他们没有别的东西可吃。/r/n

Negotiations have reached (a) stalemate./r/n 谈判陷入了僵局./r/n Any solution [to Soviet economic malaise], however, is hostage to the crisis of authority, creating a catch-22 stalemate between perestroika and glasnost, between economics and politics: any measure to shore up the economy only fans public anger and reduces the authority of the Government./r/n 不过，任何解决[苏联经济失调]办的法都受到权力危机的影响，在改革与开放，经济与政治之间产生一种自相矛盾僵持不下的情况：任何振兴经济的办法不过煽起民众的忿怒并损及政府威信而已。/r/n
The infatuated fan stalked the celebrity./r/n 那位着了迷的崇拜者追踪这位名人。/r/n He cut off the flowers at the stalk with a pair of scissors./r/n 他用剪子连花带茎都剪下来。/r/n
He doesn't have the stamina to be a teacher./r/n 他没有当教师的精力./r/n Marathon runners need plenty of stamina./r/n 参加马拉松长跑要有耐力./r/n
He stammered his thanks./r/n 他结结巴巴地道了谢。/r/n The boy dare not answer the questions because of his stammer./r/n 这个小男孩因为结巴不敢回答老师的问题。/r/n
He maintains a rigidly right-wing political stance./r/n 他坚持僵硬的右派政治立场./r/n What is your stance on corporal punishment?/r/n 你对体罚持什麽态度?/r/n
He's reading the second stanza./r/n 他正在读诗的第二节。/r/n The rhythmic pattern of a stanza, determined by the kind and number of lines./r/n 韵律一个诗节的韵律格式，由诗节中诗行的类型和数量而定/r/n
He stapled the paper together./r/n 他把文件钉在一起。/r/n Don't forget staples like sugar and salt when you go to the shops./r/n 你去商店时，不要忘记买盐和糖之类的必备食品。/r/n
Have you get a stapler?/r/n 你有订书机吗？/r/n He wants a stapler, but she have not get one./r/n 他想要一个订书机，但她没有。/r/n
He stapled the paper together./r/n 他把文件钉在一起。/r/n Don't forget staples like sugar and salt when you go to the shops./r/n 你去商店时，不要忘记买盐和糖之类的必备食品。/r/n
The starchy root of any of these plants, used in the tropics as food./r/n 山药，甘薯这些植物的含淀粉根，在热带用作食物/r/n He eat too much starchy food./r/n 他贪吃含淀粉多的食物。/r/n
The landscape was grey and stark./r/n 景色灰暗荒凉。/r/n The film vividly shows the stark realities of life for the poor and hungry./r/n 这部影片生动地揭示了贫穷和饥饿的人们赤裸裸的生活现实。/r/n
He's got his life savings stashed (away) in an old suitcase./r/n 他把一辈子的积蓄保藏在一口旧箱子里./r/n
Her hair was full of static./r/n 她的头发上静电很强./r/n There was too much static to hear their message clearly./r/n 天电干扰太大, 听不清他们的电讯./r/n
A stationary target is easiest to aim at./r/n 静止的目标是最容易瞄准的。/r/n The dead center, being a stationary bearing point, must be lubricated./r/n 由于是固定的支承点，死顶尖必须润滑。/r/n
My stationery cupboard is full of paper./r/n 我的文具柜塞满了纸。/r/n That shop does not stock stationery./r/n 那家商店不卖文具。/r/n

There will be a display of bronze statuary in this museum next week./r/n 下星期这个博物馆将举办一个青铜雕塑作品展览。/r/n He have returned from italy a greater bear than ever; He bore on architecture, painting, statuary, and music./r/n 他从意大利回来之后，变得比以前更加惹人厌烦了；他竟钻研其建筑、绘画、雕塑、甚至音乐来了。/r/n

A china statuette of a shepherdess stood on the table./r/n 桌上有一个牧羊女的小瓷像./r/n A statuette awarded annually for outstanding achievement in radio and television advertising./r/n 克利俄女神奖每年授予在广播及电视广告中作出突出成绩的人的小雕像/r/n
A man short in stature./r/n 侏儒身材矮的人/r/n Stature, especially of the human body./r/n 身高身长，尤指人类身体/r/n
The degree or status of a doctor as conferred by a university./r/n 博士学位大学授予的博士学位或身份/r/n You don't really care a fig about status./r/n 你对地位真是一点儿也不在乎。/r/n
We must obey the statutes in this country./r/n 我们必须遵守这个国家的法规。/r/n A heading that names a document, statute, or proceeding./r/n 名称命名一份文件、法令或诉讼程序的名字/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．法定的，受法令所约束的
RECORD.lx: The constitutional or statutory right to vote./r/n 选举权宪法或法律规定的选举权/r/n A decision of the local authority pursuant to the power and duties impose upon it by the statutory code./r/n 地方政府根据成文法（典）所给予的权力和义务所作出的决定。/r/n
She steeped the stained cloth in bleach overnight./r/n 她把有污迹的衣服在洗衣粉里浸了一夜。/r/n This hill is too steep to ride up on a bicycle./r/n 这山太陡了，骑自行车可上不去。/r/n
Orthodox Christian churches often have elaborate steeples./r/n 传统的基督教堂都有精致的尖塔。/r/n Now they are ready for the steeple chase./r/n 现在他们已准备好进行障碍赛跑。/r/n
He steered the car skillfully through the narrow streets./r/n 他熟练地驾驶着汽车穿过狭窄的街道。/r/n The drift of a ship or an aircraft to leeward of the course being steered./r/n 偏航，漂移船只或航空器航行过程中向背风面而作的漂移/r/n
He steered the car skillfully through the narrow streets./r/n 他熟练地驾驶着汽车穿过狭窄的街道。/r/n The drift of a ship or an aircraft to leeward of the course being steered./r/n 偏航，漂移船只或航空器航行过程中向背风面而作的漂移/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n（植物的）茎，叶柄，v．阻止，遏制（水流等）
RECORD.lx: Our ship stemmed on against the current./r/n 我们的船逆流而上。/r/n She bought some roses with long stems./r/n 她买了一些枝干很长的玫瑰花。/r/n

From a steaming stench below, the banks were coated with a slimy mould that stuck to them like glue, disgusting to behold and worse to smell/r/n 堤岸上铺着一层从下面来的臭气所凝结成的霉东西，使得眼睛和鼻子都感到憎恶。/r/n Held my nose against the stench./r/n 掩住鼻子使不闻恶臭/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．（用以刻写图案，文字的）模板 v．用模板刻写
RECORD.lx: Do you know how to cut a stencil?/r/n 你会刻蜡版[打蜡纸]吗？/r/n A fine powder, such as pulverized charcoal, dusted over a stencil to transfer a design to an underlying surface./r/n 印花粉撒于镂花模板上以便在其表面上印出图案的细粉末，如磨碎的木炭粉/r/n
He doesn't conform to the usual stereotype of the city businessman with a dark suit and rolled umbrella./r/n 他不像典型的城市商人那样, 穿一身深色的套服、 带一把收好的雨伞./r/n
Medical tests showed that he was sterile./r/n 医学检查表明他没有生育能力。/r/n The high risk of infection put a premium on the use of sterile needle./r/n 由於受感染的风险很大，无菌注射针的使用受到了重视。/r/n
The doctor performs operations with sterilized surgical instruments./r/n 医生用消过毒的外科手术器械做手术。/r/n After her fourth child she decided to have herself sterilized./r/n 她生了第四个孩子后决定做绝育手术。/r/n
She seated herself in the stern./r/n 她坐进了船尾。/r/n Stern as he is, he is full of sympathy./r/n 虽然他严格，却富有同情心。/r/n
I take it you know what a stethoscope is./r/n 我想你知道听诊器是个什么东西。/r/n The stethoscope is a medical instrument./r/n 听诊器是一种医疗器械。/r/n
She's a stickler for the truth./r/n 她是个坚持实事求是的人。/r/n My teacher is a stickler for the truth./r/n 我们的老师是一个坚持真理的人。/r/n
There's some sort of sticky fluid on the kitchen floor./r/n 厨房的地上有一种发黏的液体./r/n I am uncomfortable because my body is sticky./r/n 我身上粘粘的，很不舒服。/r/n
He walked along on stilts./r/n 他踩着高跷走过去。/r/n They built a house on stilts./r/n 他们建了一栋用桩子支撑的房子。/r/n
It is hoped that the tax cuts will act as a stimulant to further economic growth./r/n 希望降低税率这一措施能刺激经济进一步增长。/r/n Coffee and tea are mild stimulants./r/n 咖啡和茶都是温和的兴奋剂。/r/n
The nutrient in the soil acts as a stimulus to growth./r/n 土壤中的养分能促进植物生长。/r/n Her words of praise were a stimulus for people to work harder./r/n 她赞扬的话鼓舞人们工作更努力。/r/n
His flattery carries a sting./r/n 他的奉承话中带刺。/r/n Her ingratitude stung him./r/n 她的忘恩负义使他痛心。/r/n
The quality or state of being selfish or stingy./r/n 自私，吝啬自私或吝啬的品质或状况/r/n A stingy person; a miser./r/n 吝啬吝啬小气的人；守财奴/r/n
There is a stink of cats in the room./r/n 屋子里有猫的臭味。/r/n This whole affair really stinks./r/n 整件事情都让人讨厌。/r/n
She stinted herself of food in order to let the children have enough./r/n 她自己省着吃，好让孩子们吃饱。/r/n Don't stint on the cream!/r/n 不要舍不得放奶油！/r/n
Hopes to be awarded a stipend for further research./r/n 希望能被给予进一步研究的费用。/r/n

The company fails to pay on the date stipulate in the contract./r/n 该公司没有按合同中规定的日期付款。/r/n The Constitution stipulate that women shall have equal rights with men in voting and being elected./r/n 宪法规定妇女和男子一样，有同等的选举权和被选举权。/r/n

A stipulation or qualification, especially a clause in a document or an agreement./r/n 条款一种规定或条件，尤其是指一个文件或协议中的条文/r/n May I refer you to the contract stipulation about packing(or shipping..)?/r/n 请您看看合同中有关包装（装运）的规定。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．（缝纫时的）一针，一钩 v．缝合
RECORD.lx: The doctor put three stitches in my head./r/n 医生在我头上缝了三针。/r/n Will you stitch a button on this shirt?/r/n 请你在这件衬衫上钉一颗钮扣好吗？/r/n
She is tired of her husband's stock jokes./r/n 她听厌了她丈夫那些陈腐的笑话。/r/n That shop does not stock stationery./r/n 那家商店不卖文具。/r/n
The lambs were kept in the stockade./r/n 小羊羔被放在围栏里养着。/r/n The sheep were surrounded by stockade./r/n 羊被栅栏圈着。/r/n
A strong, stocky horse./r/n 强壮、结实的马/r/n
A Stoic person responds to hardship with imperturbation./r/n 坚忍克己之人经受苦难仍能泰然自若。/r/n Every stoic is a stoic; but in christendom, where be the christian?/r/n 每一个斯多葛派的人都是“斯多葛”主义者；但在基督教世界，哪有基督教徒？/r/n
She showed great stoicism during her husband's final illness./r/n 她在丈夫患病临终期间表现出了坚强的毅力./r/n They reacted to the appalling weather with typical British stoicism./r/n 他们忍受著恶劣天气的煎熬, 表现了英国人典型的坚忍不拔的精神./r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．无动于衷的，感情麻木的
RECORD.lx: He conceals his feelings behind a rather stolid manner./r/n 他装作无动於衷的样子以掩盖自己的感情./r/n
Don't swim on an empty stomach./r/n 不要空腹时游泳。/r/n I've no stomach for this trip./r/n 我对这次旅行不感兴趣。/r/n
The old woman walked with a stoop./r/n 老太太伛偻而行。/r/n She stooped low to look under the bed./r/n 她弯下腰看床底下。/r/n
This book is a storehouse of useful information./r/n 这本书里汇集了大量有用的资料。/r/n Contraband goods were found in the storehouse of the hotel./r/n 在旅馆的储藏室里发现了走私货。/r/n
She's growing rather stout./r/n 她有点发胖。/r/n Hope is a slender reed for a stout man to lean on./r/n 希望是壮汉依靠的一根纤细的芦苇。/r/n
Struggling to achieve effect; strained and contrived./r/n 紧张的；不自然的努力取得效果的；紧张的，不自然的/r/n He strained every nerve to get the post, but was unsuccessful./r/n 他竭尽全力想得到那份工作，但是没有成功。/r/n
The door is rather strait./r/n 这门相当窄。/r/n I hear you are in poor financial straits./r/n 我听说你处于经济困难之中。/r/n
I hear you are in poor financial straits./r/n 我听说你处于经济困难之中。/r/n The straits of Gibraltar are the gate of the Mediterranean./r/n 直布罗陀海峡是通向地中海的必经之路。/r/n
The stranded hulk of a severely damaged ship./r/n 遇难船的残骸严重毁坏而搁浅的船体/r/n A crab was left stranded on the beach when the tide ebbed./r/n 退潮时，一只蟹被困留在沙滩上。/r/n
They have worked out the stratagem to attack the enemy./r/n 他们已经想出了攻击敌人的策略。/r/n The practice or use of tricks; deception by stratagem./r/n 欺骗，哄骗用诡计进行欺诈；用计谋进行的欺骗/r/n

A problem that cuts across all strata of society/r/n 一个影响到一切社会阶层的问题。/r/n A sharp ridge with steeply sloping sides, produced by erosion of the broken edges of highly tilted strata./r/n 豚脊丘，陡峻的山脊由于对高斜层破碎山背的侵蚀而形成的陡峭的山背/r/n
He disappeared round the corner like a streak of lightning./r/n 他快如闪电般地从拐角处消失。/r/n The cat streaked across the road with a dog behind it./r/n 有只狗在后面，这只猫飞快地越过马路。/r/n

He made strenuous attempts to stop her./r/n 他为阻止她作出了极大的努力。/r/n Nothing Bush tries works. In fact, everything hurts. His strenuous September campaigning sliced five points off his approval rating, which is at37 percent and heading south./r/n 布什的努力全然无益。事实上，反而有害。他九月份奋力竞选，民意测验赞许率降低5点，目前是百分之三十七，仍在下降。/r/n
China is striding ahead in her economic construction./r/n 中国正在经济建设方面大步前进。/r/n In a few strides he crossed the room./r/n 他几大步就穿过了房间。/r/n
A loud, strident noise./r/n 大而刺耳的声音/r/n
These firms are at strife./r/n 这几家商行彼此不和。/r/n Fighting, especially armed battle; strife./r/n 战斗，尤指武器战斗；斗争/r/n
I was attracted by the striking idea./r/n 我被这个惊人的想法吸引住了。/r/n The striking office workers have occupied the whole building./r/n 罢工的办公室人员占据了整座建筑物。/r/n
We'll have to strip the engine down to find the fault./r/n 我们得把发动机拆卸开来找出毛病。/r/n They stripped off and jumped into the pool./r/n 他们脱掉衣服，跳进了池子。/r/n
Tigers have orange fur with black stripes./r/n 老虎的皮毛是橘黄色的，带有黑色条纹。/r/n Which do you want for your new dress, a stripe or a check?/r/n 你要哪种料子来做新连衣裙, 条子的还是方格的?/r/n
He is a young man, hardly more than a stripling./r/n 他是个小伙子，尚不及而立之年。/r/n The stripling helped the old man across the road./r/n 年轻的男子帮助那老人过马路。/r/n
My sister and I strolled through the streets after supper./r/n 晚饭后，我妹妹和我在街上散步。/r/n The act or an instance of wandering; a stroll./r/n 闲逛徘徊的行为或事例；闲逛/r/n
I often see them strolling happily arm in arm./r/n 我经常看到他们幸福地挽臂散步。/r/n I often see my grandparents strolling happily arm in arm./r/n 我常常看见我的爷爷奶奶臂挽着臂愉快地散步。/r/n
Our office is really stuffy./r/n 我们的办公室很闷。/r/n The atmosphere is very stuffy in here can we open a window?/r/n 这 的空气很闷--咱们能把窗户打开吗?/r/n
She sat stunned for a while, until she recovered./r/n 她一时昏迷，坐下呆了一会儿才醒过来。/r/n The punch stunned me for a moment./r/n 那一拳把我打得昏了一阵。/r/n

His plays are distinguished only by their stunning mediocrity./r/n 他的戏剧与众不同之处就是平凡得出奇./r/n For today is the concrete expression of a stunning fact, our continuity these200 years since our government began./r/n 因为今天具体说明了一个非常美好的事实，我国政府自成立以来已延续二百年了。/r/n
Her latest stunt is riding a motor cycle through a ring of flames./r/n 她的最新特技表演是骑摩托车钻火圈。/r/n Inadequate food can stunt a child's development./r/n 食物不足能影响儿童的发育。/r/n
I was stupefied by what I read./r/n 我读到的内容把我惊呆了./r/n Exhilarated or stupefied by or as if by alcohol; intoxicated./r/n 醉的，陶醉的因（仿佛）喝酒类饮料而兴奋或木然的；醉的/r/n
The opera was quite stupendous./r/n 这部歌剧很精彩。/r/n He made a stupendous mistake./r/n 他犯了一个极大的错误。/r/n
Stupor induced by a narcotic./r/n 麻醉性昏睡麻醉药引起的昏迷状态/r/n He was in an alcoholic stupor./r/n 他醉得不省人事。/r/n
A sturdy cylindrical container for storing liquids; a barrel./r/n 桶贮存液体的坚固的圆筒状容器；桶/r/n Being in robust and sturdy good health./r/n 强壮的，健康的强壮的和身体健康的/r/n
I was completely stymied by her refusal to help./r/n 由於她拒不相助, 我完全陷入了困境./r/n
He managed to subdue his mounting anger./r/n 他设法克制住了阵阵愤怒。/r/n

The comet's ice, heated by the sun, rapidly and spectacular sublimate to gas./r/n 彗星上的冰块在太阳热的作用下迅速而壮观地升华成气体。/r/n Her sublimate future husband will be tall, dark, and handsome./r/n 她理想化的未来丈夫将是身材高大，皮肤浅黑，相貌英俊。/r/n

Interrupting an opera on television for a pet-food commercial is going from the sublime to the ridiculous./r/n 在电视播演歌剧时插播宠物食品广告真是煞风景./r/n Soaring as if with wings; elevated or sublime./r/n 高远的象有翅膀般飞翔的；高扬的或升华的/r/n
At the first sign of danger the submarine will submerge./r/n 一有危险迹象，潜艇就会潜入水中。/r/n Such feelings tend to remain submerge beneath a mask of social politeness./r/n 在社交礼貌的掩盖下，这样的情感往往不会显露出来。/r/n
Tomorrow is the last date for submission of entries for the competition./r/n 明天是提交参赛表格的最后期限。/r/n In my submission these proposals are completely unworkable./r/n 在我看来，这些建议完全不可行。/r/n

He is a humble and submissive servant./r/n 他是个恭顺的仆人。/r/n Relating to or characteristic of an inactive or submissive role in a relationship, especially a sexual relationship./r/n 消极的，被动的关于在一种关系中不活跃的、被动的或具有此种特征的，尤指性关系/r/n
He subordinated his wishes to the general good of the group./r/n 他使自己的愿望服从于集体的利益。/r/n He was always friendly to his subordinates./r/n 他对下级一向和蔼可亲。/r/n
Failure of a witness or party to appear in response to a subpoena or notice./r/n 不出庭证人或当事人接到传票或通知后未出现/r/n
We subscribe to an animal protection society./r/n 我们定期捐款给一个动物保护基金会。/r/n I subscribed to several magazines./r/n 我订阅了几份杂志。/r/n
People should not be regarded as subservient to the economic system./r/n 不应把人的因素看成是经济体制的附庸./r/n People shall not be regarded as subservient to the economic system./r/n 不应把人的因素看成是经济体制的附庸。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．（建筑物等）下陷，（天气等）平息，平静
RECORD.lx: The flood gradually subsided./r/n 洪水正逐渐退去。/r/n The storm began to subside./r/n 风暴渐渐平息了。/r/n
Most of the group profit is contributed by the subsidiary in the far east./r/n 集团的大部分利润是由远东的子公司缴纳。/r/n A lack of corporate interest has made the subsidiary an orphan./r/n 因缺乏共同利益，使得这家子公司无人照管/r/n

The islanders don't want to leave, and probably wouldn't if there were a subsidy to reduce freight charges. But they don't see that happening./r/n 岛上居民不愿离开；要是有补助金使运输费用降低的话，他们很可能不会离开。但是，他们对补助金并不存奢望。/r/n It's the old and the poor who suffer worst when subsidies are cut./r/n 补助津贴一削减，最吃苦头的就是那些老人和贫民。/r/n
Can you substantiateyour accusations against him?/r/n 你指责他, 能提出事实根据吗?/r/n
A noun or substantive that receives or is affected by the action of a verb within a sentence./r/n 宾语一个句子中接受动词的动作或受之影响的名词或名词性词组/r/n
We substituted a red ball for blue to see if the baby would notice./r/n 我们用红皮球换下了蓝皮球，看这婴儿会不会发觉。/r/n Water is not a proper substitute for wine./r/n 水不是酒的适当代用品。/r/n
This creature can be subsumed in the class of reptiles./r/n 这种生物可以归入爬行动物一类./r/n

Her claim to be a journalist was simply a subterfuge to get into the theatre without paying./r/n 她自称是记者, 这只是个看戏不买票的花招而已./r/n It was no subterfuge on her part. She just lied in her throat and we all realized toe grossness of her false utterance./r/n 她所说的不是什么遁词。她简直是在撒弥天大谎。对她说假话之无耻程度，我们都是了解的。/r/n

Such philosophical subtleties are beyond my reach./r/n 这种深奥的哲理我可无法理解。/r/n How much easier, how much more satisfying it is for you who can see to grasp quickly the essential qualities of another person by watching the subtleties of expression, the quiver of a muscle, the flutter of a hand./r/n 对你来说，一个能看见的人，通过观察微妙的表情－－－一条肌肉的颤抖、一只手的摆动，很快地了解另一个人的本质，是多么容易又多么令人满足的事情。/r/n
They are contaminating the minds of our young people with these subversive ideas./r/n 他们这些颠覆性的思想是对我们年轻人的精神污染。/r/n The new party has subversive ideas./r/n 新政党有颠覆的意图。/r/n
A plot or scheme intended to subvert another plot./r/n 反计策意在破坏另一计谋的计策或计划/r/n
A short, succinct statement./r/n 简短，扼要的陈述/r/n
These refugees are very grateful to the government's succor./r/n 这些难民非常感激政府的救援。/r/n The government has worked out a plan of succoring the needy./r/n 政府已经制定出了救济贫民的计划。/r/n
Several children have measles, and the others are bound to succumb (to it)./r/n 有几个孩子患了麻疹, 其他孩子也必然传染上./r/n The driver has succumbed to (ie died of) his injuries./r/n 司机已受伤不治./r/n
An hour should suffice for the journey./r/n 这点路程一小时足够了。/r/n The rations will suffice until next week./r/n 这些口粮足够吃到下星期。/r/n
There is sufficient food for everybody./r/n 有足够的饭菜供大家吃。/r/n Given sufficient goodwill on both sides, there's no reason why this dispute shouldn't be resolved./r/n 只要双方都有充分的善意，这种纠纷是没有理由解决不了的。/r/n
