I'm suffocating in here; can't we open a few windows?/r/n 我觉得这儿很憋气, 咱们开几扇窗户好吗?/r/n The fireman was suffocated by the fumes./r/n 那个消防队员让浓烟憋死了./r/n
When was universal suffrage introduced in your country?/r/n 贵国是什么时候实行普选权的？/r/n The question of woman suffrage sets them at variance./r/n 妇女参政的问题使他们发生争执。/r/n
A blush suffused his cheeks./r/n 他瞬间满脸通红./r/n The evening sky was suffused with crimson./r/n 黄昏时分天空红霞灿灿./r/n
I did many stupid things when I was young and suggestible./r/n 我年轻时受外界的影响做过不少傻事。/r/n She's at a suggestible age./r/n 她处于易受影响的年龄。/r/n

She refused her suitor./r/n 她拒绝了求婚者。/r/n A Victorian suitor would be expected to satisfy a girl's father that he could support her in the manner to which she was accustomed./r/n 维多利亚时期总是希望求婚者向女方的父亲保证他能供养其女，让她过上和她以往一样的舒适讲究的生活。/r/n
She never laughed and became very sullen./r/n 她再也没有笑过，变得郁郁寡欢。/r/n Susan is sullen in the morning because she had not sleep well./r/n 苏珊今天早上郁闷不乐，因为昨晚没睡好。/r/n
I wouldn't sully my hands by acceptinga bribe./r/n 我决不接受贿赂, 一尘不染./r/n
She is a sultry western beauty./r/n 她是位性感的西方美人。/r/n I met her in a sultry summer afternoon./r/n 我在夏天一个闷热的下午遇见了她。/r/n
The boat was sundered by the rock./r/n 船被岩石撞碎了。/r/n
They prepared rice, flour and sundry other items of food for the poor./r/n 他们为穷人准备了米，面及其它各种食物。/r/n We can see the rich man on sundry occasions./r/n 我们能在各种场合见到那个富豪。/r/n
Are you still riding that superannuated old bike?/r/n 你还骑那辆老掉牙的自行车吗?/r/n
I like our country's superb view./r/n 我喜欢我们国家壮丽的景色。/r/n The sports facilities are superb in this city./r/n 这个城市的运动设施是一流的。/r/n

Affecting an attitude of disdain or conceit; haughty and supercilious./r/n 傲慢的摆出轻蔑或自满的样子的；高傲且盛气凌人的/r/n The shop assistant was very supercilious towards me when I asked for some help./r/n 我要买东西招呼售货员时，那个售货员对我不屑一顾。/r/n
He is too superficial to appreciate great literature like this./r/n 他太肤浅，无法欣赏这类文学巨著。/r/n Superficial scratches can be easily removed./r/n 表面的划痕很容易擦掉。/r/n
He has already been told, so our comments are superfluous./r/n 早就有人同他说过，所以我们的意见是多余的。/r/n A superfluous word or phrase./r/n 冗词多余的词或短语/r/n
He was appointed to superintend the toy department./r/n 他获任玩具部的负责人。/r/n The manager is superintending the staff's work./r/n 经理正在监督工人的工作。/r/n
Motorways have largely superseded ordinary roads for long-distance travel./r/n 高速公路多已取代了普通公路./r/n Will factory workers be entirely superseded by machines one day?/r/n 工人将来能完全由机器取代吗?/r/n
It's a common superstition that black cats are unlucky./r/n 认为黑猫不吉利，这是一种普遍的迷信思想。/r/n Frightened or intimidated by superstition./r/n （因迷信而）恐惧被迷信吓倒或胆怯的/r/n
She has been supplanted by another in his affections./r/n 他爱上了另一个人，不再爱她了。/r/n The party leader has been supplanted by his rival./r/n 那位政党领导已被他的对手取而代之了。/r/n
Exercise keeps you supple./r/n 经常锻炼可使身体灵活。/r/n She has a supple mind./r/n 她头脑灵活。/r/n
I supplement my scholarship by working in the evening./r/n 我除了享受奖学金外还打夜工以增加收入。/r/n The money I got was a useful supplement to my ordinary income./r/n 我得到的那笔钱是很管用的外快。/r/n
He supplicates me to help./r/n 他向我求助。/r/n She supplicated for pardon./r/n 她恳求原谅。/r/n
We must not condemn her on pure supposition./r/n 我们不能单凭猜测就谴责她。/r/n Our suppositions were fully confirmed./r/n 我们猜测的事实已全部证实。/r/n
A surfeit of rich food is bad for you./r/n 多吃油腻食物对身体有害。/r/n There has been a surfeit of plays about divorce on the TV recently./r/n 最近有关离婚的电视剧太多了。/r/n
Anger surged up within him./r/n 怒火在他心中燃烧。/r/n The crowd surged past him./r/n 人们从他身边涌过。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj 脾气暴躁的，阴沉的
RECORD.lx: Don't look so surly!/r/n 别那么横眉立目的！/r/n Surly the most sensible thing would be to stay away from the case./r/n 肯定地说，最合理的做法就是远离这个箱子。/r/n
Your first surmise was right./r/n 你第一次猜得对。/r/n We surmised that he must have had an accident./r/n 我们猜想他一定出事了。/r/n
I think most of these obstacles can be surmounted./r/n 我认为这些障碍大多数都是可以克服的。/r/n Hard to traverse, climb, or surmount./r/n 难攀登的，陡峭的难以通过、攀登或克服的/r/n
We are giving away all our surplus apples./r/n 我们准备把多余的苹果全部送人。/r/n Mexico has a large surplus of oil./r/n 墨西哥有大量过剩的石油。/r/n
Characterized by stealth; surreptitious./r/n 秘密的偷偷摸摸的；鬼鬼祟祟的/r/n His surreptitious behaviour naturally aroused suspicion./r/n 他那鬼鬼祟祟的行为自然引起了旁人的怀疑。/r/n
Fiction is a poor surrogate for real experience./r/n 小说中的事远逊於实际体验./r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj 易受影响的，多情的
RECORD.lx: The plant is not susceptible to disease./r/n 这种植物不容易受病害侵袭。/r/n He's so susceptible that she easily gained his affection./r/n 他易受感情影响，所以她很轻易就得到了他的爱。/r/n
Don't keep us in suspense any longer!/r/n 别再让我们着急了！/r/n We waited in great suspense for the doctor's diagnosis./r/n 我们焦急万分地等候医生做出诊断。/r/n
The foundations were not strong enough to sustain the weight of the house./r/n 这地基不够牢固，无法承受房屋的重量。/r/n Hope alone sustained him in his struggle./r/n 在奋斗中，只有希望支持着他。/r/n

A system of physical conditioning designed to enhance circulatory and respiratory efficiency that involves vigorous, sustained exercise, such as jogging, swimming, or cycling, thereby improving the body's utilization of oxygen./r/n 有氧健身法旨在增强循环和呼吸功效的生理调节体系，包括有力的、持久的锻炼，例如慢跑、游泳或骑自行车，从而提高肌体对氧气的利用/r/n The court sustained his claim that the contract was illegal./r/n 法庭确认他的要求正当，宣布该合同不合法。/r/n
She is weak from lack of sustenance./r/n 她因缺乏营养而虚弱。/r/n There's not much sustenance in a glass of orange squash./r/n 一杯橙汁饮料没有什么营养。/r/n
Don't swagger (around) just because you got the job./r/n 别因为得到了这份工作就得意忘形./r/n He took his prize and swaggered back to his seat./r/n 他领奖後洋洋得意地回到自己的座位上./r/n
Don't be such a swank!/r/n 别那麽招摇!/r/n She's swanking just because they said her essay was the best./r/n 皆因人称她的文章最好, 她就忘乎所以了./r/n
He has received a swarm of letters./r/n 他已经收到了一大批信件。/r/n The crowd swarmed out of the cinema after the film ended./r/n 电影结束后，人们从电影院蜂拥而出。/r/n
He has received a swarm of letters./r/n 他已经收到了一大批信件。/r/n The crowd swarmed out of the cinema after the film ended./r/n 电影结束后，人们从电影院蜂拥而出。/r/n
She has a swarthy complexion./r/n 她的肤色黝黑。/r/n
The wind swelled out the sail./r/n 风吹得船帆鼓了起来。/r/n Her ankle swelled up after the fall./r/n 她跌倒后脚踝肿了起来。/r/n
I will never swerve from my declared policy on this matter./r/n 我决不背离我已经宣布的在这个问题上的政策。/r/n The car swerved to the right./r/n 汽车突然向右转。/r/n
The rugby players were swilling mugs of beer at the bar./r/n 橄榄球运动员正在酒吧间痛饮啤酒。/r/n Make sure the garage is well swilled out./r/n 请务必将车库里里外外都冲洗干净。/r/n
An instance of cheating; a swindle./r/n 诈骗一个欺诈的例子；诈取/r/n He's just the kind that would stoop to swindle children out of a few pence./r/n 他就是这种货色，会不顾廉耻去从孩子手中骗取几个零钱。/r/n
With this customer, he felt himself, as it were, casting pearls before swine./r/n 面对这个客商，他感到好像是在对牛弹琴。/r/n A swine over fat is the cause of his own bane./r/n 猪死都因身过肥；象以齿焚。/r/n
Dancers spun in a swirl of skirts./r/n 跳舞的人旋转著, 裙子也不停地打转./r/n A trademark used for a whirlpool bath or a device that swirls water in a bath./r/n 佳骨肌泡沫浴装置一种用于涡流式沐浴或用于在浴池中产生漩涡的装置的商标/r/n
`Hamlet' is on this year's English literature syllabus./r/n 《哈姆雷特》是本学年英国文学教学大纲中规定的作品./r/n

Any of the reciprocal actions or effects, such as symbiosis, that can occur in a community./r/n （种间）相互作用出现在群落中的相互作用和效应，例如共生现象/r/n A type of symbiosis, as among certain ants, in which one species is dominant and makes the members of another species perform the tasks required for their mutual survival./r/n 共生（现象），役生现象一种共生（现象），如某些蚂蚁，在这种现象中，一个种处于支配地位，并使得别的种的成员承担他们共同生存所需完成的任务/r/n
The plan of the ground floor is completely symmetrical./r/n 一楼的平面图是完全对称的。/r/n He introduced to us the symmetrical arrangement of the garden./r/n 他为我们介绍了花园中对称的布局。/r/n

Having no balance or symmetry./r/n 不对称的，不匀称的失去平衡或对称性的/r/n An imaginary line to which elements of a work of art, such as a picture, are referred for measurement or symmetry./r/n 中轴线相对于某些要求测量或对称的文艺作品的一条假想线，如绘画/r/n
The wheels must synchronize as they revolve./r/n 这些轮子须同速转动./r/n The sound on a film must synchronize with the action./r/n 影片中的声音必须与动作配合一致./r/n
The periodic variation in speed of a synchronous motor with respect to the current./r/n （同步电动机的）速度偏差同步电机运行速度的周期性变化/r/n
The song has a syncopated rhythm in the jazz version./r/n 这首歌曲改编为爵士乐後采用了切分音节奏./r/n The song have a syncopate rhythm in the jazz version./r/n 这首歌曲改编为爵士乐後采用了切分音节奏。/r/n

Synonymous with illegal: used with instruction code, character, etc./r/n 与“非法”同义，主要用在：置于指令码、字符等前面，构成禁用指令码、禁用字符等。/r/n The Asian part of Turkey. It is usually considered synonymous with Asia Minor./r/n 安纳托利亚土耳其的亚洲部分，一般认为等同于小亚细亚/r/n
An abbreviated list, as of contents; a synopsis./r/n 简表一个扼要的（如内容的）条目；大纲/r/n

This shelf was made of synthetic resin./r/n 这个架子是合成树脂做的。/r/n Any of numerous natural and synthetic compounds of usually high molecular weight consisting of up to millions of repeated linked units, each a relatively light and simple molecule./r/n 聚合物许多天然和人工合成的化合物中的任一种，通常具高分子的重量，包含最多可达上百万个的彼此重复且相连的单位，每一个单位都是一个相对较轻和较简单的分子/r/n

An article, such as a paper diaper or hypodermic syringe, that can be disposed of after one use./r/n 用后即丢弃的物品，一次性物品用后即可丢弃的物品，如纸制尿布或皮下注射器/r/n The child started to wail when the nurse come over with a syringe./r/n 当护士拿著针筒走过来时，孩子便嚎啕大哭起来。/r/n
The table legs are screwed to the floor./r/n 这张桌子的腿是用螺丝固定在地板上的。/r/n He drummed on the table with his fingers./r/n 他用手指咚咚地敲打着桌子。/r/n
Sex is no longer the taboo subject it used to be./r/n 现在不再像过去那样把性的问题视为禁区。/r/n There's a taboo on smoking in this office./r/n 在这个办公室里一向是都不吸烟的./r/n
My mother tacked the sleeves on before sewing them./r/n 我妈妈在把袖子缝好之前，先用大针脚把它缝好。/r/n The speaker suddenly changed tack and left us all rather confused./r/n 演讲人突然改变了论调，把我们都搞糊涂了。/r/n
Tact consists in knowing how far we may go too far./r/n 机智在于知道自己可以过分到什么程度。/r/n Her patience and tact were legendary./r/n 她的耐心和机智是出名的。/r/n
She gets them to accept these changes by tactful management./r/n 她用机智的手段使他们接受了这些改变。/r/n Not tactful or diplomatic./r/n 不老练的；不机敏的/r/n
A fair tactic./r/n 合宜的策略/r/n An instance of the use of this delaying tactic./r/n 阻挠议事的情形应用这种拖延策略的实例/r/n

An instrument used to measure tactile sensitivity./r/n 触觉测量计用来测量触觉的一种装置/r/n The aesthetic feel or tactile quality of something, such as a fabric, textile, or carpeting, that indicates its fineness, texture, and durability./r/n 手感触摸诸如纤维、织物、毯子等物时对它们的质地、品质以及柔软程度的感觉或美感/r/n
Tadpoles are the infancy form of frogs./r/n 蝌蚪是青蛙的幼年形态。/r/n A tadpole has a tail./r/n 蝌蚪有尾巴。/r/n
Throw that tainted meat away; it's not edible./r/n 把那块腐烂的肉扔掉，不能再吃了。/r/n His political reputation was tainted by his abuse of the power./r/n 他因滥用职权而破坏了政治声誉。/r/n
He criticized my taking risks./r/n 他批评了我的冒险活动。/r/n The act or practice of offering, giving, or taking a bribe./r/n 行贿，受贿提供、给予或取得贿赂的行为或实践/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．（使）一致，符合 n．完全相似
RECORD.lx: His account of the accident tallies with yours./r/n 他对该故事的说法和你一样。/r/n The two lists do not tally./r/n 这两张单子不相符。/r/n
He tamped down the tobacco in his pipe./r/n 他把烟丝紧紧摁实在烟斗里。/r/n
Someone has been tampering with the lock./r/n 有人乱动过这把锁./r/n The records of the meeting had been tampered with./r/n 会议记录已被人擅自改动./r/n
It took me all summer to get this tan./r/n 我花了整个夏天才晒出这样的棕褐色。/r/n Jane tanned quickly in the sun./r/n 简在太阳下很快就晒黑了。/r/n
The tanner is said to be reluctant to quote firm price because of a rising and uncertain raw material market./r/n 据说由于原材料市场上升且捉摸不定，制革商们不愿报出实盘。/r/n

The teacher was telling us about the poet's life, when he went off at a tangent and started talking about his war experiences./r/n 老师在给我们讲述诗人生平故事的时候，突然把话题一转，讲开他自己的战争经历来了。/r/n It's not easy to follow her think because she's always go off at a tangent./r/n 要跟上她的思路并非易事，因为她老是突然扯到题外去。/r/n
The prize is a tangible testimony that she has gotten a germ of write ability./r/n 这个奖是一个具体的证明，说明她具有创作才能。/r/n

A packaging engineer from Hamburg designed this so-called tango pack, using much less cardboard than usual. The cans are held firmly together by a narrow plastic trip./r/n 来自汉堡的一位包装设计师发明了Tango法。这种方法用极少量的纸板和一根塑料带就能将罐牢牢捆住。/r/n
He was tantalized by visions of power and wealth./r/n 他追求不到可望而不可即的权力和财富, 受尽了折磨./r/n Give the dog the bone don't tantalize him./r/n 把那块骨头给那条狗吧--别让它乾著急了./r/n
Her statement is tantamount to a confession of guilt./r/n 她的供述等於认罪./r/n The King's request was tantamount to a command./r/n 国王的要求就相当於命令./r/n
She regularly throws tantrums./r/n 她经常大发脾气./r/n
The wall of my living room was hung with a tapestry./r/n 我的起居室的墙上挂着一块壁毯。/r/n Such strange events are all part of life's rich tapestry./r/n 这些怪事都是丰富多彩的人生的一部分。/r/n
He was tardy for the meeting./r/n 那次开会他迟到了。/r/n His boss was dissatisfied with his tardy progress./r/n 老板对他缓慢的进度不满意。/r/n
The tariff at the hotel ranges from 20 dollars to 50 dollars a day for a single room./r/n 旅馆的单人房间的价钱每天从20美元到50美元不等。/r/n There is a very high tariff on jewelry./r/n 宝石的税率很高。/r/n
The firm's good name was badly tarnished by the scandal./r/n 这件丑事玷污了公司的好名声./r/n
Her tart reply offended me./r/n 她的刻薄的回答激怒了我。/r/n He ate some tart in the morning before going out./r/n 早上出门前，他吃了一些果酱点心。/r/n
There are blue tassels on my curtains./r/n 我的窗帘上有蓝色的流苏。/r/n

I know he looks a bit of a rough diamond in his tattered jeans, but apparently he does a lot of good work for local charities./r/n 我知道他穿着破烂的牛仔裤看上去有些浑金璞玉的样子，但清楚他是为当地的慈善事业做了许多有益的工作。/r/n The flag was tattered by a gale./r/n 旗子被大风刮成了碎布条。/r/n
They taunted him for being timid./r/n 他们讥笑他胆小。/r/n We shouldn't taunt others./r/n 我们不该嘲笑他人。/r/n

A brief high-pitched humming or buzzing sound, such as that made by a swiftly passing object or a taut vibrating string./r/n 尖啸声一种短暂尖锐的嗡嗡声或滋滋声，例如高速运动的物体和拉紧的震颤的线发出的声音/r/n Not taut, firm, or compact; slack./r/n 松弛的不紧、不严密或不坚实的；放松的/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．低级的，俗的而不值钱的
RECORD.lx: A woman regarded as gaudy or tawdry./r/n 娼妓被认为是媚俗或低俗的女人/r/n
A baby drinks milk from teats./r/n 婴儿用奶嘴喝牛奶。/r/n
He told me a tedious story./r/n 他给我讲了一个冗长乏味的故事。/r/n He is an exceedingly tedious fellow./r/n 他是一个非常令人生厌的家伙。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．充满，到处都是v．倾盆大雨
RECORD.lx: The rain teemed down for hours./r/n 大雨一直下了好几个小时。/r/n The river teems with all kinds of fish in summer./r/n 夏天这条河里各种各样的鱼多得很。/r/n
He had the temerity to call me a liar./r/n 他竟胆敢说我撒谎./r/n He had the temerity to ask for higher wages after only a day's work./r/n 只工作了一天，他就蛮不讲理地要求增加工资。/r/n
They are of congenial temper./r/n 他们的性情相投。/r/n She coaxed him out of his bad temper./r/n 她循循善诱地劝他改掉坏脾气。/r/n
Nigel is temperamental but he's very highly strung, you know./r/n 奈杰变化无常，但你知道他是很容易激动的。/r/n A physiological or temperamental peculiarity./r/n 特异性格一种心理的或脾气上的特异性/r/n
The patient had to practice temperance in eating and drinking./r/n 这个病人不得不节制饮食。/r/n I would like some temperance drinks./r/n 我想要一些没有酒精的饮料。/r/n
Be more temperate in your language, please./r/n 言词上请节制一点儿。/r/n Britain has a temperate climate./r/n 英国气候温和。/r/n
It was a marvelous night with a tempest to rouse the gods./r/n 真是个美妙的夜晚，暴风雨惊天动地。/r/n The scandal caused tempests in the newspaper./r/n 那件丑闻在报纸上引起阵阵风波。/r/n
Their ship was sailing dangerously in the tempestuous sea./r/n 他们的船在浪急风高的海上危险地航行着。/r/n
Your tempo is too slow./r/n 你演奏的速度太慢了./r/n All this was comparatively slow until, with the coming of science, the tempo was suddenly raised./r/n 所有这些发展都比较缓慢，直到出现了科学，其速度才突然加快。/r/n
The Pope has no temporal power in modern society./r/n 教皇在当代社会没有世俗方面的权利。/r/n The word is a temporal conjunction./r/n 该词是表示时间的连词。/r/n
The boss hired some temporary workers./r/n 老板雇佣了一些临时工。/r/n A temporary stop; a pause./r/n 停顿暂时的停顿；暂停/r/n
He is always temporize and be dislike by his classmate./r/n 他总是见风使舵，因而不受同学喜欢。/r/n
He was surrounded by temptations./r/n 他受到各种诱惑的包围。/r/n I should congratulate you that you resisted the temptation./r/n 我应向你祝贺，你抗住了这种引诱。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: adj．站得住脚的，无懈可击的
RECORD.lx: The lectureship is tenable for a period of three years./r/n 讲师这一职位任期三年./r/n How long is the post tenable for?/r/n 这个职位任期多长？/r/n
The eagle seized its prey in a tenacious grip./r/n 鹰将捕获物紧紧抓住./r/n He hold on to my arm with a tenacious grip./r/n 他紧紧抓住我的手臂不放。/r/n
Weeds tend to displace other plants./r/n 杂草越来越多，有取代其他植物之势。/r/n Does he tend to lose?/r/n 他常常输吗?/r/n
Such tendentious statements are likely to provoke strong opposition./r/n 这种有倾向性 的说法可能招致强烈的反对./r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．提出（希望对方接受的意见等）
RECORD.lx: This tender should be submitted by June 26th./r/n 此投标书应于六月二十六日前提交。/r/n Don't mention his divorce---it's a very tender subject./r/n 别提他离婚的事---那是个敏感话题。/r/n
One who believes in and follows the tenets of naturalism./r/n 自然主义者信仰和追随自然主义信条的人/r/n
I understood the tenor of their conversation but not the details./r/n 我听懂了他们谈话的大意，但没有听懂其中的细节。/r/n The tenor soloist is unable to appear tonight because of illness./r/n 男高音独唱者因病今晚不能演出./r/n
Could is used to make more tentative suggestions./r/n 可用以提出较试探性的建议。/r/n
Sheer, light, delicate, or tenuous./r/n 轻而薄的；薄弱的；虚无漂缈的/r/n
The rank, appointment, authority, or tenure of a general./r/n 将军的任职或任期一个将军的官衔、委任权力或保存权/r/n The tenure by which such an estate is held./r/n 不动产的终身保有权保有这种不动产的权利/r/n
The next train terminates here./r/n 这是下一班火车的终点站。/r/n Your contract has been terminated./r/n 你的合同已经被终止。/r/n

The special terminology understood among the members of a profession, discipline, or class but obscure to the general population; jargon./r/n 术语，行话在一个职业、学科或阶层的成员间能被理解的特殊术语，但对一般大众来说却晦涩难懂；专门术语/r/n In data base terminology, a single instance, for example, a set occurrence, a record occurrence./r/n 在数据库术语中，一个单一实例，例如，一组具体值，一个记录的具体值。/r/n

The police reasoned out that if the criminal had left by the midday train, it would be easy to pick him up at the terminus./r/n 警察部门推断，如果那个罪犯是乘中午列车离开的，那就容易在终点站把他捉住。/r/n The police reasoned out that if the men had left by the midday train, it would be easy to pick them up at the terminus./r/n 警察推断，如果那些人是乘那趟日班车走的，那么在终点站抓住他们就不费事。/r/n
In China hill farmers grow rice on terraces./r/n 在中国，山区农民在梯田上种水稻。/r/n He walked out onto the terrace./r/n 他漫步走到外面的平台上。/r/n
The commander made a detailed study of the terrain./r/n 司令员对地形作了仔细研究。/r/n Bumped along slowly over the rocky terrain./r/n 在多石地带缓慢地颠簸前进/r/n
Although they can swim, the polar bears are terrestrial animals./r/n 北极熊虽然会游泳，但也是陆栖动物。/r/n A terrestrial globe is one that represents the earth./r/n 地球仪是表现地球的器具。/r/n
A terse, witty, instructive saying; a maxim./r/n 格言，箴言，警句简洁、机智、有教导性的话；警句/r/n
Her solicitor drew up her last will and testament./r/n 她的律师拟就了她的遗嘱。/r/n This aircraft's safety record is an impressive testament to its designers' skill./r/n 这种飞机的飞行安全记录令人印象深刻，证明了该机种设计师本领非凡。/r/n
All kinds of human experience testify to the close link between love and fear./r/n 人类的种种经验都证明了爱与怕之间的紧密联系。/r/n He agreed to testify on behalf of the accused man./r/n 他同意为被告作证。/r/n

She sent a testimonial from her former employer when applying for the post./r/n 她申请那职位时寄去了前雇主的推荐书./r/n The boy look for a job have testimonial from his teacher and former employer./r/n 那个找工作的小伙子有他的老师和以前的雇主的推荐信。/r/n
Several men were called for testimony./r/n 好几个人被传来作证。/r/n The witness is giving false testimony./r/n 那个证人在作伪证。/r/n
He studied Shakespeare's texts./r/n 他学习了莎士比亚的原作。/r/n The book contains scandalous text./r/n 该书含有诽谤性的内容。/r/n
This kind of cloth has a close texture./r/n 这种布质地很紧密。/r/n The cake has a nice light texture./r/n 这蛋糕松软可口。/r/n

The family lived in a thatched cottage before liberation./r/n 解放前，他们一家住在茅屋里。/r/n "Are you sure it was Anderson? ""Of course I'm sure. With his thatch of red hair there's no mistaking him."/r/n "你敢肯定那是安德森吗？""当然，我敢肯定，就凭那一头蓬乱的红头发就很容易把他辨别出来。"/r/n
Just give me a minute to thaw out in front of the fire, then we can talk./r/n 先让我烤烤火暖和一下，然后我们开始谈话。/r/n The ground has thawed out./r/n 地上的冰雪已经融化了。/r/n
She works in a theatrical company./r/n 她在剧团工作。/r/n The expert is writing a theatrical review./r/n 专家正在写戏剧评论。/r/n
He believes in theology./r/n 他信仰宗教。/r/n In the Middle Ages, philosophy and theology were inextricable./r/n 在中世纪, 哲学与神学是不分的./r/n

Internal and external use of water as a therapeutic treatment for all forms of disease./r/n 水疗法水的外用和内服，作为各种病症的治疗方法/r/n The act or practice of opening a vein by incision or puncture to remove blood as a therapeutic treatment./r/n 静脉切开术，放血术切割静脉或穿孔来放血的行为或实践，作为一种医学治疗/r/n
She was in therapy./r/n 她正在接受治疗。/r/n The local or general use of low temperatures in medical therapy./r/n 冷疗法一种在医疗中局部或全部使用低温的方法/r/n
The fox hid in the thicket where the dog could not reach it./r/n 狐狸躲在猎狗抓不到它的灌木丛中。/r/n A fox dart out of the midst of the thicket./r/n 一只狐狸从灌木丛中窜了出来。/r/n
Her beauty held him in thrall./r/n 她的美貌征服了他。/r/n
As he swam, he thrashed the water with his hand./r/n 他游泳时用手拍打水。/r/n Let's thrash the matter over before putting it on the agenda./r/n 我们先把这件事仔细研究一下，再把它列入议事日程。/r/n
Pride may lurk under a threadbare cloak./r/n 骄傲可能会潜藏在穿旧的斗篷下。/r/n
Her mother is a thrifty housewife./r/n 她妈妈是一个节俭的主妇。/r/n Only very thrifty children manage to fill up a money-box./r/n 只有非常节俭的儿童才会设法填满一个储蓄罐。/r/n
A patient throng was waiting in silence./r/n 一大群人耐心地静候着。/r/n Passengers thronged the station waiting for their trains./r/n 乘客们拥挤在火车站上等候乘车。/r/n
We thrust our way through the crowd./r/n 我们用力挤过人群。/r/n The enemy made a thrust against our troop./r/n 敌人向我军发动了袭击。/r/n
Our plan for a football match was thwarted by the heavy rain./r/n 我们的足球比赛计划因大雨而受阻。/r/n So as to thwart, obstruct, or oppose; perversely./r/n 以便对抗，阻碍，或反对地；任性地/r/n

The table top suddenly tilted and all the plates and glasses crashed onto the floor./r/n 桌面突然翘起，所有的盘子和玻璃制品都滑落到地板上打碎了。/r/n The latter, as the name suggests, are used to record any changes in the tilt of the land./r/n 后者，顾名思义，是用来记录任何土地斜度的变化。/r/n
"Timber" the man shouted as the tree was about to fall./r/n 树快要倒下时，那个人喊道“避开！”。/r/n Seasoned timber does not warp./r/n 经干燥处理的木材不会翘曲。/r/n
Thanks to your timely intervention./r/n 多亏你及时调停。/r/n What we expected is nothing less than a timely payment./r/n 及时付款正是我们所盼望的。/r/n

The slaves toiled up the hill pulling the heavy blocks./r/n 那些奴隶艰难地把沉重的石块拖上山。/r/n More important, a host of unemployed citizens face the grim problem of existence, and an equal and great number toil with little return./r/n 更重要的是，大批失业公民正面临严峻的生存问题，还有大批公民正以艰辛的劳动换取微薄的报酬。/r/n
Sea air has a tonic quality./r/n 海洋的空气有益于增进健康。/r/n Praise can be a fine tonic./r/n 赞美有时真让人感到振奋。/r/n
The entire village was obliterated by the tornado./r/n 整个村庄被龙卷风摧毁了./r/n The tornado cut a swath through the town./r/n 龙卷风袭击该镇，留下破坏的痕迹。/r/n
She suffered the tortures of toothaches./r/n 她因牙痛而痛苦。/r/n He tortured his prisoners./r/n 他拷打犯人。/r/n

She's so touchy about being able to look after herself that your offer of help may easily be taken amiss./r/n 她对于自己的自理能力很敏感，你要是主动帮助她，她可能容易见怪。/r/n The mines are touchy as hell./r/n 地雷非常灵敏，一有触动便会爆炸。/r/n

RECORD.meaning: n．比赛，（旧时）骑士比武大会
RECORD.lx: He will take part in a chess tournament next week./r/n 下星期，他将要参加一场国际象棋比赛。/r/n I won the tennis tournament./r/n 我赢了那场网球比赛。/r/n
I told him tout court that his services were not required./r/n 我简单地告诉他不需要他的帮助。/r/n A ticket tout offered me a two pound ticket for ten pounds./r/n 票贩子索价十镑向我兜售原价两镑的票子。/r/n
The factory had been sending out toxic fumes./r/n 这家工厂一直在排放有毒的废气。/r/n The quality or condition of being toxic or destructive to the liver./r/n 肝中毒对肝有毒的或毁灭性的性质或状况/r/n

The cake on analysis was found to contain traces of toxin./r/n 经分析发现蛋糕里含有微量的毒素。/r/n A biotechnology company is developing a range of new pesticide based on naturally occur toxin./r/n 一家生物工艺开发公司正在根据自然滋生毒素的原理研制新型农药系列产品。/r/n
My daughter has many toys./r/n 我女儿有很多玩具。/r/n While she was talking to me, she toyed with a pencil./r/n 她一边和我说话，一边摆弄着一支铅笔。/r/n
Serving to pull or draw; exerting traction./r/n 牵引的用来拉或拽的；产生牵引力的/r/n The act of pulling loads; traction./r/n 拖拽拖动装载物的行为；牵引/r/n

He was surprised to discover that his best friend had turned traitor./r/n 他惊讶地发现他最好的朋友竟成了叛徒。/r/n The angry crowd shouted,"Knock the traitor on the head. He is not fit to live."/r/n 愤怒的群众嚷道，“杀掉这个卖国贼，他该死。/r/n
We went for a tramp over the hill./r/n 我们徒步翻过了山头/r/n We missed the bus and met some tramps./r/n 我们错过了公共汽车，因此不得不步行。/r/n
Don't trample on the grass./r/n 不要践踏草地。/r/n We will not allow ourselves to be trampled upon./r/n 我们决不容许自己被人轻视。/r/n
Both my husband and I love the tranquil life in the country./r/n 我丈夫和我都喜欢乡村的宁静生活。/r/n A calm or tranquil state of mind; self-possession./r/n 冷静，沉着头脑镇定或沉着的状态；自我克制/r/n
The transaction between them was dismissed./r/n 他们之间的交易告吹了。/r/n What do you want to do after you have concluded this transaction?/r/n 这笔生意成交之后你想做什么？/r/n
She far transcends the others in beauty and intelligence./r/n 她才貌出众./r/n

She jotted down a few notes, and later transcribed them into an exercise book./r/n 她草草做了些笔记, 然後誊写在练习本上./r/n She jot down a few note, and later transcribe them into an exercise book./r/n 她草草做了些笔记，然后誊写在练习本上。/r/n
Success and wealth transformed his character./r/n 成功和财富改变了他的性格。/r/n The magician transformed the frog into a princess./r/n 魔术师把青蛙变成了公主。/r/n
His behavior transgressed the moral rules of the social conduct./r/n 他的行为违背了社会行为的道德准则。/r/n
Life is transient./r/n 人生如朝露。/r/n Her feeling of depression was transient./r/n 她那抑郁的心情一会儿就过去了。/r/n
We hope there will be a peaceful transition to the new system./r/n 我们希望能够和平过渡到新的制度。/r/n A transition or change, as to a spiritual existence at death./r/n 过渡过渡或变化，如人死后向精神存在的过渡/r/n
She wears a translucent silk gown./r/n 她穿着半透明丝质长袍。/r/n The lavatory windows are made of translucent glass./r/n 厕所窗户是用半透明玻璃做的。/r/n
This infection is transmitted by mosquitoes./r/n 这种传染病是由蚊子传染的。/r/n The tension soon transmitted itself to all the members of the crowd./r/n 这种紧张情绪很快感染了人群中所有的人。/r/n
Plain glass is transparent./r/n 普通的白玻璃是透明的。/r/n The meaning of this passage seems quite transparent./r/n 这一段的意思看来是相当清楚的。/r/n
Sue was troubled to see trash everywhere./r/n 苏看到到处是垃圾很苦恼。/r/n Many things pollute water, such as tires, trash, and plastic bags./r/n 很多东西使水污染，例如轮胎、垃圾和塑胶袋。/r/n
A trauma center; a trauma team./r/n 外伤治疗中心；外伤治疗小组/r/n A bodily injury, irritation, or trauma./r/n 身体的损伤，发炎或损伤/r/n
They traversed the valley on foot./r/n 他们徒步走过这座山谷。/r/n Searching lights traversed the sky./r/n 探照灯扫过天空。/r/n

They have committed treason against the state./r/n 他们已犯了叛国罪。/r/n English politician and historian who was falsely accused of treason and banished(1667). While in France he wrote his major work, The History of the Rebellion and Civil Wars in England(1702-1704)./r/n 克拉伦登英国政治家和历史学家，被错判叛国罪并流放（1667年）。在法国写出他的重要著作英国叛乱和内战史（1702－1704年）/r/n
The treatise he wrote is excellent./r/n 他写的论文很优秀。/r/n Our professor asked him to write a treatise on the subject./r/n 我们的教授要求他就这个课题写篇论文。/r/n

Steve and Jack gave a talk about their trek across the Polar ice cap. It was very interesting but it made my hair stand on end just to hear about the dangers they faced./r/n 史蒂夫和杰克讲述了他们在极地冰盖的一段艰苦跋涉，故事津津有味，只是听到他们遇到种种险情时，我吓得很。/r/n It took the climber a month to trek to the foot of the mountain before they even started their climb./r/n 登山者还未开始爬山，光是艰苦地跋涉到山脚下就花了1个月时间。/r/n
He's a tremendous talker./r/n 他是一个非常健谈的人。/r/n We got a tremendous surprise when she arrived./r/n 她的到来使我们大吃一惊。/r/n
Grandfather was in the trenches during the First War./r/n 在第一次世界大战中，我祖父驻守在法国北部前线。/r/n I forgot to dig a trench around the tent./r/n 我忘了在帐篷四周挖一条沟。/r/n
The prices of houses are trending upwards./r/n 房价趋于上涨。/r/n The youth like to follow the latest trends in fashion./r/n 年轻人喜好追求最新的流行款式。/r/n
Are you familiar with the laws relating to trespass?/r/n 你熟悉关于侵入私人领地的法律吗？/r/n One who is guilty of a trespass or sin; a sinner./r/n 罪人犯有过失和罪过的人；罪人/r/n
That child is a trial to his parents./r/n 那个孩子是他的父母的一块心病。/r/n The murder trial lasted six weeks./r/n 法庭对这一谋杀案的审理为时六周。/r/n
The tribunal has authority to settle certain types of dispute./r/n 裁判所有权解决某些纠纷。/r/n The tribunal will convene tomorrow./r/n 法庭将于明日开庭。/r/n
There was one street apart from a tributary road near the end of the village./r/n 除了村子尽头的岔道外，还有一条大路。/r/n A tributary colony./r/n 进贡的殖民地/r/n
Many Greek cities had to send yearly tribute to Athens./r/n 许多希腊城市不得不每年向雅典进贡。/r/n The musician gave full tribute to his former teacher./r/n 这位音乐家盛赞了他过去的老师。/r/n
The stream is reduced to a mere trickle in summer./r/n 夏天那条小河的水量减少，成了涓涓溪流。/r/n She trickles oil into the mixture./r/n 她把油一点点地注入混合物中。/r/n
He told her not to pester him with trifles./r/n 他告诉她别拿些琐事来烦他。/r/n We trifled too long at the fair./r/n 我们在集市上逛得太久了。/r/n
A pulse to gate the output of a core memory sense amplifier into a trigger in a register./r/n 将磁心存储器读出放大器的输出选通到寄存器的触发器中的一种脉冲。/r/n I pulled the trigger and the gun went off./r/n 我一扣扳机, 枪就响了./r/n
My daughter has a trim figure./r/n 我女儿身材匀称。/r/n We have to trim our cost if we want to increase our profit./r/n 我们如果想增加利润，就必须削减开支。/r/n
Don't be angry over such trivial matters./r/n 别为这些琐事生气。/r/n Empty, foolish, or trivial talk; idle chatter./r/n 闲聊空洞、愚蠢或琐碎的谈话；闲聊/r/n
The troupe is now on the road./r/n 剧团正在巡回演出。/r/n Charlie Chaplin went to the United States for the just time in1910 as a part of a troupe./r/n 查尔斯·卓别麟1910年作为一个演员随一个戏班第一次到了美国。/r/n
The two sides called a truce to avoid further bloodshed./r/n 双方宣布停战以避免再有伤亡。/r/n He was in favour of the declaration of a truce./r/n 他赞成宣布停战./r/n
He cut off the branches from the trunk./r/n 他把树干上的小分枝都剪掉。/r/n The morning glory climbs the trunk with its tendril./r/n 牵牛花用卷须攀着树干。/r/n
It's time for my dip in the tub./r/n 我该洗澡了。/r/n A large vessel, such as a tub, cistern, or barrel, used to hold or store liquids./r/n 大桶；大盆；缸一种大容器，如大盆、水箱或大桶，用来装或贮存液体/r/n
She tried to calm her turbulent thoughts./r/n 她试图平息一下紊乱的思绪。/r/n The sea is too turbulent for sailing./r/n 海浪太大，不宜航行。/r/n
I couldn't think; my mind was in a complete turmoil./r/n 我无法思考，我的脑子里一片混乱。/r/n The London Stock Exchange is in turmoil today./r/n 今天伦敦证券市场一片混乱。/r/n
Corduroy dresses sizes8-16 in white, yellow, red, turquoise, black per100$1,845./r/n 条绒上衣尺码8至16号为白，黄，红，青绿及黑色，每100件价格为1，845美元。/r/n
She heard a twig snap./r/n 她听到一根细树枝的断裂声。/r/n I kept dropping hints but he still didn't twig./r/n 我一直不停地暗示他，但他还是不懂。/r/n
She works for a tyrannical new boss./r/n 她在一个专横的新上司手下工作。/r/n He has a tyrannical reign on his empire./r/n 他是个残暴的皇帝。/r/n
The emperor was a tyrant./r/n 那皇帝是个暴君。/r/n This ruler is a pitiless tyrant./r/n 这个统治者是一个冷酷的暴君。/r/n
The sun is the ultimate source of energy./r/n 太阳是能量的最基本来源。/r/n Our ultimate objective is the removal of all nuclear weapons./r/n 我们的最终目标是消除所有核武器。/r/n
She felt her works are meaningful when she saw the unaffected delight of the children./r/n 当她看到孩子们自然流露出的喜悦时，她感到自己的工作很有意义。/r/n These rights are unaffected by the new laws./r/n 这些权利不受新法规的影响。/r/n

The committee were unanimous that the application should be turned down./r/n 委员会一致同意拒绝这项申请。/r/n Politicians from all parties were completely unanimous in condemning his action./r/n 所有党派的政治家们都一致谴责他的行为。/r/n

An investigation carried out ostensibly to uncover subversive activities but actually used to harass and undermine those with differing views./r/n 政治迫害表面上是开展揭露颠覆的活动，但实际上用于扰乱和削弱持不同看法的人的调查/r/n Beware of the fifth column. They often infiltrate into key positions and seek to undermine the body politic from within./r/n 要提防隐蔽的敌人，他们经常渗透到关键岗位企图从内部破坏国家政体。/r/n
Military intervention is highly undesirable./r/n 军事干涉极不相宜./r/n The drug has no undesirable side-effects./r/n 这种药没有什麽不良的副作用./r/n
A large or ungainly automobile./r/n 大汽车巨大的或笨拙的汽车/r/n An ungainly gesture./r/n 不雅的姿势。/r/n
My knitting has unravelled./r/n 我编织的东西散开了./r/n
An untoward incident./r/n 一起麻烦的事件/r/n Indeed, anything untoward was now kept from James./r/n 的确，现在一切不顺心的事都小心瞒着詹姆士。/r/n
The President swore to uphold the constitution./r/n 总统宣誓维护宪法。/r/n The judge upheld the lower court's decision./r/n 法官维持初级法院的判决。/r/n

I have to buy some kitchen utensils before starting cooking./r/n 开始做饭前，我还得去买些厨房用具。/r/n A hollow utensil, such as a cup, vase, or pitcher, used as a container, especially for liquids./r/n 容器一种空的容器，比如杯子、瓶子或罐子，用来装液体的一种器皿/r/n

It is hoped that in her new job her talents will be better utilized than before./r/n 希望在新的工作岗位上，她的才干能够得到比以往更好的发挥。/r/n How can we utilize his knowledge and skill to our advantage?/r/n 我们如何来利用他的知识和技术才对我们有利？/r/n
We still have vacancies for secretaries but other positions have been filled./r/n 我们的秘书名额尚有空缺，但其他职位都满了。/r/n Fill a job vacancy./r/n 填补工作的空缺/r/n
He had a vaccination against rabies./r/n 他做了疫苗注射以预防狂犬病。/r/n Induced by vaccination./r/n 因种痘引起的/r/n
This vaccine will give you immunity for two years./r/n 接种这种疫苗可有两年免疫力。/r/n The search for a new vaccine took priority over all other medical research./r/n 在各种医药研究中, 应首先解决寻找新疫苗的问题./r/n
Have you turned off the water valve?/r/n 你关掉水阀了吗？/r/n We need an eye bolt to fit this valve./r/n 我们需要一个有眼螺栓来固定这个阀门。/r/n
She married the rich man out of vanity./r/n 她出于虚荣心而嫁给了那个富人。/r/n Vanity is his Achilles' heel./r/n 虚荣自负是他的致命伤./r/n
Our army has vanquished the enemy./r/n 我们的军队已经彻底击败了敌人。/r/n
We are at variance about our lodger./r/n 我们在对待房客的问题上意见不一。/r/n This theory is at variance with the known facts./r/n 这种理论与已知事实不符。/r/n
The table has been varnished./r/n 桌子上已经涂过清漆了。/r/n The hot plate may spoil the varnish on the table./r/n 这只热盘子会损坏桌面的光泽。/r/n
The innermost layer of the cortex that forms a sheath around the vascular tissue of roots and some stems./r/n 内皮层皮层的最内层，在根、茎的导管组织周围形成一道叶鞘（茎衣）/r/n
In medieval times, poets often called the sky "the vault of heaven"./r/n 在中世纪时期，诗人常把天空叫作“苍穹”。/r/n Our school won first place for the pole vault./r/n 我们学校赢得了撑杆跳第一名。/r/n
The colorful vegetation of this tropical forest amazed the professor./r/n 这片热带森林色彩纷呈的植被使教授惊讶。/r/n The path leads to a hill bare of vegetation./r/n 这条小道通向一座没有草木的小山。/r/n
They expressed a vehement protest./r/n 他们表达了强烈的抗议。/r/n She made a vehement attack on the government's policies./r/n 她强烈谴责政府的政策。/r/n
"Is this your vehicle, sir?" asked the policeman./r/n “这是您的车吗，先生？” 警察问道。/r/n Television has become an important vehicle for spreading political ideas./r/n 电视已成为传播政治思想的重要媒介。/r/n
Gazelles can move with astonishing velocity./r/n 羚羊跑起来速度惊人。/r/n The car was moving at such a velocity!/r/n 那辆汽车的速度简直太快了！/r/n
The vendor signs a contract with the purchaser./r/n 卖方须与买方签订契约./r/n The list contain name of the vendor we do business with./r/n 这个名单上有与我们有业务往来的卖主的名字。/r/n
He took vengeance on the murderer./r/n 他向谋杀者报了仇。/r/n He cried to heaven for vengeance./r/n 他哭求老天为他雪耻。/r/n

I look down on man who vents his anger on his family after having a bad day at work./r/n 我瞧不起那些工作不顺心就拿家里人出气 的男人。/r/n When I get frustrated and angry, I have to vent my spleen on someone./r/n 我受尽挫折，怒火冲天时，禁不住想找谁发一顿脾气。/r/n
They are ventilating the sap of a coal mine./r/n 他们正在使煤矿坑道通风。/r/n My office is well ventilated./r/n 我的办公室通风良好。/r/n
The jury announced their verdict./r/n 陪审团做出了裁决。/r/n They have had the verdict of the electors./r/n 他们已经知道了选举人的决定。/r/n
The computer verified whether the data was loaded correctly./r/n 计算机查实数据输入是否正确。/r/n The truth verified the allegations./r/n 事实证明了这些说法。/r/n
This play was written in verse./r/n 这个剧本是用诗体写成的。/r/n There are four verses in each poem./r/n 每首诗有四个诗节。/r/n
Adequately versed in a subject./r/n 精通的在某一学科上很精通的/r/n He is well versed in the science of optics./r/n 他精通光学。/r/n

Situated at the vertex or highest point; directly overhead./r/n 顶点的在顶点或者最高点的；头的正上方的/r/n The perpendicular distance from the base of a geometric figure to the opposite vertex, parallel side, or parallel surface./r/n 顶垂线，高线从一个几何形体的底边到相对的顶点、平行边或平行面的垂直距离/r/n
The northern face of the mountain is almost vertical./r/n 这座山向北的一面几乎是垂直的。/r/n The vertical line meets the horizontal one here./r/n 垂直线与水平线在此相交./r/n
There are some fishing vessels in the harbor./r/n 港湾里有许多渔船。/r/n We hove the vessel to./r/n 我们把船停住了./r/n
Japan exercised her veto to block the resolution./r/n 日本使用了否决权反对该项决议。/r/n The president last week vetoed the tax cut./r/n 总统上个星期否决了减税法案。/r/n
All the ships in the vicinity of the crash joined in the search for survivors./r/n 撞船事故发生地区的所有船只都参加了搜寻幸存者的工作。/r/n In this general vicinity; around here./r/n 在这一带在这里附近；在这周围/r/n
He gave the dog a vicious blow with his stick./r/n 他用手杖恶狠狠地打了那条狗一顿。/r/n Your vicious dog is menacing my cat!/r/n 你那条恶狗对我家的猫太凶了！/r/n
The police said that the public should be vigilant./r/n 警方说公众应保持警惕。/r/n I am afraid under the vigilant eyes of the examiner./r/n 在检察员警惕的目光下，我害怕了。/r/n
Subsequent events vindicatedhis suspicions./r/n 後来的事实表明他的怀疑有道理./r/n The report fully vindicated the unions./r/n 这份报告充分说明工会是正确的./r/n
A virulent form of cancer./r/n 癌症的一种致命形式/r/n
We should be watchful of computer viruses./r/n 我们应该警惕计算机病毒。/r/n Scientists have isolated the virus causing the epidemic./r/n 科学家们已分离出引起这种流行病的病毒。/r/n
Sticky and viscous./r/n 粘性的；胶粘的/r/n The phenomenon whereby a viscous substance solidifies under pressure./r/n 膨胀凝固性一种粘性物质在压力下变成凝固的现象/r/n
His novels were in vogue ten years ago./r/n 他的小说十年前风靡一时。/r/n Short hair came back into vogue./r/n 短发又开始流行起来了。/r/n
Petrol is volatile./r/n 汽油容易挥发。/r/n The volatile political situation in Singapore upset the people./r/n 动荡不定的新加坡政局使人民感到不安。/r/n
Her taste in clothing is rather vulgar./r/n 她穿着相当俗气。/r/n Putting food into one's mouth with a knife is considered vulgar in England./r/n 在英国，用刀把食物送进嘴里被认为是粗鲁的行为。/r/n
The potato is vulnerable to several pests./r/n 马铃薯易受几种害虫的侵害./r/n She is very young and vulnerable to temptation/fraud./r/n 她很年轻，易受诱惑／易受骗上当。/r/n
There's no bridge; we'll have to wade across (the stream)./r/n 没有桥, 我们得渡过（小河）去./r/n We had to wade through the river to the opposite bank./r/n 我们只好涉水过河到对岸./r/n

RECORD.meaning: v．（狗尾巴等）摆动 n．诙谐幽默者
RECORD.lx: The news set tongues wagging./r/n 那则消息使人们议论纷纷。/r/n The dog wagged its tail./r/n 狗摇了摇尾巴。/r/n
The wind wailed in the forest all night./r/n 风在林子里彻夜呼啸。/r/n The exhausted mother smiled at the wail of her newborn baby./r/n 听到新生儿的哭叫声，倦极了的母亲笑了。/r/n
The child looked pale and wan./r/n 这孩子看上去脸色不好，一副有病的样子。/r/n A wan expression./r/n 惨淡的表情/r/n
By now the power of the Roman Empire was on the wane./r/n 到这时，罗马帝国已日益衰败。/r/n The moon waxes and wanes every month./r/n 月亮每个月都有盈亏。/r/n
What are the duties of a traffic warden?/r/n 街道停车管理员的职责是什麽?/r/n It's interesting that the words guardian and warden have a common origin./r/n 有趣的是“guardian”与“warden”同出一源。/r/n
He put all his clothes in the big wardrobe./r/n 他把所有的衣服都放在大衣柜里。/r/n You'd have more room in your wardrobe if you turfed out all your old clothes./r/n 你把所有的旧衣服都处理掉, 衣柜里地方就大了./r/n
The naval warfare ended in our victory./r/n 这次海战以我们的胜利而告终。/r/n Prepared for use or action, especially in warfare./r/n 有战斗力的，备战的为使用或行动准备的，尤指在战争中/r/n
That does not warrant you in doing so./r/n 那并不表明你有理由这样做。/r/n You shouldn't arrest him without warrant./r/n 你不能毫无根据地逮捕他。/r/n
The disaster caused him to waver in his faith./r/n 这件灾难使他对信仰发生了动摇。/r/n While we were wavering, somebody else bought the house./r/n 就在我们犹豫不决的时候, 别人把那所房子买下了./r/n
I heard weird shrieks in the darkness./r/n 我在黑暗中听到奇怪的尖叫声。/r/n I found some of her poems a bit weird./r/n 我觉得她的诗有点怪。/r/n
Some metals weld better than others./r/n 有些金属容易焊，有的不容易焊。/r/n The car has had a new wing welded on./r/n 这辆汽车焊接了一个新的翼子板。/r/n
The children were whispering in the corner./r/n 孩子们正在角落里低声耳语。/r/n The wind was whispering in the roof./r/n 屋顶上风声飒飒。/r/n
The wholesale prices of these shirts are 45 dollars./r/n 这些衬衫的批发价是45美元。/r/n He buys the materials wholesale./r/n 他成批地购买原材料。/r/n
She wields a lot of influence./r/n 她是个很有影响力的人。/r/n Easily wielded or managed./r/n 易使用的，易管理的/r/n
Willowes are common in this city./r/n 柳树在这个城市很常见。/r/n Bring up in town, the boy find it difficult to separate a poplar from a willow./r/n 那男孩是在城里长大的，所以觉得很难区别杨树和柳树。/r/n
I went home along a winding mountain path./r/n 我沿着弯曲的山路回家。/r/n You operate the mechanism by winding this handle./r/n 操纵这台机器要转动这个把手./r/n
He withdrew his horse from the race./r/n 他让他的马退出了比赛。/r/n The troops have been withdrawn from the danger area./r/n 部队已经撤出危险地带。/r/n
She withdrew all her savings and left the country./r/n 她把全部存款取出後离开了那个国家./r/n The troops have been withdrawn from the danger area./r/n 部队已经撤出危险地带。/r/n
The cold withered the leaves./r/n 严寒使树叶凋落。/r/n The grapes withered on the vine./r/n 葡萄藤上的葡萄都干瘪了。/r/n
Woe betide anyone who arrives late!/r/n 谁迟到谁倒霉！/r/n He told her all his woes./r/n 他把自己的辛酸事都告诉她了。/r/n
I fear his wrath more than anything./r/n 我最害怕他发怒。/r/n "He was... stirred by righteous wrath? (John Galsworthy)./r/n "他被…激起极大的愤怒"（约翰·高尔斯渥西）/r/n
Mist wreathed the hilltops./r/n 山顶上薄雾环绕。/r/n The local people used to wreathe the guest's head in leaves./r/n 当地人过去常把树叶缠在宾客的头上。/r/n
He closed the door so hard that he wrenched the handle off./r/n 他关门用力过猛，连门把手都拧了下来。/r/n Separation from her children was a terrible wrench./r/n 同她的孩子们分别是一项很大的痛苦。/r/n
She's beginning to get wrinkles round her eyes./r/n 她的眼角开始有皱纹了。/r/n He wrinkled up his forehead in perplexity./r/n 他困惑地皱起了眉头。/r/n
Huge waves drove the yacht onto the rocks./r/n 巨浪把游艇卷到岩石上。/r/n Will you crew for me on my yacht?/r/n 你愿意在我的快艇上当水手吗?/r/n
We stayed up yarning until midnight./r/n 我们讲故事一直讲到半夜才睡。/r/n The beggar spun a long yarn about his misfortunes./r/n 那个乞丐编造了一大篇自己如何遭遇不幸的故事。/r/n
He yearned to return to his native land./r/n 他渴望回到故乡。/r/n He yearned for a sight of the old, familiar faces./r/n 他渴望一见那些熟悉的老面孔。/r/n
Yeast must be used in producing wine./r/n 制酒时必须使用酵母菌。/r/n Made light and high by yeast or other leaven./r/n 发酵的用酵母或其它发酵剂使…轻而高/r/n
His army never came under the yoke of invaders./r/n 他的军队从来不向侵略者屈服。/r/n The farmer was yoking his oxen to a plough./r/n 农夫正在用轭把牛套到犁上。/r/n
The zealous demonstrators were ignored by the media./r/n 热情的示威游行者被新闻媒介忽视了。/r/n The doctors were zealous in their efforts to ensure the survival of premature babies./r/n 医生们在努力保证早产婴儿成活方面热情很高。/r/n
The element of risk gave (an) added zest to the adventure./r/n 这种冒险成分更给探险活动平添几分乐趣./r/n Her zest for life is as great as ever./r/n 她对生活的极大乐趣一如既往./r/n
